original: @68b / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @68b / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya aa nan ta mu kha ba ri sho dha na nir de shong ri brta n'a ma ma h'a ya na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya aa nan ta mu kha ba ri sho dha na nir de shong ri brta n'a ma ma h'a ya na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-anantamukhapariśodhanirdeśa-śrīmālādevī-tantra-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa sgo mtha' yas pa rnam par sbyong ba bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa sgo mtha' yas pa rnam par sbyong ba bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: Ārya-anantamukhapariśodhanirdeśa-śrīmālādevī-tantra-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ga lan da ka gnas pa na dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ga lan da ka gnas pa na dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandaka-nivāpa in the Veṇuvana, together with a great assembly of monks and with innumerable, countless Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas gathered from various Buddha-fields, all of whom were impeded by only one birth.

original: yang de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya stong du mas bskor cing mdun gyis bltas nas chos ston to //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya stong du mas bskor cing mdun gyis bltas nas chos ston to //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was teaching the Dharma, surrounded by a retinue of hundreds of thousands.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas zhes bya ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus te 'dug par gyur pa de stan @69a *//
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas zhes bya ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus te 'dug par gyur pa de stan @69a *//
translated: Then, the bodhisattva named Anantavyūha, who was present in the assembly,

original: las langs te /🔽chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha ngas la btsugs te /
analyzed: las langs te / chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha ngas la btsugs te /
translated: rose from his seat,🔽put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: With palms joined, he bowed toward the Blessed One

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: gal te zhus nas zhu ba lung bstan pa'i slad du //
analyzed: gal te zhus nas zhu ba lung bstan pa'i slad du //
translated: “If I may ask a question and receive an answer,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas bdag la skabs phye na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas bdag la skabs phye na /
translated: Blessed One, if the Thus-Gone One would grant me the opportunity,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig zhu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig zhu'o //
translated: I would like to ask a few questions of the Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Anantavyūha, “Anantavyūha, the thus-gone ones teach the Dharma in accordance with the world.🔽

original: bkod pa mtha' yas khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas dris pa de dang de'i lung bstan pas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas dris pa de dang de'i lung bstan pas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Anantavyūha, “Anantavyūha, ask whatever you wish of the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, and I will satisfy your wishes by answering your questions.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The bodhisattva Anantavyūha then said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes tshad ma mchis pa dang / dpag tu ma mchis pa dag la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / go cha chen po bgos pa rnams kyi slad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes tshad ma mchis pa dang / dpag tu ma mchis pa dag la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / go cha chen po bgos pa rnams kyi slad du /
translated: for the sake of the bodhisattva great beings who have set out for boundless and limitless wisdom and who are clad in great armor,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig yongs su zhu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig yongs su zhu'o //
translated: I will ask the Thus-Gone One a few questions.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: @69b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa chen po'i sa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / don mtha' yas pa shes pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / rnam par nges pa'i ye shes chen po la yang dag par brtsams pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: @69b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa chen po'i sa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / don mtha' yas pa shes pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / rnam par nges pa'i ye shes chen po la yang dag par brtsams pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang /
translated: for the sake of those bodhisattva great beings who have set out on the ground of great skill in means, who have set out on the skill in means that knows limitless meanings, who have set out on the great ascertainment of wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi lam la yang dag par zhugs pa de lta bu de dag gi slad du /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yang dag par zhugs pa de lta bu de dag gi slad du /
translated: and who have set out on the path to awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu'o //
translated: I ask the Thus-Gone One about this.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la phan par nye bar bsgrub pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / sems dpe ma mchis pa rnams dang / chos thams cad rnam par dag par shes pa'i don la sems pa rnams dang thabs la mkhas pa'i shes pa chen pos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa rnams dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la phan par nye bar bsgrub pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / sems dpe ma mchis pa rnams dang / chos thams cad rnam par dag par shes pa'i don la sems pa rnams dang thabs la mkhas pa'i shes pa chen pos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa rnams dang /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are dedicated to accomplishing the welfare of all beings,🔽the bodhisattvas who are without compare,🔽those who contemplate the meaning of the knowledge of the purity of all phenomena, those who discern with the great knowledge of skill in means,🔽those who wish to attain the skill in means of ascertaining the immeasurable meaning,

original: don tshad ma mchis pa rnam par nges pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rjes su thob par 'tshal ba rnams dang / seng ge'i khri chen po mngon par 'tshal pa rnams dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i seng ge'i khri gdan la mngon par mchis pa rnams dang /
analyzed: don tshad ma mchis pa rnam par nges pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rjes su thob par 'tshal ba rnams dang / seng ge'i khri chen po mngon par 'tshal pa rnams dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i seng ge'i khri gdan la mngon par mchis pa rnams dang /
translated: those who wish for the great lion throne, those who are seated on the lion throne of omniscience,

original: rnam par gnon pa chen po des par brtsams pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs la mkhas pa rnams dang / rnam par 'byed pa'i brtson 'grus chen po kun du brtsams pa'i go cha @70a *//
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa chen po des par brtsams pa la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs la mkhas pa rnams dang / rnam par 'byed pa'i brtson 'grus chen po kun du brtsams pa'i go cha @70a *//
translated: and who have donned the great armor of the great diligence of discernment,

original: chen po shin tu bgos pa de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chen po shin tu bgos pa de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I request the Tathāgata to explain this for them.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽for those beings who wish to be supreme among all beings,🔽who wish to attain mastery over all beings,

original: sems can gang dag sems can thams cad kyi mchog bgyid par 'tshal ba rnams dang / sems can thams cad la dbang phyug gis dbang bsgyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin par 'tshal ba rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das gang dag thogs pa ma mchis pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i shes pa rjes su thob par 'tshal ba rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag sems can thams cad kyi mchog bgyid par 'tshal ba rnams dang / sems can thams cad la dbang phyug gis dbang bsgyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin par 'tshal ba rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das gang dag thogs pa ma mchis pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i shes pa rjes su thob par 'tshal ba rnams dang /
translated: and, Bhagavān, for those who wish to attain unobstructed fearless knowledge,

original: mi 'jigs pa gang la gnas nas sems can rnams la 'phel ba ma mchis pa dang 'grib pa ma mchis pa'i thabs dang / rkyen gyis chos ston par 'gyur ba rnams dang / thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos thams cad kyi don rgya cher ston par 'gyur pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa gang la gnas nas sems can rnams la 'phel ba ma mchis pa dang 'grib pa ma mchis pa'i thabs dang / rkyen gyis chos ston par 'gyur ba rnams dang / thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos thams cad kyi don rgya cher ston par 'gyur pa rnams dang /
translated: and who, through skillful means, extensively teach the meaning of all phenomena to beings.🔽I ask this for the sake of those who teach the nature of the essence of phenomena just as it is,

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin la ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par ston par 'gyur ba rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin la ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par ston par 'gyur ba rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag dpe ma mchis pa'i sems dang bla na ma mchis pa'i sems dang / mchog gi sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / sems kyi dbang phyug rjes su thob par 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu ba 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang dag dpe ma mchis pa'i sems dang bla na ma mchis pa'i sems dang / mchog gi sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / sems kyi dbang phyug rjes su thob par 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du / de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu ba 'tshal lo //
translated: for the sake of those who possess a peerless mind, a supreme mind, and a mind without equal, and who seek to attain the sovereignty of the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag 'jig rten thams cad la sman pa dang / bde ba'i slad du ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs brtol nas /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten thams cad la sman pa dang / bde ba'i slad du ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs brtol nas /
translated: For the sake of those who will be a medicine and a happiness for all worlds, who will break open the eggshell of ignorance,

original: slob dpon la mi ston @70b par rang byung gi ye shes kyi mdzod dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rab dang / rab kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar bgyid do //
analyzed: slob dpon la mi ston @70b par rang byung gi ye shes kyi mdzod dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rab dang / rab kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar bgyid do //
translated: who will not be taught by a master, who will be a treasure of self-arisen wisdom, who will be the highest in the world with its gods, who will be the chief, the exalted, the best, the best of the best, for their sake I ask the Tathagata.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: sems can gang dag 'jig rten thams cad la sman pa dang / bde ba'i slad du nye bar gnas pa rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa chen po'i ye shes rjes su thob par 'tshal ba rnams dang / rang byung gi ye shes kyi stobs la gnas nas ye shes mtha' yas pa ston pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam par 'byed par 'tshal ba rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'jig rten thams cad la sman pa dang / bde ba'i slad du nye bar gnas pa rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa chen po'i ye shes rjes su thob par 'tshal ba rnams dang / rang byung gi ye shes kyi stobs la gnas nas ye shes mtha' yas pa ston pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam par 'byed par 'tshal ba rnams dang /
translated: for the sake of those sentient beings who will be a medicine and a happiness for all worlds, who will attain the wisdom of great fearlessness, who will abide in the power of self-arisen wisdom and will distinguish the skillful means of revealing limitless wisdom,

original: rnam par nges pa'i chos mtha' yas mu med pa dag rab tu ston par 'tshal ba rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rnam par nges pa'i chos mtha' yas mu med pa dag rab tu ston par 'tshal ba rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to illuminate the world with its gods with their light.🔽Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.🔽Blessed One,

original: gang dag lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dag 'od kyis snang bar bgyi bar 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar bgyid do //
analyzed: gang dag lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dag 'od kyis snang bar bgyi bar 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar bgyid do //
translated: I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.🔽Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.🔽Blessed One,

original: gang dag thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la bla na med pa'i ye shes rgya chen po thogs pa ma mchis pa dag yang dag par rab tu ston par 'tshal ba rnams dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ston pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnams par 'byed par 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang dag thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la bla na med pa'i ye shes rgya chen po thogs pa ma mchis pa dag yang dag par rab tu ston par 'tshal ba rnams dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ston pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnams par 'byed par 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gang dag thams @71a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gang dag thams @71a *//
translated: Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.🔽Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.🔽Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.🔽Blessed One,🔽I ask this of the Thus-Gone One for the sake of those who wish to teach beings the vast, unsurpassed wisdom that is unimpeded through skill in means, and to discern the skill in means that teaches utterly pure wisdom.

original: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i sa rjes su thob par 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar 'tshal lo; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i sa rjes su thob par 'tshal ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu bar 'tshal lo; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: For their sake, Blessed One, I would like to ask the Thus-Gone One about the wisdom of omniscience and the level of skill in means that is to be attained.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa gang la gnas nas myur du sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa rnams dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag rtogs par bgyid pa rnams dang / tshegs chung dus sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba'i thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang rtogs par bgyid pa rnams dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa gang la gnas nas myur du sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa rnams dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag rtogs par bgyid pa rnams dang / tshegs chung dus sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba'i thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang rtogs par bgyid pa rnams dang /
translated: “Blessed One, when bodhisattvas are on a certain level, they quickly perfect the level of buddhahood, realize inconceivable skill in means, and with little difficulty realize inconceivable skill in ripening beings.

original: ye shes gang gis sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams spel ba dang / byang chub kyi lam dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gdung rigs kun tu bstan par bgyi ba dang / sems can stong phrag mang po dpag tu ma mchis pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa la so sor 'god par bgyid pa'i ye shes de lta bu dag mngon sum du bgyi ba'i slad du bsgrub par bgyid
analyzed: ye shes gang gis sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams spel ba dang / byang chub kyi lam dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gdung rigs kun tu bstan par bgyi ba dang / sems can stong phrag mang po dpag tu ma mchis pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa la so sor 'god par bgyid pa'i ye shes de lta bu dag mngon sum du bgyi ba'i slad du bsgrub par bgyid
translated: and establish many thousands of sentient beings in the irreversible state of unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: pa rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: pa rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: sems can rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi lam yang dag par rab tu ston pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang dag par dga' ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa @71b la bdag yongs su zhu bar bgyid do //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi lam yang dag par rab tu ston pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang dag par dga' ba de dag gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa @71b la bdag yongs su zhu bar bgyid do //
translated: I ask the Tathāgata to explain the Dharma doors of the Tathāgata’s wisdom, so that the bodhisattvas may be able to teach the path to enlightenment to sentient beings and bodhisattvas, and so that they may delight in the buddhadharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽the time has come for the Tathāgata to teach the Dharma doors such as these to this gathered assembly.🔽The time has come for the Tathāgata to teach the Dharma doors such as these to this gathered assembly.🔽The time has come for the Tathāgata to teach the Dharma doors such as these to this gathered assembly.

original: 'khor mang po 'dus par gyur pa 'di dag la gang de bzhin gshegs pas de lta bu'i chos kyi sgo dag bstan pa'i dus ni 'di lags /🔽tshod ni 'di lags kyi de lta bu'i chos kyi sgo dag bshad cing /

original: de lta bu'i chos bstan pa de dag nye bar bsgrub tu gsol /🔽byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag kyang ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs shing thams cad kyang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos bstan pa de dag nye bar bsgrub tu gsol / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag kyang ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs shing thams cad kyang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa /
translated: The time has come for the Tathāgata to teach the Dharma doors such as these to this gathered assembly.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa sha stag lags na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa sha stag lags na /
translated: The time has come for the Tathāgata to teach

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag chos kyi tshul tshad ma mchis pa rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba dang / nges pa'i tshig gi don thams cad rtogs shing ston par 'gyur ba dang / 'tshal na byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag chos kyi tshul tshad ma mchis pa rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba dang / nges pa'i tshig gi don thams cad rtogs shing ston par 'gyur ba dang / 'tshal na byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: please teach the thus-gone ones’ dhāraṇī gateway to these bodhisattvas so that they may become skilled in discerning the immeasurable Dharma way, so that they may understand and teach all the meanings of etymologies, so that they may awaken to perfect buddhahood if they so wish,

original: 'tshal na rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs mtha' yas pa dag la gnas nas sems can tshad ma mchis pa rnams yongs su smin par bgyid bar 'gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kun tu bzung ba la mkhas par bgyi ba'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la gzungs kyi sgo la mkhas pa de lta bu dag nye bar bsgrub tu gsol /
analyzed: 'tshal na rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs mtha' yas pa dag la gnas nas sems can tshad ma mchis pa rnams yongs su smin par bgyid bar 'gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kun tu bzung ba la mkhas par bgyi ba'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la gzungs kyi sgo la mkhas pa de lta bu dag nye bar bsgrub tu gsol /
translated: so that they may ripen immeasurable beings if they so wish by abiding in infinite miraculous powers, and so that they may become skilled in upholding the qualities of buddhahood and the wisdom of buddhahood.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas de lta bu'i chos kyi sgo dag yang dag par rab tu bshad @72a *//
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas de lta bu'i chos kyi sgo dag yang dag par rab tu bshad @72a *//
translated: “If the Tathāgata were to teach such Dharma doors,

original: na; sems can dpag tu ma mchis pa dag kyang byang chub kyi lam la mkhas shing yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na; sems can dpag tu ma mchis pa dag kyang byang chub kyi lam la mkhas shing yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: immeasurable sentient beings would become skilled in the path to awakening and would reach maturity.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas sngon yun ring po nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de bzhin gshegs pas sngon yun ring po nas /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sems can tshad ma mchis dpag tu ma mchis pa dag sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes la so sor dgod par smon lam mdzad pa de'i dus ni 'di lags kyi /
analyzed: sems can tshad ma mchis dpag tu ma mchis pa dag sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes la so sor dgod par smon lam mdzad pa de'i dus ni 'di lags kyi /
translated: “Thus-Gone One, for a long time you have made aspirations to establish immeasurable and innumerable sentient beings in the knowledge of the buddhas and in self-arisen wisdom. Now is the time for that.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag rang rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / slar zhing rgya cher gong nas gong du smon lam bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas pas gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag rang rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / slar zhing rgya cher gong nas gong du smon lam bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas pas gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
translated: How will they attain the inconceivable and immeasurable skillful means through the power of the thus-gone ones?

original: tshad ma mchis pa dag 'thob par 'gyur ba de ltar de dag la gzungs kyi sgo de lta bu dag bshad cing rab tu bstan dug gsol /
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa dag 'thob par 'gyur ba de ltar de dag la gzungs kyi sgo de lta bu dag bshad cing rab tu bstan dug gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please explain and teach them such dhāraṇī gateways.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni thabs la mkhas pa mtha' yas pa dag ni thugs su chud /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni thabs la mkhas pa mtha' yas pa dag ni thugs su chud /
translated: Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha has realized infinite skillful means.

original: mi 'jigs pa chen po'i sa la ni shin tu rab tu bzhugs /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa chen po'i sa la ni shin tu rab tu bzhugs /
translated: He has reached the level of great fearlessness.

original: bskal ba bye ba dpag tu ma mchis pa nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i dgongs pas ni /
analyzed: bskal ba bye ba dpag tu ma mchis pa nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i dgongs pas ni /
translated: He has accomplished his intention for countless millions of eons.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa bsgrub pa la mkhas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa bsgrub pa la mkhas na /
translated: If you are skilled in fulfilling the wishes of all sentient beings,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'khor 'di @72b dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal du blta zhing 'khor 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bas ngoms ma 'tshal /
analyzed: 'khor 'di @72b dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal du blta zhing 'khor 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bas ngoms ma 'tshal /
translated: all of these retinues look to the face of the Thus-Gone One. These retinues are never satisfied with looking at the Thus-Gone One.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su tshol bas ngoms ma 'tshal /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su tshol bas ngoms ma 'tshal /
translated: They are never satisfied with seeking omniscient wisdom.

original: chos yongs su tshol bas ngoms ma 'tshal /
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol bas ngoms ma 'tshal /
translated: They are never satisfied with seeking the Dharma.

original: don rnams par nges pa'i chos kyi mdzod nyan pas ngoms ma 'tshal ba lags kyi /
analyzed: don rnams par nges pa'i chos kyi mdzod nyan pas ngoms ma 'tshal ba lags kyi /
translated: They are never satisfied with listening to the treasury of Dharma that ascertains the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'khor 'di rnams kyi bsam pa bsgrub pa la mkhas shing de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad kyi smon lam mkhas pa yang rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'khor 'di rnams kyi bsam pa bsgrub pa la mkhas shing de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad kyi smon lam mkhas pa yang rab tu mkhyen /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is skilled in fulfilling the wishes of these retinues. The Thus-Gone One fully knows the skill in aspiration of all these bodhisattvas.

original: 'jug pa la mkhas pa yang rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: 'jug pa la mkhas pa yang rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He fully knows their skill in engagement.

original: yongs su smin par bgyi ba la mkhas pa yang rab tu mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bgyi ba la mkhas pa yang rab tu mkhyen pas na /
translated: He fully knows their skill in ripening.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul bla na med pa la bzhugs nas /🔽de dag la chos kyi sgo gang dag dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig gang dag gis chos thams cad rnam par nges pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul bla na med pa la bzhugs nas / de dag la chos kyi sgo gang dag dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig gang dag gis chos thams cad rnam par nges pa la mkhas pa /
translated: having dwelt in the unsurpassed domain of the buddhas and the domain of the thus-gone ones,🔽please teach and explain the Dharma gateways and the dhāraṇī gateway phrases through which one will become skilled in ascertaining all phenomena

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu dag de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal cing bshad du gsol /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu dag de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal cing bshad du gsol /
translated: and will be completely fulfilled.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems so sor thob par bgyi ba @73a *//
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems so sor thob par bgyi ba @73a *//
translated: how should we bring to maturity those bodhisattvas who are not yet mature, and how should we cause those who are mature to quickly attain the superknowledges and the omniscient mind of the wisdom vision of liberation?

original: dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag ma nges pa'i sa la gnas pa'i sems can de dag gis chos bstan pa 'di thos nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i slad du /
analyzed: gang dag ma nges pa'i sa la gnas pa'i sems can de dag gis chos bstan pa 'di thos nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i slad du /
translated: In order that those sentient beings who are on the uncertain grounds may, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, all become ripened for the domain of omniscience,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag shin tu rnam par nges pa dag yongs su zhu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag shin tu rnam par nges pa dag yongs su zhu'o //
translated: I ask the Thus-Gone One with such great certainty.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byams pa chen pos sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba'i slad du chos bshad pa 'di la bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: byams pa chen pos sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba'i slad du chos bshad pa 'di la bzhugs su gsol /
translated: please remain in this teaching of the Dharma in order to care for sentient beings with great love.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar slad ma'i dus slad ma'i tshe na gnod sems che ba'i dus dang; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nyon mongs pa mang po 'byung ba'i dus dang / ma rig pas zin par gyur pa'i sems can rnams chos la 'khrug pa 'chab par bgyid pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: ji ltar slad ma'i dus slad ma'i tshe na gnod sems che ba'i dus dang; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nyon mongs pa mang po 'byung ba'i dus dang / ma rig pas zin par gyur pa'i sems can rnams chos la 'khrug pa 'chab par bgyid pa'i dus dang /
translated: in the future, when there is great malice, when there is much desire, anger, and delusion, when there is much affliction, when sentient beings are caught up in ignorance, when there is strife and concealment in the Dharma,

original: chos la rtsod cing 'thab pa'i dus na /
analyzed: chos la rtsod cing 'thab pa'i dus na /
translated: when there is dispute and conflict over the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byams pa chen pos yang dag par zin pa'i sems kyis 'khrug pa de la bzod cing ji mi snyam par bgyid pa dang / rtsod pa ma mchis par chos kyi tshul 'di la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas rtsod pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byams pa chen pos yang dag par zin pa'i sems kyis 'khrug pa de la bzod cing ji mi snyam par bgyid pa dang / rtsod pa ma mchis par chos kyi tshul 'di la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas rtsod pa ma mchis shing /
translated: Bodhisattvas, with minds fully embraced by great love, will be patient and tolerant of that conflict, and will attain liberation in this way of the Dharma without dispute.

original: rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa dag rjes su thob par bgyi ba'i slad du /
analyzed: rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa dag rjes su thob par bgyi ba'i slad du /
translated: Fully embraced by great compassion, they will be without dispute and in harmony, and will attain the strength of the roots of virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag don rnam par @73b nges pa 'di dag yongs su zhu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag don rnam par @73b nges pa 'di dag yongs su zhu'o //
translated: I ask the Thus-Gone One about these certainties of meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thogs pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi tshul 'di rnam par dbye bar bzhed na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thogs pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi tshul 'di rnam par dbye bar bzhed na /
translated: if the Thus-Gone One wishes to explain this unobstructed way of the Dharma to the bodhisattvas,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag chos thams cad kun tu bsdu ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos bstan pa'i sgo dang / chos snang ba'i sgo de dag gang lags /
analyzed: gang dag chos thams cad kun tu bsdu ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos bstan pa'i sgo dang / chos snang ba'i sgo de dag gang lags /
translated: What are the gateways of the Dharma teachings and the gateways of the illumination of the Dharma through which one becomes skilled in the complete synthesis of all phenomena?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad bsdu ba la mkhas pa gang dag gis chos kyi tshul 'di ni bslu ba med cing nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad bsdu ba la mkhas pa gang dag gis chos kyi tshul 'di ni bslu ba med cing nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One has taught the Dharma in a way that is free from deception and peacefulness, and he has revealed the treasury of the Dharma.

original: zhes bstan zhing chos kyi gter dpag tu ma mchis pa dag rnam par dbye bar gsol /
analyzed: zhes bstan zhing chos kyi gter dpag tu ma mchis pa dag rnam par dbye bar gsol /
translated: Please explain the inexhaustible Dharma treasury.

original: chos kyi mdzod rnams rnam par dgrol du gsol /
analyzed: chos kyi mdzod rnams rnam par dgrol du gsol /
translated: Please open the Dharma treasury.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zil gyis mi non cing nyams pa mi mnga' la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zil gyis mi non cing nyams pa mi mnga' la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is invincible and undiminished.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas /
translated: He is endowed with the perfect and uninterrupted intention.

original: pha rol rgol ba thams cad ni chos dang mthun pas tshar bcad cing /
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba thams cad ni chos dang mthun pas tshar bcad cing /
translated: He has defeated all opponents in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rab tu btul /
analyzed: rab tu btul /
translated: He has completely subdued them.

original: bdud thams cad ni pham par mdzad /
analyzed: bdud thams cad ni pham par mdzad /
translated: He has defeated all māras.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ni yang dag par bsgrubs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ni yang dag par bsgrubs /
translated: They will perfect the roots of virtue in sentient beings through the qualities of the buddhas.

original: sems can rnams la smon lam la mkhas pa mtha' yas pa mngon par 'phags pa dag ni yang dag par bsgrub cing kun tu ston /
analyzed: sems can rnams la smon lam la mkhas pa mtha' yas pa mngon par 'phags pa dag ni yang dag par bsgrub cing kun tu ston /
translated: They will perfect and teach the infinite, exalted skill in aspiration prayers for sentient beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la ni mngon par 'phags /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la ni mngon par 'phags /
translated: They will be exalted in this omniscient wisdom.

original: chos kun bsdu ba tshad ma mchis pa rnams ni rjes su dgongs /
analyzed: chos kun bsdu ba tshad ma mchis pa rnams ni rjes su dgongs /
translated: They will contemplate the infinite collections of the Dharma.

original: spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa mtha' yas pa dang ni ldan /
analyzed: spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa mtha' yas pa dang ni ldan /
translated: They will possess infinite, perfect eloquence.

original: rnam @74a *// bar gsal ba'i tshig 'bru dpe ma mchis pa rnams dang / shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'i so so yang dag pa rig pa rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams kyis gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa mtha' yas pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: rnam @74a *// bar gsal ba'i tshig 'bru dpe ma mchis pa rnams dang / shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'i so so yang dag pa rig pa rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams kyis gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa mtha' yas pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will comprehend infinite skill in the way of dhāraṇī through incomparable, clear words and uninterrupted, thoroughly purified correct understanding.

original: chos thams cad shin tu rnam par nges pa'i tshul la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams la bsam pa bsgrub par bskul ba dang / sems can rnams la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i sbyor ba bstan pa dang / 'das pa dang /🔽ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par bstan pa dang / rgyu la rag las pa rnams yang dag par bstan pa dang / chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par sems can rnams la chos bstan pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu rnam par nges pa'i tshul la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams la bsam pa bsgrub par bskul ba dang / sems can rnams la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i sbyor ba bstan pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par bstan pa dang / rgyu la rag las pa rnams yang dag par bstan pa dang / chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par sems can rnams la chos bstan pa dang /
translated: they will be skilled in the way of ascertaining all phenomena; they will encourage beings to accomplish their intentions; they will teach beings the connection between the past and the future;🔽they will teach the past, the future, and the present in the correct way; they will teach the dependence on causes; they will teach the Dharma to beings without clinging to any phenomenon;

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /
translated: and they will teach the Dharma to beings in the world systems of the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de dag la yang dag pa'i ched du brjod pa gsung bar 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pas sems can rnams kyi chos la lta ba spang bar bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de dag la yang dag pa'i ched du brjod pa gsung bar 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pas sems can rnams kyi chos la lta ba spang bar bgyi ba dang /
translated: through the power of their miracles and fearlessnesses, they will eliminate the views of the Dharma of sentient beings in all the worlds in the ten directions;

original: sems can rnams la rnam par nges pa'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su smin par bgyi ba la mkhas pa de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam 'phel ba dag bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par nges pa'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su smin par bgyi ba la mkhas pa de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam 'phel ba dag bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: they will teach the inconceivable Dharma of ascertainment to sentient beings; and they will be skilled in ripening the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas @74b pa chen po'i sa yongs su brtag pa'i ched dang / don thams cad shes pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yang dag par bsdu ba'i slad du /
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas @74b pa chen po'i sa yongs su brtag pa'i ched dang / don thams cad shes pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yang dag par bsdu ba'i slad du /
translated: in order to thoroughly investigate the level of great skill in methods and in order to perfectly gather the inconceivable skill in methods that know all meanings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su zhu'o //
translated: I ask the Tathāgata.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: gzhan yang chos gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam la mkhas pa dang / yongs su smin par bgyi pa la mkhas pa dang; thabs la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos bstan pa 'di thos na chos kyi snang ba chen po so sor thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam la mkhas pa dang / yongs su smin par bgyi pa la mkhas pa dang; thabs la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos bstan pa 'di thos na chos kyi snang ba chen po so sor thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: and that will cause the bodhisattvas, upon hearing this Dharma teaching, to each attain great illumination and

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / smon lam gyi khyad par la mkhas pa yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos dag de bzhin gshegs pas bshad du gsol /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / smon lam gyi khyad par la mkhas pa yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos dag de bzhin gshegs pas bshad du gsol /
translated: ripen the path to awakening, and expertise in the special aspirations.”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Anantavyūha, “Anantavyūha,

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gang khyod de ltar shin tu dul ba'i blos de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su zhu ba ni legs so //
analyzed: gang khyod de ltar shin tu dul ba'i blos de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su zhu ba ni legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, Mañjuśrī!🔽It is excellent that with such a well-disciplined mind you ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: legs so // bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: legs so // bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Excellent, excellent, Vimalakīrti!🔽You have spoken well of the bodhisattvas’ skill in liberative art.🔽Vimalakīrti, it is indeed as you have said.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar yang khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / ji ltar yang khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhugs shing /
analyzed: ji ltar yang khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / ji ltar yang khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhugs shing /
translated: The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems @75a *//🔽dpa' thams cad kyi ched dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems @75a *// dpa' thams cad kyi ched dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la shin tu rnam par nges pa dag yongs su zhu pa ni khyod kyi yon tan mthar thug par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la shin tu rnam par nges pa dag yongs su zhu pa ni khyod kyi yon tan mthar thug par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill in liberative art should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: The bodhisattvas who wish to perfect the skill

original: de'i phyir nyon la legs par rab tu yid la gzung zhig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la de dag dang / gzhan yang yon tan tshad med pa dag gis mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan pa dag bshad par bya'o; ;bcom ldan 'das /🔽legs so zhes byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon la legs par rab tu yid la gzung zhig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la de dag dang / gzhan yang yon tan tshad med pa dag gis mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan pa dag bshad par bya'o; ;bcom ldan 'das / legs so zhes byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Therefore, listen well and pay attention! I will teach the Dharma so that bodhisattvas will become exalted by immeasurable qualities and the domain of omniscient wisdom.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Very well, Blessed One,” the bodhisattva Vairocana replied, and he listened as the Blessed One had instructed. The Blessed One said,🔽“Vairocana,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' smon lam la mkhas pa mtha' yas ba mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa'i gsang tshig la 'jug par bya /🔽kun tu gzung bar bya /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' smon lam la mkhas pa mtha' yas ba mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa'i gsang tshig la 'jug par bya / kun tu gzung bar bya /
translated: the bodhisattvas who wish for infinite skill in vows should engage with the secret words of the intention of the thus-gone ones.🔽They should uphold them.

original: nges par brtag par bya /
analyzed: nges par brtag par bya /
translated: They should investigate them.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la nye bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la nye bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should properly examine this.

original: ji ltar tshul bzhin du nye bar brtag bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul bzhin du nye bar brtag bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should you properly examine this?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di ni ji tsam du yang dag par bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las byung bas yongs su ma @75b dag pa las 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di ni ji tsam du yang dag par bsdu ba la mkhas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las byung bas yongs su ma @75b dag pa las 'byung ba med do //
translated: this teaching of the thus-gone ones is the wisdom of the buddhas, which is skilled in the perfect summary of the Dharma. It does not arise from anything impure.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di la yang dag par rab tu bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di la yang dag par rab tu bslab par bya ste /
translated: bodhisattvas should train in this:

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa rnams ni de dag gis chos 'di dag nyid la nges par brten cing thugs rje chen po la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa rnams ni de dag gis chos 'di dag nyid la nges par brten cing thugs rje chen po la gnas nas /
translated: the teachings of the blessed buddhas are based on these very phenomena, and they are grounded in great compassion.

original: sems can rnams la byams pa chen pos khyab par mdzad pa las 'di ltar rnam par nges pa'i chos rnams mtshungs par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byams pa chen pos khyab par mdzad pa las 'di ltar rnam par nges pa'i chos rnams mtshungs par 'byung ste /
translated: It is from the pervasion of beings with great love that the definitive Dharma arises in the same way.

original: sems can dman pa la mos pa kha cig ni nyan thos kyis la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dman pa la mos pa kha cig ni nyan thos kyis la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some beings, who are interested in the inferior vehicle, will enter the vehicle of the disciples.

original: ngan pa'i sa la mos pa'i sems can kha cig ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan pa'i sa la mos pa'i sems can kha cig ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some beings, who are interested in the inferior stage, will enter the vehicle of the solitary sages.

original: smon lam chen po phun sum tshogs pa'i sems can rgya chen po la mos pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam chen po phun sum tshogs pa'i sems can rgya chen po la mos pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those beings who are interested in the vast, who are endowed with the great vows, will enter the complete knowledge of the omniscient one.

original: dman pa'i chos dang / ngan pa'i chos rnams yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: dman pa'i chos dang / ngan pa'i chos rnams yongs su spangs pa /
translated: They have abandoned the inferior and bad dharmas.

original: nged ni rgya chen po'i chos la mos pa 'di dag la gnas shing /
analyzed: nged ni rgya chen po'i chos la mos pa 'di dag la gnas shing /
translated: We are interested in the vast dharmas and abide in them.

original: nged kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa bstan pa'i gsang tshig gi mtshams de dag mkhyen nas /
analyzed: nged kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa bstan pa'i gsang tshig gi mtshams de dag mkhyen nas /
translated: We know the limits of the secret words that reveal the intention of the Tathāgatas.

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa tshig 'bru dpe med pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa tshig 'bru dpe med pa dang /
translated: In order to ripen beings according to their faculties and to ripen them according to their aspirations, the teachings of the thus-gone ones appear with incomparable words and syllables,

original: rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa rnams kyis @76a *//🔽chos thams cad yang dag par blangs pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa rnams kyis @76a *// chos thams cad yang dag par blangs pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: which are vast and sublime.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni mnyam pa ste /🔽lhag pa med pa /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni mnyam pa ste / lhag pa med pa /
translated: All these teachings are equal,

original: chad pa med pa /🔽gzugs med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: chad pa med pa / gzugs med pa ma yin pa /
translated: without excess and without deficiency,

original: gzugs mnyam pa ma yin pa /🔽'grib pa med pa /
analyzed: gzugs mnyam pa ma yin pa / 'grib pa med pa /
translated: without form and not the same as form,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa med pa /🔽mtha' yas pa med pa /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa med pa / mtha' yas pa med pa /
translated: without decrease and without completion,

original: 'chi ba med pa /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa /
translated: without infinity and without death,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: and naturally pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du mthong zhing rtogs par 'gyur yang chos gang yang rab tu rtogs pa yang med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du mthong zhing rtogs par 'gyur yang chos gang yang rab tu rtogs pa yang med /
translated: They see and realize the nature of the essence of the Dharma taught by the buddhas, yet they do not realize any Dharma at all.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: They do not realize the true nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called ‘all dharmas’

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam grangs su bstan te gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam grangs su bstan te gsungs pas na /
translated: are taught and spoken of by the Tathāgata as a category.

original: gang rnam grangs su bstan te gsungs pa'i chos de la ni chos dang chos ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su gdags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rnam grangs su bstan te gsungs pa'i chos de la ni chos dang chos ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su gdags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the Dharma that is taught and spoken of as a category, there is no designation of the state of Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: rjes su gdags pa'i chos thams cad ni don dam par yang dag pa nyid du ni gdags su med do //
analyzed: rjes su gdags pa'i chos thams cad ni don dam par yang dag pa nyid du ni gdags su med do //
translated: All nominally designated dharmas ultimately cannot be designated as the true nature.

original: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhol bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhol bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has said that all dharmas are to be directed to the true nature.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas par byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas par byas pa ma yin /
translated: Dharma and non-Dharma are not established by conceptualization.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are also not established by non-conceptualization.

original: chos thams cad ni rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du mnyam pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du mnyam pa nyid yin pas /
translated: All phenomena are the same as conceptualization.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not conceptualized.

original: @76b chos thams cad ni khyad par khong du chud pas khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: @76b chos thams cad ni khyad par khong du chud pas khyad par med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without distinction, because they are understood to be without distinction.

original: chos thams cad ni byung ba med pas ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byung ba med pas ma byung ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are non-arisen, because they do not arise.

original: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su brtags shing kun nas bslangs pas dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su brtags shing kun nas bslangs pas dngos po med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are unreal, because they are imagined and motivated by false conceptualization.

original: chos thams cad ni kun nas slong ba la rag las pas kun nas ldang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni kun nas slong ba la rag las pas kun nas ldang ba med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without motivation, because they depend on motivation.

original: chos thams cad ni phan tshun rdob pa med pas 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phan tshun rdob pa med pas 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without engagement, because they do not engage with each other.

original: chos thams cad ni btang snyoms yongs su rdzogs pas ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni btang snyoms yongs su rdzogs pas ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without dependence, because they are perfected in equanimity.

original: chos thams cad ni blang ba dang dor ba med pas rjes su sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni blang ba dang dor ba med pas rjes su sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are not to be adopted or rejected, and so they are not to be engaged in.

original: 'dir ni smon lam gyi khyad par gyi las byed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni smon lam gyi khyad par gyi las byed do //
translated: Here, the function is the special aspiration.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid las shin tu 'das pas bdag gi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid las shin tu 'das pas bdag gi ba med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without intrinsic nature and transcend the nature of phenomena, and so they are not possessed of an owner.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni spros pa med pas khyad par med cing mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni spros pa med pas khyad par med cing mnyam pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without conceptual elaboration, and so they are undifferentiated and equal.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ji ltar smon pa de ltar yang dag par 'grub kyang /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ji ltar smon pa de ltar yang dag par 'grub kyang /
translated: All phenomena are accomplished just as they are aspired to,

original: de la smon par byed pa gang yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de la smon par byed pa gang yang med pa'o //
translated: and yet there is no one who aspires to them.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rag las pa las gzhol pas ci yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rag las pa las gzhol pas ci yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are not anything at all, since they are directed toward dependence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag thams cad ni rmi lam dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bur bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag thams cad ni rmi lam dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bur bstan te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has taught that all phenomena are like dreams and illusions.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag la ni rab dang / 'bring dang / tha mar dbye ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag la ni rab dang / 'bring dang / tha mar dbye ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In those natures of phenomena, there is not the slightest distinction of high, middling, or low.

original: de lta bas na nged ni smon lam rnam par dag pas sems @77a *//
analyzed: de lta bas na nged ni smon lam rnam par dag pas sems @77a *//
translated: Therefore, we establish beings in pure aspirations,

original: can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir smon lam rgya chen po dag la rab tu bkod nas chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa la rab tu 'god pa mdzad do //
analyzed: can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir smon lam rgya chen po dag la rab tu bkod nas chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa la rab tu 'god pa mdzad do //
translated: and having established them in vast aspirations, we establish them in the absence of attachment to any phenomenon.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽'di ni nyi ma'i rigs kyi 'od zer snang bar byed pa dang / chos kyi snang ba gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam gyi khyad par phun sum tshogs pa dag rnam par 'phel zhing /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / 'di ni nyi ma'i rigs kyi 'od zer snang bar byed pa dang / chos kyi snang ba gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam gyi khyad par phun sum tshogs pa dag rnam par 'phel zhing /
translated: “Anantavyūha,🔽this is the light of the sun’s rays, which illuminates and is the light of Dharma by which the bodhisattvas’ aspirations are fulfilled and increase,

original: mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi snang ba yin no //
translated: and by which the light of Dharma becomes exalted.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi tshul bstan pa 'di la mos pa'i rigs kyi bu dag ni sems can rnams la chos kyi snang bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi tshul bstan pa 'di la mos pa'i rigs kyi bu dag ni sems can rnams la chos kyi snang bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, those sons of noble family who are devoted to this teaching of the way of the Dharma illuminate the Dharma for sentient beings.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' nang du tshul bzhin du sems pa dang / phyi rol tu dran pa mi g-yeng ba dang / sgrib pa spang ba la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin kun tu snang ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' nang du tshul bzhin du sems pa dang / phyi rol tu dran pa mi g-yeng ba dang / sgrib pa spang ba la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin kun tu snang ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: the bodhisattvas should examine this teaching with their minds properly directed inward, their minds undistracted outward, their minds focused on the elimination of obscurations, and their minds recalling the bodhisattvas’ samādhi of universal illumination.

original: chos zab mo la mos pa dag gis chos 'di la nye bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo la mos pa dag gis chos 'di la nye bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: They should examine this teaching with a mind that is devoted to the profound Dharma.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rkyen gyi don la mkhas pa so sor rtog par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rkyen gyi don la mkhas pa so sor rtog par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has taught all these teachings in order to discern the meaning of conditions.

original: rkyen gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid de yang rang bzhin gyis gsog /
analyzed: rkyen gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid de yang rang bzhin gyis gsog /
translated: The essence of the meaning of conditions is essentially hollow,🔽hollow,

original: gsob / ya ma brla /
analyzed: gsob / ya ma brla /
translated: hollow,

original: snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: snying po med pa ste /
translated: and essenceless.

original: rdzun pa slu ba'i chos su bstan to //
analyzed: rdzun pa slu ba'i chos su bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be a false and deceptive phenomenon.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang dag gis sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de dag kyang gsog /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang dag gis sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de dag kyang gsog /
translated: The causes and conditions by which sentient beings are defiled are also hollow,

original: gsob / ya ma brla /
analyzed: gsob / ya ma brla /
translated: hollow, false,

original: @77b snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: @77b snying po med pa ste /
translated: hollow, and without essence.

original: rdzun pa slu pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rdzun pa slu pa'i chos yin no //
translated: They are false and deceptive phenomena.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang dag gis sems can rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de dag kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su btsal yang snang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang dag gis sems can rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de dag kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su btsal yang snang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: The causes and conditions by which sentient beings are purified, even if sought in the worlds of the ten directions, are not seen,

original: dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: are not apprehended.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Because all these phenomena are ungraspable and inexistent, they are unapprehendable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gang chos rnams kyang spang bar btags na chos ma yin pa rnams spang ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gang chos rnams kyang spang bar btags na chos ma yin pa rnams spang ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: The Tathāgata has declared that even phenomena should be abandoned, let alone non-phenomena.

original: gang spang ba de yang blang ba med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang spang ba de yang blang ba med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is to be abandoned does not exist in the least, because it is non-appropriated, spontaneous, and naturally pure.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin pas rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin pas rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are realized as they are, so they are free from conceptualization and imagination.

original: chos thams cad ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gnas bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gnas bstan du med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are not other than what they are, so they cannot be taught as a location.

original: de lta bas na chos 'di dag thams cad ni gnas med pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos 'di dag thams cad ni gnas med pa /
translated: Therefore, all these phenomena are without location,

original: gnas pa med pa brjod pas ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa brjod pas ming du btags pa ste /
translated: without support, and designated by expression.

original: gang brjod pas ming du btags pa de ni ya ma brla ste /
analyzed: gang brjod pas ming du btags pa de ni ya ma brla ste /
translated: That which is designated by expression is a non-entity,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par nye bar gnas pa /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par nye bar gnas pa /
translated: existing without any intrinsic essence.

original: nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not a support,

original: gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: gnas med pa ste /
translated: not a location.

original: de ltar de dag ni gnas med pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni gnas med pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since they are without location, they are not located.

original: zad pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'gog pa dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam grangs kyi tshig gis bstan pa ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs @78a *//
analyzed: zad pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'gog pa dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam grangs kyi tshig gis bstan pa ste / de bzhin gshegs @78a *//
translated: Exhaustion, transformation, and cessation are taught by the Tathāgata as synonyms.

original: pa rnams kyi dgongs pa'i rnam grangs 'di la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: pa rnams kyi dgongs pa'i rnam grangs 'di la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas have taught these synonyms in order to introduce the meaning of the Tathāgatas’ intention.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /🔽mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste / mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: One should not cling to wholesome and unwholesome dharmas.🔽Clinging to unwholesome dharmas

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: leads to clinging to unwholesome dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Clinging to unwholesome dharmas

original: sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par gtogs pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par gtogs pas /
translated: leads to the arising of suffering and unpleasant dharmas. These are included in the noble truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs su bstan to; ;dge ba dang mi dge ba las mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / sred pa 'gog pa 'di dag ni kun 'byung ba spang zhing 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs su bstan to //🔽'gog pa'i phyir dang / rlom sems med pa'i phyir dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la nye bar brtag pa dang / nye bar mi len pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs su bstan to; ;dge ba dang mi dge ba las mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / sred pa 'gog pa 'di dag ni kun 'byung ba spang zhing 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs su bstan to // 'gog pa'i phyir dang / rlom sems med pa'i phyir dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la nye bar brtag pa dang / nye bar mi len pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba med pa dang /
translated: The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.🔽The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.

original: rlom sems dang bral ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rlom sems dang bral ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The Tathāgata has taught the categories of wholesome dharmas in order to abandon the origin and realize the second noble truth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i bden pa gsum pa'i rnam grangs su bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i bden pa gsum pa'i rnam grangs su bstan to //
translated: The Tathāgata has taught

original: chos 'di ji lta ba bzhin du @78b rtogs pa'i sa dang / rlom sems dang / g-yo ba dang / spobs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i sa'i lam gang yin pa de dag yongs su btsal zhing /
analyzed: chos 'di ji lta ba bzhin du @78b rtogs pa'i sa dang / rlom sems dang / g-yo ba dang / spobs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i sa'i lam gang yin pa de dag yongs su btsal zhing /
translated: The path of the stage that is beyond all conceit, movement, and eloquence, which is the stage of realizing this Dharma as it is, is sought.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba bsgom pa nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i lam rnams bstan pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba bsgom pa nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i lam rnams bstan pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The path endowed with the eight branches, from the cultivation of right view up to right concentration, is taught in order to realize the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi pa'i rnam grangs su bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi pa'i rnam grangs su bstan te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has taught this enumeration of the four noble truths.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba dag las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang /
