analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba dag las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: This is the way the blessed buddhas teach the understanding of suffering, the relinquishment of its origin, the manifestation of its cessation, and the cultivation of the path.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par dang; sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur pa'i lam gyi rnam grangs su bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par dang; sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur pa'i lam gyi rnam grangs su bzhag pa yin te /
translated: The cessation of suffering and the path that leads to the cessation of suffering are also designations.

original: sdug bsngal 'di ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las btags par zad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las btags par zad do //
translated: This suffering is merely a designation that is based on what is not real.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa shes pa'i gzhi rnams ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa shes pa'i gzhi rnams ni 'di gnyis te /
translated: The basis for the knowledge of ignorance and so on is these two.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa med pa la ni gzhi cung zad kyang med pas /
analyzed: shes pa med pa la ni gzhi cung zad kyang med pas /
translated: Because there is no basis for knowledge whatsoever in the absence of knowledge.

original: de ni mngon par rtogs pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa; shes pa med pa /
analyzed: de ni mngon par rtogs pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa; shes pa med pa /
translated: It is not an understanding, it is not a perception, it is not a knowledge,

original: khongs su gtogs pa med pas na /
analyzed: khongs su gtogs pa med pas na /
translated: and it is not a basis.

original: de la gang gi gzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gang gi gzhir 'gyur te /
translated: What could be its basis?

original: med pa / gsog /
analyzed: med pa / gsog /
translated: It is nonexistent, hollow,

original: rdzun pa bslu ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rdzun pa bslu ba'i chos yin no //
translated: and a false and deceptive phenomenon.

original: de la gzhi de yang yod pa ma yin pa @79a *//
analyzed: de la gzhi de yang yod pa ma yin pa @79a *//
translated: The basis for that does not exist.

original: las btags pa ste /
analyzed: las btags pa ste /
translated: It is a designation.

original: 'di la ther zug tu mngon par zhen pa dang / chad bar mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi med pas na /
analyzed: 'di la ther zug tu mngon par zhen pa dang / chad bar mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi med pas na /
translated: There is no basis for the conception of permanence or the conception of annihilation.

original: rlom sems su mngon par zhen pa med par sdug bsngal gyi gzhi la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rlom sems su mngon par zhen pa med par sdug bsngal gyi gzhi la brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate the basis of suffering without fixating on the conceit of knowing.

original: de ltar gzhi med pa la mngon par shes pa yang med par yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhi med pa la mngon par shes pa yang med par yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand that if there is no basis, there is also no superknowledge.

original: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba las byung bas sdug bsngal ni mi shes pa'i rang bzhin can te /🔽ma rig pa ni gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba las byung bas sdug bsngal ni mi shes pa'i rang bzhin can te / ma rig pa ni gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Suffering arises from the connection with ignorance, and ignorance is by nature unknowing.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: Ignorance is neither associated with anything nor is it non-associated.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not associated with anything.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa la ni byed pa po gdags su med cing byed pa po mi dmigs pas mi rtog /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa la ni byed pa po gdags su med cing byed pa po mi dmigs pas mi rtog /
translated: Thus, ignorance cannot be designated as an agent, and since an agent cannot be observed, it does not think,

original: rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog /
translated: it does not conceive,

original: mi byed / rnam par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi byed / rnam par mi byed do //
translated: it does not act, and it does not perform any action.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i sgo ste /
translated: this is the gateway to the knowledge that accords with the bodhisattvas’ understanding of the essence of ignorance.

original: gang gis ma rig pa'i mun pa bsal zhing rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi sgo mngon du gyur nas //
analyzed: gang gis ma rig pa'i mun pa bsal zhing rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi sgo mngon du gyur nas //
translated: Having dispelled the darkness of ignorance and manifested the Dharma gateway that accords with awareness,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to realize the expertise in the noble truths of the bodhisattvas,

original: sgo 'di dag yongs su sbyong zhing mngon par sgrub pa dang / sdug bsngal la lhag par dmigs pa na kun 'byung ba nub pa dang / zad pa dang 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgo 'di dag yongs su sbyong zhing mngon par sgrub pa dang / sdug bsngal la lhag par dmigs pa na kun 'byung ba nub pa dang / zad pa dang 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: they purify and accomplish these gateways. When they focus on suffering, the origin will disappear, be exhausted, and cease.

original: de ltar mnyam pa @79b nyid kyi lam bsgrub cing bsgom pa dang / de ltar spyad pas de ltar mnyam pa nyid kyi lam gyi rnam grangs kyis chod de dag thams cad mngon du shes shing yongs su shes so //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam pa @79b nyid kyi lam bsgrub cing bsgom pa dang / de ltar spyad pas de ltar mnyam pa nyid kyi lam gyi rnam grangs kyis chod de dag thams cad mngon du shes shing yongs su shes so //
translated: In this way, they accomplish and cultivate the path of sameness. By practicing in this way, through the enumeration of the path of sameness, they directly know and fully understand all those severed states.

original: mngon du shes pas sbang bar bya'o //🔽mngon du shes pas mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: mngon du shes pas sbang bar bya'o // mngon du shes pas mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: They should be burned by direct knowledge.🔽They should be actualized by direct knowledge.

original: mngon du shes pas bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon du shes pas bsgom par bya ste /
translated: They should be cultivated by direct knowledge.

original: de'i phyir gang mngon du shes pa de ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang mngon du shes pa de ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is directly cognized is fully understood.

original: gang yongs su shes pa de ni spang ba'o //
analyzed: gang yongs su shes pa de ni spang ba'o //
translated: That which is fully understood is abandoned.

original: gang spang ba de ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang spang ba de ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: That which is abandoned is actualized.

original: gang mngon sum du bya ba de ni bsgom par bstan te /
analyzed: gang mngon sum du bya ba de ni bsgom par bstan te /
translated: That which is actualized is taught to be cultivated.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i chos shes nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i chos shes nas /
translated: Thus, having understood the Dharma of the noble ones,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus dang ma bral par bden pa mngon par sgrub bo zhes blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus dang ma bral par bden pa mngon par sgrub bo zhes blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will accomplish the truth without being separated from diligence, in a way that is free from conceptual thought.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽'phags pa rnams kyis ni chos thams cad brtags pa /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / 'phags pa rnams kyis ni chos thams cad brtags pa /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: rnam par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: rnam par bsgrubs pas /
translated: the noble ones do not conceptualize or elaborate about any phenomena,

original: gces ba'o zhes pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gces ba'o zhes pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: but regard them as precious.

original: spros par mi byed par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba srung zhing zhen par mi byed //
analyzed: spros par mi byed par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba srung zhing zhen par mi byed //
translated: They do not engage in conceptual elaboration, but rather guard the accurate view, without clinging or conceptualizing.

original: rnam par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi byed do //
translated: They do not engage in conceptual elaboration.

original: de lta bas na lam dang / spang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la yang rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de lta bas na lam dang / spang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la yang rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Therefore, they do not falsely project anything onto the path, what is to be abandoned, or virtuous qualities.

original: spros par mi byed ni /🔽mi dge ba'i chos rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: spros par mi byed ni / mi dge ba'i chos rnams lta ci smos /
translated: Therefore, they do not form mental constructs or conceptual thoughts about the path, what is to be abandoned, or virtuous phenomena.🔽They do not form mental constructs or conceptual thoughts about nonvirtuous phenomena, let alone about what is to be abandoned.

original: de dag spong ba'i phyir yang mi gnas rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis chos ma yin pa dag spang ba'i phyir lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa'i mkhas @80a *//
analyzed: de dag spong ba'i phyir yang mi gnas rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis chos ma yin pa dag spang ba'i phyir lta smos kyang ci dgos / kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa'i mkhas @80a *//
translated: They do not even form mental constructs or conceptual thoughts about what is not Dharma, let alone about what is to be abandoned.

original: pa dag ni /🔽chos rnams dang kun tu sbyor bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: pa dag ni / chos rnams dang kun tu sbyor bar yang mi byed /
translated: The wise ones who have abandoned fetters🔽do not form fetters with regard to phenomena.

original: chos ma yin pa rnams dang kun tu sbyor ba yang mi byed de /🔽des chos thams cad rdzun pa bslu ba; ya ma bral /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa rnams dang kun tu sbyor ba yang mi byed de / des chos thams cad rdzun pa bslu ba; ya ma bral /
translated: They do not form fetters with regard to what is not Dharma.🔽Since they know that all phenomena are false, deceptive, hollow,

original: gsog / gsob lta bur shes pas na 'di ni de'i bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gsog / gsob lta bur shes pas na 'di ni de'i bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: and void, this is the accomplishment of their truth.

original: gang gi phyir de ni btang snyoms yongs su rdzogs pa dang / kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa dang / lam la gnas pa dang / 'gro ba rnams kyis dus las 'das par bya ba'i phyir rjes su chags pa med cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni btang snyoms yongs su rdzogs pa dang / kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa dang / lam la gnas pa dang / 'gro ba rnams kyis dus las 'das par bya ba'i phyir rjes su chags pa med cing /
translated: Because they are completely perfected in equanimity, they have abandoned fetters, abide on the path, and are free from attachment and anger toward beings who have passed beyond the time for being guided.

original: khong khro ba med pas chos nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo blang ba dang / dor ba med par rtogs so //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pas chos nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo blang ba dang / dor ba med par rtogs so //
translated: They realize the nature of phenomena to be beyond acceptance and rejection, as it is by nature.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽gang yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / gang yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: “Vimalaprabhā,🔽the nature of phenomena is empty by nature.

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pas na /
translated: Since all phenomena are devoid of any nature,

original: chos rnams la byed pa po ni 'ga' yang dmigs su med do //🔽chos thams cad ni kun tu sbyor ba med pa dang ldan pas na ldan pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: chos rnams la byed pa po ni 'ga' yang dmigs su med do // chos thams cad ni kun tu sbyor ba med pa dang ldan pas na ldan pa yang ma yin //
translated: no creator of phenomena can be observed.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Since all phenomena are endowed with the absence of fetters, they are neither endowed nor not endowed.

original: de dag ni dngos po med pa la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po med pa la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya //
translated: They do not even conceive of non-entities.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spang ba yang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spang ba yang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: One should not even entertain the idea of abandoning things and nonthings.

original: spros par mi bya'o //
analyzed: spros par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not conceptualize them.

original: rkyen rnams rnam par dag par yongs su shes pa de chos gang dag rkyen gyis bskyed de byung ba'i rkyen de dag ni gcig gis gcig stong pa dang / sems can gyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir @80b shin tu dag pa dang / shin tu dben pas na rkyen rnams kyang rgyu dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rkyen rnams rnam par dag par yongs su shes pa de chos gang dag rkyen gyis bskyed de byung ba'i rkyen de dag ni gcig gis gcig stong pa dang / sems can gyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir @80b shin tu dag pa dang / shin tu dben pas na rkyen rnams kyang rgyu dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: “When the conditions are fully understood to be pure, the conditions that give rise to and produce phenomena are mutually empty, and because sentient beings are devoid of an essence, the conditions are utterly pure and utterly void. Therefore, the conditions are not endowed with causes,

original: rgyu yang rkyen rnams dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yang rkyen rnams dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and causes are not endowed with conditions.

original: chos thams cad ni pa na tshun g-yo ba med cing spyad pa med pas 'jug pa med pa'i chos rnams la sems bar byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni pa na tshun g-yo ba med cing spyad pa med pas 'jug pa med pa'i chos rnams la sems bar byed de /
translated: Since all phenomena are devoid of mutual movement and activity, they are phenomena that do not engage. One should be aware of this.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas //
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzhi med pa'i chos kyi sgo 'di la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i chos kyi sgo 'di la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: one should engage with this Dharma gateway that is without basis.

original: sgo rnam par dag cing chos snang ba'i gzhir gyur pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur zhing skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgo rnam par dag cing chos snang ba'i gzhir gyur pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur zhing skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The door to the pure light of the Dharma will not be lost, but will arise.

original: rjes su gzung ba nyid kyang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //🔽spros pa dang bral ba'i snang ba yang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su gzung ba nyid kyang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro // spros pa dang bral ba'i snang ba yang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the pure acceptance of the Dharma will also arise.🔽The light of freedom from conceptual elaboration will also arise.

original: snang bas snyems pa med par 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang bas snyems pa med par 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the light of non-conceit will also arise.

original: gzhung las yang dag par 'das te /🔽chags pa med pas nges par 'byung ba yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhung las yang dag par 'das te / chags pa med pas nges par 'byung ba yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will transcend the scriptures.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas //
translated: And one will attain liberation through non-attachment.🔽“Anantavyūha,

original: chos thams cad ni ming dang mtshan ma'i tha snyad kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ming dang mtshan ma'i tha snyad kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: all phenomena are described by the conventions of names and signs.

original: de la mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gzugs su btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gzugs su btags pa'o //
translated: The signs are imputed to form in the four great elements.

original: ming gang yin pa de ni phung po bzhi la gzugs med par btags pa ste /
analyzed: ming gang yin pa de ni phung po bzhi la gzugs med par btags pa ste /
translated: The names are imputed to the four aggregates that are not form.

original: de la ming ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su btags pa'o //
translated: Among them, names are imputed to be unreal.

original: mtshan ma yang yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa'i phyir ci log gis bdag ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma yang yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa'i phyir ci log gis bdag ni gzugs yin no //
translated: Since the signs are not real as they appear, one grasps at the self as form,

original: gzugs ni bdag gi yin no zhes 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gi yin no zhes 'dzin cing /
translated: and form as belonging to the self.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pas ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pas ming du btags pa'o //
translated: This is the imputation of names by conceptual thoughts of signs.

original: de la gang yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba gnyis ka yang yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pas @81a *//
analyzed: de la gang yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba gnyis ka yang yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pas @81a *//
translated: In this regard, what is called name-and-form is both unreal.

original: gsog dang / rdzun pa bslu ba'i chos te /
analyzed: gsog dang / rdzun pa bslu ba'i chos te /
translated: It is hollow, false, and deceptive,

original: sgyu mar gyur pa dang / rmi lam gyi gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur pa dang / rmi lam gyi gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: like an illusory form or a form in a dream.

original: rmi lam gyi gzugs kyi lus ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs rnams bstan te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gzugs kyi lus ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs rnams bstan te /
translated: Just as the body in a dream is a form, so are forms taught.

original: snying po med pa'i gzugs rnams dang / ming gi phung po bzhi po gnyig yang tha snyad tsam du rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa'i gzugs rnams dang / ming gi phung po bzhi po gnyig yang tha snyad tsam du rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that both the collection of forms without essence and the four aggregates of name are mere conventions.

original: de ltar rjes su rtogs na sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa med cing /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su rtogs na sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa med cing /
translated: If one understands this, one will not be harmed by suffering,

original: bden pa la lhag par dmigs pa yang med pas /
analyzed: bden pa la lhag par dmigs pa yang med pas /
translated: and one will not grasp at the four noble truths as real.

original: de'i sems la ci yang med cing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i sems la ci yang med cing mi dmigs te /
translated: His mind is nothing at all, and he does not observe anything.

original: de chung du na mya ngan las 'da' ba dang ldan pa yang med de /
analyzed: de chung du na mya ngan las 'da' ba dang ldan pa yang med de /
translated: He does not even have the idea of nirvana.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa na /
translated: In this way, when he has transcended all ideas,

original: tshor ba 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: his feelings will cease.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: khams gsum pa rnams ni 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa las byung la /
analyzed: khams gsum pa rnams ni 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa las byung la /
translated: the three realms arise from the mental activity of ideas,

original: 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa ni yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir khams gsum pa rnams kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa ni yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir khams gsum pa rnams kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: but since the mental activity of ideas does not exist, the three realms are taught to be nonexistent.

original: gang yang kun tu shes par byed pa de ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang kun tu shes par byed pa de ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Any notion of knowing is clinging to form.

original: gang yid la byed pa de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag dang ldan par bstan te /
analyzed: gang yid la byed pa de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag dang ldan par bstan te /
translated: Any mental activity is taught to be associated with feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The nature of phenomena is not associated with anything.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pas 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pas 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not non-existent, that conceptual mental activity is not existent.

original: 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa de yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma @81b yin pas de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa las tshig gis btags pa na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi yid la byed pa de yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma @81b yin pas de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa las tshig gis btags pa na /
translated: Since that conceptual mental activity is not inherently existent, therefore, when it is designated by words as non-existent,

original: rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i rnam grangs su bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i rnam grangs su bstan to //
translated: it is taught to be a synonym for natural peace.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin las chos bshad pa'i rnam grangs dag byung ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin las chos bshad pa'i rnam grangs dag byung ste /
translated: the categories of Dharma teachings that explain the nature of phenomena have arisen.

original: bshad pa dang brjod pa mnyam pa nyid kyis bden pa bsgrubs pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dang brjod pa mnyam pa nyid kyis bden pa bsgrubs pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas should realize that this accomplishment of truth is due to the sameness of explanation and expression.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bshad pa 'byung ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bshad pa 'byung ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin te /
translated: the thus-gone ones’ Dharma teachings that arise in order to relinquish all fetters are not without result.

original: de la khyed kyis brlabs po che'i sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: de la khyed kyis brlabs po che'i sems bskyed nas /
translated: You should generate a vast mind

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / sems can med pas chos rnams la 'jug cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / sems can med pas chos rnams la 'jug cing /
translated: They should engage with phenomena without clinging to any phenomena, without conceit, without conceptual elaboration, and without sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po bskyed nas chos kyi sgo 'di dag la 'jug par bya /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po bskyed nas chos kyi sgo 'di dag la 'jug par bya /
translated: They should engage with these Dharma gateways after developing great love and great compassion for sentient beings.

original: yang dag par 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: yang dag par 'gro bar bya /
translated: They should proceed correctly.

original: nges par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par brtag par bya'o //
translated: They should investigate.

original: chos kyi sgo rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the Dharma gateways?

original: mi shes pa las 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad 'byung bar rtogs pa dang / ye shes mthong ba las 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad 'byung bar rtogs nas /
analyzed: mi shes pa las 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad 'byung bar rtogs pa dang / ye shes mthong ba las 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad 'byung bar rtogs nas /
translated: They should realize that all conditioned phenomena arise from ignorance and that all unconditioned phenomena arise from the vision of wisdom.

original: spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyis 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la yang yang dag par 'jug par bya zhing /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyis 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la yang yang dag par 'jug par bya zhing /
translated: With nonconceptual wisdom, they should engage with conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / bgrang ba med pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug @82a *//
analyzed: yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / bgrang ba med pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug @82a *//
translated: They should purify and follow the Dharma that is beyond enumeration.

original: pas grangs rnams kyang grangs dang ldan pa med cing /
analyzed: pas grangs rnams kyang grangs dang ldan pa med cing /
translated: Therefore, numbers are not endowed with numbers,

original: grangs rnams kyang grangs la gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: grangs rnams kyang grangs la gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: and numbers do not abide in numbers.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i sgo ni chos kyi sgo yin pas /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i sgo ni chos kyi sgo yin pas /
translated: The gateway to the unconditioned is the gateway to phenomena.

original: chos kyi sgo ni yongs su dag cing chos snang ba'i rnam pa kun 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo ni yongs su dag cing chos snang ba'i rnam pa kun 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: The gateway to phenomena is pure and it upholds all the aspects of the illumination of phenomena.

original: rjes su bzung ba dang / kun bzung ba'i chos rnams kyang chud za bar mi 'gyur bar thabs la mkhas par mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos brjod cing ston par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su bzung ba dang / kun bzung ba'i chos rnams kyang chud za bar mi 'gyur bar thabs la mkhas par mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos brjod cing ston par byed do //
translated: It is expressed and taught with a mind that has accomplished skill in means, so that the Dharma that is upheld and taken up is not wasted.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs kyi sgor 'jug pa dang / gang dag gi blo'i rab tu dbye ba rgya cher mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don thams cad bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs kyi sgor 'jug pa dang / gang dag gi blo'i rab tu dbye ba rgya cher mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don thams cad bstan pa'o //
translated: this is the gateway to the form of the bodhisattvas, and it is the teaching of the entire meaning of the words of wisdom that will greatly enhance the discernment of their minds.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas //
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de la gang gis byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kun 'dzin pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i gzungs kyi sgo'i chos rim par phye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang gis byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kun 'dzin pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i gzungs kyi sgo'i chos rim par phye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the section of the Dharma of the dhāraṇī gateway through which bodhisattvas become skilled in retaining all Dharmas?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dag pa'i ye shes mkhas pa la gnas pa dang / spobs pa'i ye shes la gnas nas don gyi rjes su song ba'i blos chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta zhing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dag pa'i ye shes mkhas pa la gnas pa dang / spobs pa'i ye shes la gnas nas don gyi rjes su song ba'i blos chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta zhing /
translated: the bodhisattvas who abide in the wisdom of complete purity and in the wisdom of eloquence will, with a mind that accords with the meaning, observe the essential nature of phenomena.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa med pa /🔽ming med pa /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa med pa / ming med pa /
translated: All these phenomena are essentially devoid of abiding.🔽They are nameless,

original: mtshan ma med pa /🔽mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa / mnyam pa med pa /
translated: signless,🔽unequal,

original: mthun pa med pa /
analyzed: mthun pa med pa /
translated: uncommon,

original: gzugs med pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: and not formless.

original: de dag ni brjod du med pa las @82b yang dag par 'gro ba bkri ba'i tshig gis bstan te /
analyzed: de dag ni brjod du med pa las @82b yang dag par 'gro ba bkri ba'i tshig gis bstan te /
translated: They are taught through words that lead beyond the inexpressible.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni bstan du med pa /🔽'ong ba med pa /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni bstan du med pa / 'ong ba med pa /
translated: The nature of phenomena is unteachable,🔽it does not come,

original: 'gro ba med pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa /
translated: and it does not go.

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: It is without syllables.

original: yi ge rnam par dag pa ste lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge rnam par dag pa ste lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: It is the purity of syllables, spontaneously present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: The nature of phenomena is similar to and the same as space.

original: de'i phyir chos de dag thams cad ni rdzun pa mngon par ma grub pa ste; nam mkha' ltar yongs su brtag cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de dag thams cad ni rdzun pa mngon par ma grub pa ste; nam mkha' ltar yongs su brtag cing /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are false and insubstantial, like space.

original: brjod pa rnam pa med cing rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa rnam pa med cing rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: They are beyond conceptual elaboration and are pure like space.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni sgo med pa'i sgo yin pas /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni sgo med pa'i sgo yin pas /
translated: All phenomena are doors without doors.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad kyi sgo ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad kyi sgo ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The door of all phenomena is pure.

original: shin tu nyon mongs pa med cing nye bar nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu nyon mongs pa med cing nye bar nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is utterly free of afflictions and is afflicted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni shin tu skye ba med cing mngon par grub pa med de /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni shin tu skye ba med cing mngon par grub pa med de /
translated: Why is this?🔽The nature of phenomena is utterly unborn and unestablished.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de la ni skye ba'am mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de la ni skye ba'am mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of phenomena is such that there is no birth or establishment.

original: de'i phyir chos de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de dag thams cad ni /
translated: Therefore, all these phenomena

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan zhing bshad de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan zhing bshad de /
translated: are taught and explained as having the nature of non-entityness.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of phenomena is non-entityness.

original: de ltar 'di dag la mngon par zhen pa med na /
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag la mngon par zhen pa med na /
translated: In this way, if one is not attached to them,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa med pa'i chos kyi sgo dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / chos rim par phye ba'i sgo rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa med pa'i chos kyi sgo dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / chos rim par phye ba'i sgo rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattvas’ unattached Dharma gateway, dhāraṇī gateway, and Dharma section gateway will be purified.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called aspects of all phenomena

original: tha snyad kyis 'di ltar rnam pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyis 'di ltar rnam pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: are conventionally said to be ‘aspects’ in this way.

original: rnam pa gang yin pa de @83a *//
analyzed: rnam pa gang yin pa de @83a *//
translated: Whatever is an aspect

original: ni rnam pa med pas na /🔽rnam pa ni byed pa med pa /
analyzed: ni rnam pa med pas na / rnam pa ni byed pa med pa /
translated: is non-aspect.🔽Aspects are without action,

original: rnam par byed pa med pa /
analyzed: rnam par byed pa med pa /
translated: without activity,

original: rjes su chags pa med pa /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa med pa /
translated: without attachment,

original: khong khro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa'o //
translated: and without aversion.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i sgo ni sgo med par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i sgo ni sgo med par bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the gateway of purity is taught as a non-gateway.

original: sgo rnam par dag pa de ni rnam pa med par 'jug pa'i sgo yongs su dag pa yin pas na /
analyzed: sgo rnam par dag pa de ni rnam pa med par 'jug pa'i sgo yongs su dag pa yin pas na /
translated: This pure gateway is the pure gateway to the entrance into the absence of aspects.🔽Thus, what is called an ‘aspect’ is taught to be a non-existent object.

original: de ltar rnam pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i don du bstan to; ;de ltar na ma rig pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i don dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa la 'jug pa'i tshul du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i don du bstan to; ;de ltar na ma rig pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i don dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa la 'jug pa'i tshul du bstan pa yin te /
translated: In this way, it is taught as the meaning to be realized after ignorance, as the entrance into the absence of formation and the absence of aspects.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: sgo 'di ni gzungs rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgo 'di ni gzungs rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: this gateway is the gateway to the purity of dhāraṇī.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: sgo sgo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i sgo lta bur rtogs shing /
analyzed: sgo sgo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i sgo lta bur rtogs shing /
translated: a ‘gateway’ is the realization that all phenomena are like the gateway of space.

original: nam mkha'i sgo ltar snang ba med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i sgo ltar snang ba med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Like the gateway of space, they are beyond appearances.

original: de la gang skye ba dang / gang 'jig pa de dag mnyam pa nyid du rjes su rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de la gang skye ba dang / gang 'jig pa de dag mnyam pa nyid du rjes su rtogs pa na /
translated: When one realizes the equality of what arises and what ceases,

original: rtogs pa yang med /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang med /
translated: there is no realization,

original: nub pa yang med /
analyzed: nub pa yang med /
translated: no disappearance,🔽and

original: kun bzung ba yang med par chos de dag thams cad kun gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun bzung ba yang med par chos de dag thams cad kun gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Without any grasping at all, all these phenomena should be grasped.

original: gzung ba med pa dang / spang ba med pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / mi mnyam pa med pa dang / rdul phra mo tsam gyi chos kyang dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa'i sgor 'jug pa 'di ni rnam pa med pa rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa dang / spang ba med pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / mi mnyam pa med pa dang / rdul phra mo tsam gyi chos kyang dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa'i sgor 'jug pa 'di ni rnam pa med pa rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The entrance to the gateway of the aspect of the non-apprehension of even the most subtle of phenomena is the purity of the absence of aspects.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: rnam pa med pa rnam pa med pa zhes bya ni /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa rnam pa med pa zhes bya ni /
translated: the so-called absence of aspects

original: gang la lus med pa dang / lus su btags @83b pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la lus med pa dang / lus su btags @83b pa med pa ste /
translated: is where there is no body and no designation of a body.

original: rnam pa med pa ni gang la ming gi tshogs med pa dang / tshig gi tshogs kyis btags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni gang la ming gi tshogs med pa dang / tshig gi tshogs kyis btags pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of aspects is where there is no collection of names and no designation by a collection of words.

original: rnam pa med pa ni nam mkha' ltar rnam par bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni nam mkha' ltar rnam par bsgom pa ste /
translated: The absence of aspects is cultivated like space.

original: de ltar don gyi tshul rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar don gyi tshul rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus should the principle of the meaning be realized.

original: nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Space, space—

original: nam mkha' med pas na nam mkha' zhes tshig gi tshogs kyis btags pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' med pas na nam mkha' zhes tshig gi tshogs kyis btags pa'o //
translated: Since space does not exist, it is designated by the term ‘space.’

original: 'di ni gang gis byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gis byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This is how bodhisattvas realize expertise in the way of dhāraṇī.

original: ma rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa rig pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa'i sgo'i chos rim par bye ba yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa rig pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa'i sgo'i chos rim par bye ba yin te /
translated: It is the gateway to the power of the wisdom that is in accord with and consistent with the absence of ignorance.

original: rjes su mthun pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to be in accord with, to be free from dispute, and to be free from delusion,

original: klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas /
translated: the nāga king Anavatapta

original: char gyi rgyun chen po dang / chu chen po gtong ba bzhin du rgyun chad pa med pa'i gzungs kyi gsang sngags kyi tshig gi dgongs pa la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: char gyi rgyun chen po dang / chu chen po gtong ba bzhin du rgyun chad pa med pa'i gzungs kyi gsang sngags kyi tshig gi dgongs pa la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: should be understood to engage in the intended meaning of the dhāraṇī secret mantra words, which are like a great rain and a great river that never cease.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs gzungs zhes bya ba'i gsang tshig 'di dag ji lta bur bstan pa yin /
analyzed: gzungs gzungs zhes bya ba'i gsang tshig 'di dag ji lta bur bstan pa yin /
translated: how are these secret dhāraṇī words taught?

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said this, the bodhisattva Anantamati said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gzungs zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: gzungs zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: the term ‘dhāraṇī’

original: chos rnams dang mtshams sbyor ba la mkhas pa'i tshig bla dvags lags so //
analyzed: chos rnams dang mtshams sbyor ba la mkhas pa'i tshig bla dvags lags so //
translated: is a term for the skill in connecting with the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzungs zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: gzungs zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: the term ‘dhāraṇī’

original: rjes su dran pa'i las kun 'dzin par bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i las kun 'dzin par bgyid pa lags so //
translated: is the retention of the activity of recollection.

original: shes rab kyi gter gyi stobs kyis kun 'dzin pa'i @84a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi gter gyi stobs kyis kun 'dzin pa'i @84a *//
translated: It is the retention of the power of the treasure of insight.

original: gsang tshig gi gzhi 'di dag bstan pa de'i slad du gzungs zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o //
analyzed: gsang tshig gi gzhi 'di dag bstan pa de'i slad du gzungs zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o //
translated: For that reason, it is counted as a dhāraṇī.

original: ye shes la mkhas pa la 'jug pa'i blos de ltar byang chub kyi stobs mtha' yas pa dag kun tu gzung bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: ye shes la mkhas pa la 'jug pa'i blos de ltar byang chub kyi stobs mtha' yas pa dag kun tu gzung bar bgyi ste /
translated: With a mind that engages in the skill of wisdom, one should thus retain the infinite power of awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag ni ji ltar sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i slad du ye shes mtha' yas pa ston pa la mkhas pa'i stobs rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / chos kyi rgyun rnam par 'byed par bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: bdag ni ji ltar sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i slad du ye shes mtha' yas pa ston pa la mkhas pa'i stobs rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / chos kyi rgyun rnam par 'byed par bgyid pa lags so //
translated: I am skilled in revealing infinite wisdom in order to benefit all beings, and I continuously exert the power of the uninterrupted stream of Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzungs kyi sgo 'di ni nam mkha' ltar yangs shing mnyam pa ma mchis pa'i sgo chen po lags te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo 'di ni nam mkha' ltar yangs shing mnyam pa ma mchis pa'i sgo chen po lags te /
translated: this dhāraṇī gateway is as vast as space, a great gateway without equal.

original: de'i slad du de ni tshad ma mchis pa dang / mtha' ma mchis pa'i tshig gis brjod do //
analyzed: de'i slad du de ni tshad ma mchis pa dang / mtha' ma mchis pa'i tshig gis brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is described with immeasurable and limitless words.

original: brjod pa mnyam pa nyid dang / rjes su bzung ba dang / rjes su bstan pa zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: brjod pa mnyam pa nyid dang / rjes su bzung ba dang / rjes su bstan pa zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: What is called ‘the sameness of expression, acceptance, and teaching’

original: ston mkhas pa dang mnyam pa ma mchis pa zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o //
analyzed: ston mkhas pa dang mnyam pa ma mchis pa zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o //
translated: is counted as ‘skillful teaching and being without equal.’

original: yi ge'i rnam par dbye ba yongs su rdzogs pas nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge'i rnam par dbye ba yongs su rdzogs pas nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By perfecting the analysis of letters, the correct understanding of language will be perfected.

original: don la nye bar rtog cing ston pa la mkhas pas don so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //🔽chos rnams kyi rnam par nges pa rab tu ston pa la mkhas pas chos so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don la nye bar rtog cing ston pa la mkhas pas don so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro // chos rnams kyi rnam par nges pa rab tu ston pa la mkhas pas chos so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being skilled in teaching the meaning, one will perfect the correct understanding of the meaning.🔽By being skilled in teaching the definitive classification of phenomena, one will perfect the correct understanding of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi sgo la spobs pa yongs su dag pas @84b spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi sgo la spobs pa yongs su dag pas @84b spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By having pure eloquence in the gateway of phenomena, one will perfect the correct understanding of eloquence.

original: sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i slad du byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yongs su gzung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i slad du byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yongs su gzung ste /
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings, one should uphold great love and great compassion.

original: rjes su bzung nas kyang gzhan shes la gzhan ston par mi bgyid par spros pa ma mchis pa'i btang snyoms rten par bgyid do //
analyzed: rjes su bzung nas kyang gzhan shes la gzhan ston par mi bgyid par spros pa ma mchis pa'i btang snyoms rten par bgyid do //
translated: Having upheld them, one should rely on the unelaborated equanimity that does not engage in teaching others or understanding others.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: don mtha' yas pa la mkhas pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i tshul la mkhas pa'i chos rim par bye ba 'di dag ni /
analyzed: don mtha' yas pa la mkhas pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i tshul la mkhas pa'i chos rim par bye ba 'di dag ni /
translated: these ten million Dharma stages of expertise in the limitless meaning and expertise in the method of the dhāraṇī gateway

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal gyi sgo nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal gyi sgo nas byung ba'o //
translated: and has come forth from the mouth of the Tathagata.🔽

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: It has come forth from the mouth of the Tathagata.

original: kyis byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: kyis byang chub sems dpa' bkod pa mtha' yas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: The Lord then said to the Bodhisattva Vairocana:🔽“Vairocana,

original: sgo sgo zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dvags yin no //
analyzed: sgo sgo zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: ‘gate’ is a term for the Tathagata’s wisdom of omniscience.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Vairocana,

original: gang las chos 'di dag ston cing brjod par 'gyur ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang byung gi ye shes gzigs pa'i sgo shin tu rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: gang las chos 'di dag ston cing brjod par 'gyur ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang byung gi ye shes gzigs pa'i sgo shin tu rnam par dag pa /
translated: from that gate of the Tathagata’s pure vision of self-arisen wisdom,

original: sgo mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pa la gnas pa /🔽gnas pa med pa mi gnas pa'i tshul gyi chos mang po 'dzin par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sgo mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pa la gnas pa / gnas pa med pa mi gnas pa'i tshul gyi chos mang po 'dzin par snang ba yin no //
translated: the infinite gate of purity,

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: many teachings appear, held in a manner that is not a basis, not a location.🔽Vairocana,

original: ngas chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ngas chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: I have explained that all phenomena are the phenomena of the Buddha.

original: gang chos thams cad rjes su rtogs pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad rjes su rtogs pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ste /
translated: The realization of all phenomena is called the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis chos thams cad kyi @85a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis chos thams cad kyi @85a *//
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha comprehends the nature of all phenomena as being the same.

original: rang bzhin mnyam par thugs su chud pa de'i phyir chos 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yin no //🔽chos so cog rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad khong du chud pa zhes bstan pa yang chos rnams rjes su rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin mnyam par thugs su chud pa de'i phyir chos 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yin no // chos so cog rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad khong du chud pa zhes bstan pa yang chos rnams rjes su rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, these phenomena are the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rjes su rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rjes su rtogs pa yin te /
translated: “In order to realize all phenomena, one should comprehend all phenomena.” This teaching on the realization of all phenomena is the realization of the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: chos thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it includes all phenomena.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs 'di lta bu ni bshad pa dang / bsngags pa dang / brjod pa dang / rab tu brjod pa dang / dper bstan pa thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin /
analyzed: gzungs 'di lta bu ni bshad pa dang / bsngags pa dang / brjod pa dang / rab tu brjod pa dang / dper bstan pa thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin /
translated: this dhāraṇī includes all explanations, praises, expressions, descriptions, and illustrations.

original: nang du 'dus pa dang / gtsor bor gyur pa dang / snying por gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa dang / gtsor bor gyur pa dang / snying por gyur pa yin te /
translated: It is included within, is foremost, and is the essence.

original: bsngags pa dang / bshad pa dang / dper ston pa thams cad ni yi ge'i rnam par rig pas rjod par byed /
analyzed: bsngags pa dang / bshad pa dang / dper ston pa thams cad ni yi ge'i rnam par rig pas rjod par byed /
translated: All praise, explanations, and examples are expressed through the knowledge of letters.

original: ston par byed /
analyzed: ston par byed /
translated: They are taught,

original: rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: and they are made clear.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽de la yi ge rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / de la yi ge rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: aa zhes bya ba sngon du 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba sngon du 'gro ba yin la /
translated: the knowledge of letters begins with the syllable a

original: yi ge bstan pa ni ha zhes bya bas mthar gtugs pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge bstan pa ni ha zhes bya bas mthar gtugs pa yin no //
translated: and ends with the syllable ha.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: dper na / mngal du bu chags shing 'dzin pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na / mngal du bu chags shing 'dzin pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni ma yin la /
translated: for example, the mother is the prerequisite for conceiving and holding a child in the womb,

original: sa bon nye bar 'jog pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni pha yin /
analyzed: sa bon nye bar 'jog pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni pha yin /
translated: while the father is the prerequisite for planting the seed.

original: phung po'i na tshod 'gyur ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni skye ba yin /
analyzed: phung po'i na tshod 'gyur ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni skye ba yin /
translated: Birth is the prerequisite for the aging of the aggregates.

original: de'i 'og tu yan lag mtha' dag gi dbyibs rnam par phye ba dang / skye mched rnam par phye ba dang / dbang po rnam par phye @85b ba dang / dbang po yongs su smin pa'i dbyibs rnam par phye ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon par 'grub pa ltar rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa thams cad kyi sngon du yi ge'i phyi mo 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yan lag mtha' dag gi dbyibs rnam par phye ba dang / skye mched rnam par phye ba dang / dbang po rnam par phye @85b ba dang / dbang po yongs su smin pa'i dbyibs rnam par phye ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon par 'grub pa ltar rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa thams cad kyi sngon du yi ge'i phyi mo 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Then, after that, the arrangement of all the limbs, the arrangement of the sense-spheres, the arrangement of the faculties, and the arrangement of the faculties that have matured—all of these are accomplished. In the same way, the alphabet precedes all the arrangements.

original: de la yi ge'i phyi mo aa zhes bya ba gsal ba nye bar gnas pa ni sngon du 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: de la yi ge'i phyi mo aa zhes bya ba gsal ba nye bar gnas pa ni sngon du 'gro ba yin /
translated: In this regard, the letter A is the clear manifestation that precedes.

original: ha zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa yin la /
analyzed: ha zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa yin la /
translated: The letter Ha is the culmination.

original: yi ge gzhan dag ni de'i khongs su gtogs shing rjes su 'brang ba dang / rjes su 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge gzhan dag ni de'i khongs su gtogs shing rjes su 'brang ba dang / rjes su 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The other letters are included in that, and they follow and are connected with it.

original: 'di ni gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pa bstan zhing brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pa bstan zhing brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation and expression of the entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: 'dus byas su gtogs pa thams cad kyi 'jig pa gang yin pa de yang nye bar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas su gtogs pa thams cad kyi 'jig pa gang yin pa de yang nye bar brtag par bya ste /
translated: The destruction of all that is included in the conditioned should be examined.

original: dper na / yi ge kha zhes bya ba dang / yang zhes bya ba de dag nye bar sbyar nas /
analyzed: dper na / yi ge kha zhes bya ba dang / yang zhes bya ba de dag nye bar sbyar nas /
translated: For example, when the letters “ka” and “ya” are combined,

original: yi ge 'bru bslab pa'i mthar phyin nas dor ba ltar srid pa'i yan lag tu nye bar gnas pa'i 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad 'jig pa'i sgo nas zad pa nyid du ston pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'bru bslab pa'i mthar phyin nas dor ba ltar srid pa'i yan lag tu nye bar gnas pa'i 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad 'jig pa'i sgo nas zad pa nyid du ston pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: the letter “ka” is taught to be exhausted by way of destruction, like the letter “ya” that is discarded after the completion of the training in the alphabet.

original: dper na / ldan pa ni 'gog pa dang rnam par bsten pa ltar srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang mtshungs par ldan zhing /
analyzed: dper na / ldan pa ni 'gog pa dang rnam par bsten pa ltar srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang mtshungs par ldan zhing /
translated: For example, when “possession” is combined with “cessation” and “abandonment,”

original: srid par gtogs par ldan pa gnyis nye bar ngas pa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: srid par gtogs par ldan pa gnyis nye bar ngas pa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: all the possessions included in existence and the two possessions that are combined with the fetters of existence are like that.

original: de la dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i ldan pa gnyis nye bar gnas pa'i chos thams cad kun tu btags nas /
analyzed: de la dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i ldan pa gnyis nye bar gnas pa'i chos thams cad kun tu btags nas /
translated: There, the two possessions of entity and non-entity are combined with all phenomena that are present.

original: mthar gyis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i sgo yongs su sbyang bar bya ste /🔽'di ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa ston @86a *//
analyzed: mthar gyis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i sgo yongs su sbyang bar bya ste / 'di ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa ston @86a *//
translated: “Finally, they should train in the gateway of the effortless.

original: pa'i chos kyi sgor 'jug cing /
analyzed: pa'i chos kyi sgor 'jug cing /
translated: This is the gateway to the Dharma that reveals arising and destruction.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rim par phye ba ston pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rim par phye ba ston pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is the gateway to dhāraṇī that reveals the unfolding, and it is the gateway that brings about the perfection of the bodhisattvas’ skill in means.

original: 'di ltar yi ge'i phyi mi rnams las yi ge dang po smos nas rim gyis dha zhes bya ba dang / ha zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa chub par smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge'i phyi mi rnams las yi ge dang po smos nas rim gyis dha zhes bya ba dang / ha zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa chub par smos te /
translated: In this way, they should recite the first letter of the subsequent letters, and so on, until they reach the letter dha and the letter ha.

original: bshad pa dang / sgras yang dag par bstan pa'i sgo nas gsang sngags kyi dgongs pa la 'jug par bya zhing /
analyzed: bshad pa dang / sgras yang dag par bstan pa'i sgo nas gsang sngags kyi dgongs pa la 'jug par bya zhing /
translated: They should enter the intention of the mantra through explanation and sound.

original: thogs pa med par chos dang mthun par 'jug pa'i yang dag par 'gro ba yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med par chos dang mthun par 'jug pa'i yang dag par 'gro ba yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: They should also contemplate the correct approach that is in accord with the Dharma and is free of obstruction.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la dper na /
analyzed: de la dper na /
translated: it is like this:

original: yi ge'i phyi mi rnams rnam par brtags na yi ge aa zhes bya ba dang por smos la /
analyzed: yi ge'i phyi mi rnams rnam par brtags na yi ge aa zhes bya ba dang por smos la /
translated: If you examine the letters that follow, you will find that the letter A is mentioned first.

original: de las gzhan pa'i yi ge rnams kyang rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yi ge rnams kyang rnam par brtags te /
translated: And if you examine the other letters,

original: ying  la byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rim pa dha zhes bya ba dang / ha zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar smos shing 'dri bar byed na /
analyzed: ying  la byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rim pa dha zhes bya ba dang / ha zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar smos shing 'dri bar byed na /
translated: you will find that they are mentioned and written in a sequence that accords with the order in which they are mentally produced, from the letter D to the letter H.

original: de las lhag par btags pa'i yi ge ci yang med pa ltar 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i yid la byed pa mngon par grub pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par btags pa'i yi ge ci yang med pa ltar 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i yid la byed pa mngon par grub pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as there are no letters beyond those, in the same way, all that is included in the compounded is also established as being without duality.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Vairocana,

original: gang gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba de la ni yang dag par na yi ger gdags pa cung zad kyang med cing rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba de la ni yang dag par na yi ger gdags pa cung zad kyang med cing rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: that which is free from conceptualization is, in reality, not even slightly designated as a letter, and there is not even the slightest conceptualization of an intrinsic essence.”

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa med @86b pa de la ni 'du byed du gdags pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa med @86b pa de la ni 'du byed du gdags pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Where there is no discursive thought, there is no designation of formative predispositions whatsoever.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos thams cad shes pa gang yin pa de la yi ge'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa de ni yi ge mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir rnam pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad shes pa gang yin pa de la yi ge'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa de ni yi ge mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir rnam pa med pa yin no //
translated: the awareness of all phenomena is devoid of aspects, for it is not established in terms of letters.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: aa zhes bya ba yang dag pas kun nas bslang ba ni ci yang med de /🔽de ltar 'dus byas su gtogs pa thams cad rnam pa med par 'jug par lta bar bya zhing mngon par 'du byed pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba yang dag pas kun nas bslang ba ni ci yang med de / de ltar 'dus byas su gtogs pa thams cad rnam pa med par 'jug par lta bar bya zhing mngon par 'du byed pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is aroused by the syllable a.

original: phung po thams cad spang bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: phung po thams cad spang bar yang bya'o //
translated: Thus, all that is included within the conditioned should be regarded as engaging in the absence of aspects and should be relinquished in order to be free from formation.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di ni gzungs rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa'i sgo yin /
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa'i sgo yin /
translated: this is the gateway to expertise in the purity of dhāraṇī.

original: kun nas 'dzin pa'i sgo yin /
analyzed: kun nas 'dzin pa'i sgo yin /
translated: It is the gateway to retention.

original: chos rim par phye ba'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: chos rim par phye ba'i sgo yin te /
translated: It is the gateway to the sections of the Dharma.

original: de la bslab na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kun nas rmongs pa med pa'i bya ba la mngon par 'phags par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de la bslab na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kun nas rmongs pa med pa'i bya ba la mngon par 'phags par yang 'gyur /
translated: If they train in this, bodhisattvas will become superior in their activity, which is not confused.

original: sems can rnams chos kyis phongs pa med par byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can rnams chos kyis phongs pa med par byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will ensure that sentient beings are not deprived of the Dharma.

original: de dag 'du shes su gyur pa'i sems nye bar blangs nas gnas par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag 'du shes su gyur pa'i sems nye bar blangs nas gnas par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not take up and abide in a mind that is conceptual.

original: 'du shes yid la byed pa rnam par spangs nas sems can rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir skye bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du shes yid la byed pa rnam par spangs nas sems can rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir skye bar yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be born out of compassion for sentient beings, having abandoned conceptual mental activity.

original: chos bla na med pa shes pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir blos chos kyi snang ba kun tu stong bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: chos bla na med pa shes pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir blos chos kyi snang ba kun tu stong bar yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be able to illuminate the Dharma with their minds in order to become skilled in ascertaining the knowledge of the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod rjes su dran par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod rjes su dran par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be able to recall the Thus-Gone One’s treasury of Dharma.

original: chos rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /🔽blos rtogs pa'i @87a *//
analyzed: chos rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / blos rtogs pa'i @87a *//
translated: They will be able to understand the Dharma.

original: tshul mtha' yas pa la mkhas pa khong du chud par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul mtha' yas pa la mkhas pa khong du chud par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be able to understand the infinite ways of understanding with their minds.”

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dzin pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dzin pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: chos thams cad ming tsam du shes par byas nas /🔽sgra dang / yang dag par 'gro ba dang / brjod pa sna tshogs kyang khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam du shes par byas nas / sgra dang / yang dag par 'gro ba dang / brjod pa sna tshogs kyang khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: bodhisattvas should understand that all phenomena are mere names.

original: gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: They should comprehend the various sounds, expressions, and languages and engage with the skill in the way of dhāraṇī.

original: ji ltar gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya zhe na /
translated: How should they engage with the skill in the way of dhāraṇī?

original: gang yul na mi gnas shing phyogs na mi gnas la /
analyzed: gang yul na mi gnas shing phyogs na mi gnas la /
translated: They should understand that it does not abide in any place or direction.

original: chos gang gi khongs su yang ma gtogs pa nang du yang ma 'dus shing /
analyzed: chos gang gi khongs su yang ma gtogs pa nang du yang ma 'dus shing /
translated: It is not included in any phenomenon, and it is not internal.

original: brjod pa dang / yang dag par brjod pa mnyam par gnas pa 'di ni ming du btags pa tsam du zad par rjes su rtogs nas chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i tshig ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang / yang dag par brjod pa mnyam par gnas pa 'di ni ming du btags pa tsam du zad par rjes su rtogs nas chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i tshig ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It is merely a designation, and it is the same as what is expressed and what is not expressed.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos ni thams cad kyang rnam pa med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos ni thams cad kyang rnam pa med pa /
translated: The Dharma of the Tathāgatas is also without aspects,

original: brjod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa med pa yin no //
translated: and is inexpressible.

original: 'di ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sa yin te /
translated: This is the stage of the powers and fearlessnesses.

original: chos gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad sgo 'di nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad sgo 'di nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: Any Dharma whatsoever should be taught through this approach.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos rnams rnam pa du ma nyid du bstan mod kyi /🔽chos rnams la ni gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos rnams rnam pa du ma nyid du bstan mod kyi / chos rnams la ni gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: The Tathāgata has indeed taught the manifold aspects of phenomena,

original: tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: but phenomena do not exist as singular or manifold.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa dang med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa dang med pa yin no //
translated: These phenomena are all unborn and nonexistent.

original: @87b 'di ltar chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: @87b 'di ltar chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are taught to be emptiness.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid yin pa de dag ni mtshan ma dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid yin pa de dag ni mtshan ma dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Those that are emptiness are free from marks.

original: gang dag mtshan ma dang bral ba de dag ni smon pa med pa dang / rab tu shes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mtshan ma dang bral ba de dag ni smon pa med pa dang / rab tu shes pa med pa yin no //
translated: Those that are free from marks are free from aspirations and free from cognition.

original: chos gang dag stong pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral ba dang / smon lam gyis dbang ma bsgyur ba dang / shes pa med pa dang / bye brag tu shes pa med pa de dag ni yod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang dag stong pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral ba dang / smon lam gyis dbang ma bsgyur ba dang / shes pa med pa dang / bye brag tu shes pa med pa de dag ni yod ces bya ba'am /
translated: Those phenomena that are empty, signless, and wishless, not subject to karma, not subject to action, not subject to being known, and not subject to being specifically known—are they existent or nonexistent?”🔽

original: med ces bya bar brjod par bya ba yang ma yin la /🔽med do zhes tha snyad gdags par bya ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: med ces bya bar brjod par bya ba yang ma yin la / med do zhes tha snyad gdags par bya ba yang ma yin /
translated: “Those phenomena that are empty, free of marks, not subject to wishes, not conscious, and not objects of consciousness are not to be described as existent or🔽nonexistent.🔽They are not to be described as nonexistent.🔽One should not cling to the idea that they are nonexistent.

original: de la med do snyam du mngon par zhen par bya ba yang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la med do snyam du mngon par zhen par bya ba yang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad don dam par mngon par zhen pa med par gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad don dam par mngon par zhen pa med par gsungs te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has said that all phenomena are ultimately free of clinging.

original: 'di ltar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis mngon par zhen pa dang / ji ltar gang du mngon par zhen pa de dag thams cad ni gsog /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis mngon par zhen pa dang / ji ltar gang du mngon par zhen pa de dag thams cad ni gsog /
translated: In this way, clinging, that which is clung to, and the way in which something is clung to are all hollow,

original: gsob / bslu ba'i chos can g-yo ba rlom pa ste spros pa yin no //
analyzed: gsob / bslu ba'i chos can g-yo ba rlom pa ste spros pa yin no //
translated: hollow, deceptive, unstable, and presumptuous—they are conceptual elaborations.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos 'di dag ston pa la ltos /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ston pa la ltos /
translated: It depends on the teaching of this Dharma.

original: gang zhig gis ci yang ma bstan tam /
analyzed: gang zhig gis ci yang ma bstan tam /
translated: What if nothing is taught?

original: yongs su dag par bstan kyang rung /
analyzed: yongs su dag par bstan kyang rung /
translated: Or if it is taught in a purified way?

original: 'on kyang de la ston pa po yin par brjod dgos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la ston pa po yin par brjod dgos te /
translated: Still, it must be called a teacher.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: 'di lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: this is how the Thus-Gone One’s teaching of the Dharma occurs.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: 'di ni tshul 'di kun shes pa yang dkon te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul 'di kun shes pa yang dkon te /
translated: it is rare to find someone who understands this approach.🔽Now, those who are present before me,

original: da ltar khyod la sogs pa nga'i mngon sum du gyur cing /🔽kun shes @88a *//
analyzed: da ltar khyod la sogs pa nga'i mngon sum du gyur cing / kun shes @88a *//
translated: such as you,

original: par byed pa'i sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams chos 'di la mos pa mang bar zad do //
analyzed: par byed pa'i sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams chos 'di la mos pa mang bar zad do //
translated: who are established in the practice of understanding, have a great deal of interest in this Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus phyi ma'i tshe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus phyi ma'i tshe na /
translated: in the future,

original: sems can chos 'di lta bu dag kun shes par 'gyur ba ni nyung ste /
analyzed: sems can chos 'di lta bu dag kun shes par 'gyur ba ni nyung ste /
translated: there will be few beings who understand this kind of Dharma.

original: gang dag da ltar 'di na nga'i mngon sum du gyur cing /
analyzed: gang dag da ltar 'di na nga'i mngon sum du gyur cing /
translated: Those who are present before me now

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and who benefit and bring happiness to many beings

original: bdag cag gis phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi tshul gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi tshul gzung bar bya'o //
translated: “We will uphold the way of the Dharma of the Tathāgata in the future.”

original: zhes go bgos pa de dag ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: zhes go bgos pa de dag ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Those who have made such a promise will uphold this Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas shing /
translated: those bodhisattvas who have served the victorious ones of the past,

original: zab mo la mos pa /
analyzed: zab mo la mos pa /
translated: who are devoted to the profound,

original: chos zab mo'i tshul la mkhas pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo'i tshul la mkhas pa /
translated: who are skilled in the way of the profound Dharma,

original: mnyan pa don du gnyer zhing mos pa de dag ni chos 'di 'dzin pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan pa don du gnyer zhing mos pa de dag ni chos 'di 'dzin pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and who are eager to listen and devoted to it will acquire this Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa /
translated: the Tathāgata has served the victorious ones of the past,

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
translated: has attended to many buddhas,

original: zab mo'i tshul gyis gzhi blangs pa /
analyzed: zab mo'i tshul gyis gzhi blangs pa /
