translated: has taken the profound way as his basis,

original: dad pa can dge ba'i chos la mos pa mang ba /
analyzed: dad pa can dge ba'i chos la mos pa mang ba /
translated: is faithful, and is devoted to virtuous qualities.

original: rgya chen po la yang dag par gnas pa /
analyzed: rgya chen po la yang dag par gnas pa /
translated: He abides in the vast,

original: theg pa chen po don du gnyer ba la brtson pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po don du gnyer ba la brtson pa /
translated: strives for the pursuit of the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / khams gsum pa thams cad don du mi gnyer ba /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / khams gsum pa thams cad don du mi gnyer ba /
translated: the vehicle of the hearers, and all the three realms.

original: chos zab mo spyod pa rnams la sngon ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshul zab mo yangs pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo spyod pa rnams la sngon ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshul zab mo yangs pa /
translated: “Anantavyūha, the Thus-Gone One repeatedly teaches this profound Dharma way, which is profound and vast,

original: tshad med pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa /
translated: boundless,

original: blta dka' ba /
analyzed: blta dka' ba /
translated: difficult to see,

original: rtogs @88b par dka' ba /🔽byis pa thos pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: rtogs @88b par dka' ba / byis pa thos pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa /
translated: difficult to realize,🔽and difficult for the childish who are not endowed with learning and so forth and who are attached to grasp the depths of.

original: mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis gting dpag dka' ba 'di sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba dang / bde bar bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang du ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis gting dpag dka' ba 'di sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba dang / bde bar bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang du ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: He does so in order to benefit and bring happiness to all beings,

original: 'di don du mi gnyer ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di don du mi gnyer ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for those who are not interested in it.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni khyod la sogs pa lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni khyod la sogs pa lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is teaching this Dharma discourse to you and the rest of the world with its gods, who are endowed with proper conduct and discipline,

original: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba /
translated: who regard even the slightest unwholesome action with fear,

original: 'jigs pa thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'dod cing snyom las med pa rnams la chos ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'dod cing snyom las med pa rnams la chos ston par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who wish to be completely liberated from all fears and who are not lazy.

original: de'i ched du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: de'i ched du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: For that purpose, the Thus-Gone One, when he was previously practicing bodhisattva conduct,

original: chos zab mo 'di la bskal pa bye ba phrag du mar bslabs nas nges par byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos zab mo 'di la bskal pa bye ba phrag du mar bslabs nas nges par byung ba yin no //
translated: trained in this profound Dharma for many millions of eons and then emerged.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis ye shes chen po bla na med pa mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rigs rgyun mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi tshul 'di ston par mdzad /🔽byin gyis rlob par mdzad cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis ye shes chen po bla na med pa mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rigs rgyun mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi tshul 'di ston par mdzad /🔽byin gyis rlob par mdzad cing /
translated: the Thus-Gone One teaches this way of the Dharma in order to bless and empower it, so that all beings may turn the unsurpassed wheel of Dharma and behold the unsurpassed great wisdom of all beings, and so that the lineage of omniscient wisdom may be unbroken.

original: ci nas kyang sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzungs kyi tshig gi chos 'di rgyas par bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul 'di @89a *//🔽la rjes su yi rang bar 'gyur ba de ltar ston par mdzad /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzungs kyi tshig gi chos 'di rgyas par bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul 'di @89a *// la rjes su yi rang bar 'gyur ba de ltar ston par mdzad /
translated: and in order to spread the Dharma of the dhāraṇī words and rejoice in this way of Dharma,

original: brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: brjod par mdzad do //
translated: the Thus-Gone One teaches and explains it.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽de la khyod la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su slob pa'i tshul can dag gis sems can dad pa can rnams la chos bstan pa dang / chos rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / de la khyod la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su slob pa'i tshul can dag gis sems can dad pa can rnams la chos bstan pa dang / chos rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Anantavyūha,🔽you and others who follow the Thus-Gone One’s way should teach the Dharma to faithful sentient beings and illuminate the Dharma.

original: ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar thos pa'i chos rgyas par 'khor rnams la ston par byed /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar thos pa'i chos rgyas par 'khor rnams la ston par byed /
translated: In order to do so, bodhisattvas should teach the Dharma as they have heard it to their retinues in detail.

original: rab tu gsal bar byed pa de lta de ltar chos la gnas pa nyid du bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du gzungs thob pa rnyed par gyur zhing /🔽gzungs thob pa des kyang tshegs chung dus chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed pa de lta de ltar chos la gnas pa nyid du bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du gzungs thob pa rnyed par gyur zhing / gzungs thob pa des kyang tshegs chung dus chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa /
translated: The more you illuminate it, the more you will accomplish the state of abiding in the Dharma, approach the wisdom of the buddhas, and quickly attain the dhāraṇī.🔽Through attaining the dhāraṇī, you will easily uphold the pure,

original: gsal ba / dkar po rnams kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur bar nan tan gyis shig /
analyzed: gsal ba / dkar po rnams kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur bar nan tan gyis shig /
translated: clear, and virtuous Dharma gateways.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /🔽gang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun tu sbyor ba yang ma yin /🔽rnam par 'bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste / gang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun tu sbyor ba yang ma yin / rnam par 'bral ba ma yin te /
translated: all phenomena are pure by nature.🔽The nature of phenomena is neither a fetter nor a separation.

original: ldan pa dang mi ldan par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa dang mi ldan par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not something that can be said to be either connected or unconnected.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: chos rnams la chos yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos yod pa ma yin no //
translated: phenomena do not contain phenomena.

original: yod pa ma yin pa ni gang du yang yang dag par gdags su med de /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni gang du yang yang dag par gdags su med de /
translated: That which does not exist cannot be designated anywhere.

original: sems can rnams kyis kun shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyu nges par ston pa dang / rgyu zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang @89b bral ba dang / 'gog par 'dogs pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis kun shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyu nges par ston pa dang / rgyu zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang @89b bral ba dang / 'gog par 'dogs pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: except for the teaching of the cause for the understanding of sentient beings, the exhaustion of the cause, the freedom from desire, and the designation of cessation.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la ni rgyu yang med /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la ni rgyu yang med /
translated: the nature and characteristics of phenomena are such that they are not causes,

original: rgyu zad pa yang med /
analyzed: rgyu zad pa yang med /
translated: they do not exhaust causes,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang med /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang med /
translated: they are not free from desire,

original: 'gog pa yang med na /
analyzed: 'gog pa yang med na /
translated: and they are not cessation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa yongs su dag pa de lta bu 'byung ba la ltos ////🔽bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa yongs su dag pa de lta bu 'byung ba la ltos //// bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Consider, then, the appearance of the Thus-Gone One’s pure teaching of the Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du rtog na yang de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du rtog na yang de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: those who conceive of the Thus-Gone One as the nature of phenomena do not see the Thus-Gone One in a pure way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyang ma yin /
translated: And why?🔽The Thus-Gone One is not a phenomenon,

original: chos ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is he not a phenomenon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang gis kyang rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang gis kyang rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur na /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is not established by any phenomenon,

original: chos ma yin pas rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: so how could he be established by something that is not a phenomenon?

original: 'di lta bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is impossible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos su gdags pa las yang dag par 'das pas de ni cir yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos su gdags pa las yang dag par 'das pas de ni cir yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The Thus-Gone One transcends the designation of phenomena, so he cannot be described in any way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brjod pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brjod pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is pure in his expression,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni zab pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni zab pa /
translated: and therefore the Thus-Gone One is profound,

original: rgya che ba /🔽tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba / tshad med pa yin no //
translated: vast,🔽and immeasurable.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa yang med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa yang med /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is not an object of cognition related to form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pa yang med na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pa yang med na /
translated: feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: gang dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs par 'dogs par @90a *//
analyzed: gang dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs par 'dogs par @90a *//
translated: By what means is the Thus-Gone One designated?

original: 'gyur / gang gis ni 'dogs par shes /
analyzed: 'gyur / gang gis ni 'dogs par shes /
translated: Who is it that designates him?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs zad pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa zad pa'i rnam par grol ba dang yang dag par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs zad pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa zad pa'i rnam par grol ba dang yang dag par ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is endowed with the liberation that is the exhaustion of form, and with the liberation that is the exhaustion of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan /🔽rab tu mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan / rab tu mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not conjoined with or disjoined from form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su rlom par mi mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su rlom par mi mdzad /
translated: The Tathāgata does not conceive of or elaborate on the compounded or the uncompounded.

original: spros par mi mdzad de; nye bar len pa gnyis dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: spros par mi mdzad de; nye bar len pa gnyis dang mi ldan no //
translated: He is not conjoined with or disjoined from the two acquisitions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan rab tu mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan rab tu mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not conjoined with or disjoined from the acquisition of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsa ba chad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsa ba chad pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is cut off at the root.

original: chos thams cad kyang rtsa ba dang bral ba /🔽spros pa med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rtsa ba dang bral ba / spros pa med pa /
translated: All phenomena are also free from a root.🔽They are free from conceptual elaboration.🔽They are free from movement.

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: They are free from agitation.

original: mi g-yo ba chu bo las brgal ba /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba chu bo las brgal ba /
translated: They are free from a river to cross.

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: They are unsurpassed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul kho na la gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul kho na la gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: They abide only in the domain of the buddhas.

original: mi gnas pa'o zhes brjod par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'o zhes brjod par ni mi bya'o //
translated: However, it should not be said that they do not abide.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang yang thugs su mi chud; len par mi mdzad /🔽nye bar rtog par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang yang thugs su mi chud; len par mi mdzad / nye bar rtog par mi mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One does not cognize, grasp, or conceptualize any phenomenon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bar chos ston pa yang de dag 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bar chos ston pa yang de dag 'dra ste /
translated: The Dharma teaching is similar to the Thus-Gone One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs par ldan pa mi mnga' @90b ba ni 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs par ldan pa mi mnga' @90b ba ni 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One, who is not associated with anything, teaches the Dharma in order to be free from anything to be associated with.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de dang 'dra la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi tshul yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de dang 'dra la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi tshul yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par ston te /
translated: All phenomena are similar to the Thus-Gone One’s true nature, and the way of the suchness of all phenomena is taught just as it is.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dang / chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid du 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dang / chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid du 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Thus-Gone One and all phenomena are designated as suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta bar chos thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta bar chos thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as suchness is, so are all phenomena, and the reality of the Thus-Gone One and the reality of all phenomena are the same.

original: de ni gnyis su med gnyis su byar med la /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med gnyis su byar med la /
translated: They are nondual and indivisible.

original: gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: They are not the same,

original: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they different.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: the Thus-Gone One does not abide in conceptualization and discursive thought.

original: chos thams cad las mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir chos bla na med pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad las mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir chos bla na med pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: In order to not transgress any phenomenon, he teaches the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gang yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i chos de 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gang yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i chos de 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Thus-Gone One does not observe any phenomenon that is to be transcended.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the Tathāgata fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: chos 'ga' yang mngon par rdzogs par thugs su ma chud /
analyzed: chos 'ga' yang mngon par rdzogs par thugs su ma chud /
translated: he does not fully awaken to any dharma at all.

original: ma mkhyen / rnam par ma mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma mkhyen / rnam par ma mkhyen to //
translated: He does not know, does not understand, and does not comprehend any dharma.

original: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos thams cad kyang mi dmigs te /🔽gang mi dmigs pa de la rjes su @91a *//
analyzed: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos thams cad kyang mi dmigs te / gang mi dmigs pa de la rjes su @91a *//
translated: He does not apprehend any dharma that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: mthun pa'i chos mi dmigs so snyam du rnam par rtog par yang mi mdzad do //🔽de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa la chos kyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos mi dmigs so snyam du rnam par rtog par yang mi mdzad do // de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa la chos kyi 'du shes sam /
translated: He does not think, ‘I do not apprehend that which is in accord with the Dharma.’

original: chos ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyang mi 'jug cing kun tu mi spyod la /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyang mi 'jug cing kun tu mi spyod la /
translated: At that time, the Tathāgata does not engage in the notion of Dharma or the notion of non-Dharma. He does not engage in conduct.

original: 'du shes yid la byed pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes yid la byed pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He does not have the mental activity of the notion of Dharma.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la gnas shing /
translated: At that time, the Tathāgata abides in the intrinsic nature of the Dharma, which is pure by nature.

original: mi gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad mkhyen zhing rnam par phye mod kyi /
analyzed: mi gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad mkhyen zhing rnam par phye mod kyi /
translated: Although they are known and distinguished,

original: sus kyang mkhyen pa yang med /
analyzed: sus kyang mkhyen pa yang med /
translated: no one knows them,

original: rnam par phye ba yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba yang med do //
translated: and they are not distinguished.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: don dam pa ston pa'i tshig 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig med pa'i tshig rnam par dag pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ston pa'i tshig 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig med pa'i tshig rnam par dag pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: these words that teach the ultimate are the words of the Thus-Gone One, which are pure words that are not words.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshig rnam par dag pa shes pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshig rnam par dag pa shes pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: All of these are the bodhisattvas’ way of knowing the purity of words.

original: gang gis sgo mtha' yas pa'i tshul dang / gzungs kyi sgo rjes su rtogs pa ni chos cung zad kyang rtogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis sgo mtha' yas pa'i tshul dang / gzungs kyi sgo rjes su rtogs pa ni chos cung zad kyang rtogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: Those who realize the way of the infinite gateway and the dhāraṇī gateway do not realize even the slightest phenomenon,

original: ma rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor do they fail to realize it.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: tshig tshig ces bya ba ni tshig tu gyur pa med de /
analyzed: tshig tshig ces bya ba ni tshig tu gyur pa med de /
translated: words are called words because they are not words.

original: tshig med pa la 'jug pas tshig thams cad rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig med pa la 'jug pas tshig thams cad rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand all words by engaging with the absence of words.

original: tshig thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: tshig thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: All words are words of freedom from desire.

original: 'di ltar tshig de ni nor ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig de ni nor ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: In this way, those words are mistaken words.

original: gang nor ba'i tshig yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang nor ba'i tshig yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Those that are mistaken words are words of freedom from desire.

original: tshig de dag thams cad ni bslu ba'i tshig yin @91b no; ;gang bslu ba'i tshig yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshig go /
analyzed: tshig de dag thams cad ni bslu ba'i tshig yin @91b no; ;gang bslu ba'i tshig yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshig go /
translated: All those words are deceptive words. Those that are deceptive words are words of suchness.

original: gang de bzhin nyid kyi tshig yin pa de ni mthar thug pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid kyi tshig yin pa de ni mthar thug pa'i tshig go /
translated: Those that are words of suchness are words of ultimate reality.

original: gang mthar thug pa'i tshig yin pa de ni zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: gang mthar thug pa'i tshig yin pa de ni zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i tshig go /
translated: Those that are words of ultimate reality are words of exhaustion, freedom from desire, and cessation.

original: gang zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i tshig yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: gang zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i tshig yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Those that are words of exhaustion, freedom from desire, and cessation are words of nirvāṇa.

original: tshig med pa'i tshig /🔽kun tu sbyor ba med pa'i tshig /
analyzed: tshig med pa'i tshig / kun tu sbyor ba med pa'i tshig /
translated: They are words that are not words.🔽They are words that are not fetters.

original: gdags pa med pa'i tshig yin no //🔽bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: gdags pa med pa'i tshig yin no //🔽bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: They are words that are not designations.🔽“Anantavyūha,

original: tshig gcig ces bya ba ni chos thams cad dge ba dang mi dge ba'i nang du yang dag par mi 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig gcig ces bya ba ni chos thams cad dge ba dang mi dge ba'i nang du yang dag par mi 'du ba yin no //
translated: One word is that all phenomena are not included in virtue and nonvirtue.

original: tshig gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that one word?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig ste /
translated: It is the word ‘freedom from desire.’

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni tshig 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni tshig 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Freedom from desire is not a word.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ji lta bar tshig thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ji lta bar tshig thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as freedom from desire is, so are all words.

original: 'di ltar tshig rnam par dag pa'i phyir tshig thams cad ni tshig med pa yin no //🔽tshig rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig rnam par dag pa'i phyir tshig thams cad ni tshig med pa yin no // tshig rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: In this way, all words are not words because of the purity of words.🔽The purity of words is the purity of nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de yang tshig rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de yang tshig rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The purity of nirvāṇa is the purity of words.

original: 'di ltar tshig thams cad ni brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig thams cad ni brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: In this way, all words are inexpressible.

original: ngag gang gis tshig rjod par byed pa de yang phyogs bcur mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ngag gang gis tshig rjod par byed pa de yang phyogs bcur mi dmigs te /
translated: The speech by which words are expressed is not apprehended in the ten directions.

original: gang gis rjod pa dang / gang la brjod pa dang / gang brjod pa dang / cis rjod pa dang / ji ltar brjod pa de dag thams cad yod pa @92a *//🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rjod pa dang / gang la brjod pa dang / gang brjod pa dang / cis rjod pa dang / ji ltar brjod pa de dag thams cad yod pa @92a *// ma yin no //
translated: The one who expresses, that which is expressed, the expression, the means of expression, and the manner of expression—all of these do not exist.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni med pa'i don du rlom par yang mi bya /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni med pa'i don du rlom par yang mi bya /
translated: That which does not exist should not be imagined to have the meaning of nonexistence.

original: spros par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: spros par yang mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be elaborated.

original: tshig thams cad ni rlom sems med pa'i tshig /
analyzed: tshig thams cad ni rlom sems med pa'i tshig /
translated: All words are words of non-imagination.

original: spros pa med pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: They are words of non-elaboration.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa tshig de dag thams cad yongs su tshol zhing rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa tshig de dag thams cad yongs su tshol zhing rnam par rtog na /
translated: Therefore, when yogins and yoginīs investigate and analyze all those words,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: they become free from desire, cessation, and nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan 'das pa de ni tshig de dang tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa de ni tshig de dang tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: That nirvāṇa is not different from those words.

original: tshig de nyid kyang brjod du med pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig de nyid kyang brjod du med pa yin te /
translated: Those very words are inexpressible.

original: 'di ltar tshig kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig kyang gzhan /
translated: In this way, words are one thing,

original: ngag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: ngag kyang gzhan la /
translated: and speech is another.

original: ngag gang gis tshig ston pa'i ngag de ni dbang med pa /
analyzed: ngag gang gis tshig ston pa'i ngag de ni dbang med pa /
translated: The speech by which words are taught is powerless.

original: gsob / 'drid pa ste /
analyzed: gsob / 'drid pa ste /
translated: They are hollow, deceptive,

original: bslu ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: bslu ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: and have the nature of being misleading.

original: tshig rnam par dag pa bstan pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig rnam par dag pa bstan pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to be skilled in teaching the purity of words,

original: gdags pa med par tshig rnam par rig par byed de /
analyzed: gdags pa med par tshig rnam par rig par byed de /
translated: one should understand words without imputation.

original: gang 'dogs pa med pa de ni 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dogs pa med pa de ni 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: That which is without imputation is imputation.

original: gang 'dogs pa de ni tshig tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dogs pa de ni tshig tha dad pa yin no //
translated: That which is imputation is a different word.

original: gang gi tshig tha dad pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o; ;gang rnam par mi rtog pa de ni rtog pa spangs shing chos nyid 'di'i nang du yang dag par 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshig tha dad pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o; ;gang rnam par mi rtog pa de ni rtog pa spangs shing chos nyid 'di'i nang du yang dag par 'du ba yin no //
translated: That which is a different word is non-conceptuality. That which is non-conceptuality is the abandonment of conceptualization and is subsumed within this true nature.

original: de ni rnam par spyod pa med par bya ba'i phyir gang la yang tha snyad kyi spyod pa kun tu mi spyod de /
analyzed: de ni rnam par spyod pa med par bya ba'i phyir gang la yang tha snyad kyi spyod pa kun tu mi spyod de /
translated: In order to be without activity, one should not engage in any conventional activity.

original: 'di ltar de mi spyod /🔽rnam par mi spyod /🔽yang dag par mi spyod /
analyzed: 'di ltar de mi spyod / rnam par mi spyod / yang dag par mi spyod /
translated: In this way, one does not engage,🔽does not engage in differentiation,

original: nye bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: nye bar mi spyod do //
translated: does not engage in true engagement,🔽and does not engage in close engagement.

original: gang dag de ltar gnas pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin @92b gshegs pa'i theg pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag de ltar gnas pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin @92b gshegs pa'i theg pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Those who abide in this way are said by the Tathagata to be in the vehicle of the Tathagata.

original: chos cung zad kyang mi spyod par byang chub sems dpa'i sa la kun tu spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos cung zad kyang mi spyod par byang chub sems dpa'i sa la kun tu spyod pa yin no //
translated: They are in the bodhisattva stages, in which they do not practice anything at all.

original: gang dag de ltar zhugs pa de dag ni gzungs mtha' yas pa rnam par spyong ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de ltar zhugs pa de dag ni gzungs mtha' yas pa rnam par spyong ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Those who enter in this way are skilled in the purification of the infinite dhāraṇīs.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzungs so sor thob nas /
analyzed: de la gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzungs so sor thob nas /
translated: I will now teach the dhāraṇī gateway’s words, through which bodhisattvas will attain dhāraṇī and

original: chos kyi gter mtha' yas pa rab tu ston par 'gyur ba dang / rgol ba thams cad tshar bcad nas rtsod pa med pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i chos rgyas par bya ba la 'jug par 'gyur pa'i gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gter mtha' yas pa rab tu ston par 'gyur ba dang / rgol ba thams cad tshar bcad nas rtsod pa med pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i chos rgyas par bya ba la 'jug par 'gyur pa'i gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig bstan par bya'o //
translated: reveal infinite Dharma treasures, defeat all adversaries, abide on the level of no conflict, and engage in the elucidation of the Dharma of peace.

original: gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo'i tshig de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those words of the dhāraṇī gateway?

original: sad ya the dan /
analyzed: sad ya the dan /
translated: Sayadhadan.

original: dza ya bi dza ye /🔽au ge au ka ba ti /🔽a'a lo ke /
analyzed: dza ya bi dza ye / au ge au ka ba ti / a'a lo ke /
translated: Jayavijaye.🔽Uge uka-vati.🔽A loke.

original: a'a lo ka ba te /
analyzed: a'a lo ka ba te /
translated: A loka-vati.🔽Prave bhati.

original: pra bhe ba te /🔽pra bha ba ti; nir dar sha ne /
analyzed: pra bhe ba te / pra bha ba ti; nir dar sha ne /
translated: Prava bhati.

original: nir dar sha na ba te /
analyzed: nir dar sha na ba te /
translated: Nir darśane.🔽Nir darśana-vati.🔽Arthe.

original: aar the / aar tha ba ti /
analyzed: aar the / aar tha ba ti /
translated: Artha-vati.

original: sho dha ni sho dha ni ba ti /
analyzed: sho dha ni sho dha ni ba ti /
translated: Śodhani śodhani-vati.

original: pa ri sho dha ni /
analyzed: pa ri sho dha ni /
translated: Pari śodhani.

original: kri ye bi kri ya ba ti /🔽aud ta ra ni /
analyzed: kri ye bi kri ya ba ti / aud ta ra ni /
translated: Kriya vikri-vati.🔽Ud tarani.

original: sa ra ni /🔽mah'a bi dza ye /
analyzed: sa ra ni / mah'a bi dza ye /
translated: Sarani.🔽Mahā vijaye.

original: ma h'a bi dza ya ba ti /
analyzed: ma h'a bi dza ya ba ti /
translated: Mahā vijaya-vati.

original: aa nu san dhi /
analyzed: aa nu san dhi /
translated: Anusandhi.

original: aa pra ti san dhi /
analyzed: aa pra ti san dhi /
translated: Apratisandhi.

original: yu ga b'a hi na dha /
analyzed: yu ga b'a hi na dha /
translated: Yu ga vahi ndha.🔽Sidhi.

original: sid dhi / sid dha ra de /
analyzed: sid dhi / sid dha ra de /
translated: Sidha rade.

original: sid dh'artha ba ti /
analyzed: sid dh'artha ba ti /
translated: Sidhārtha-vati.

original: ma ti ma ti pra bhe /🔽aud ta re /
analyzed: ma ti ma ti pra bhe / aud ta re /
translated: Mati mati prabhe.🔽Ud tare.

original: aud ta ra ba ti /
analyzed: aud ta ra ba ti /
translated: Ud tara-vati.

original: bi tsa re /
analyzed: bi tsa re /
translated: Vicare.

original: bi tsa r'a nu san dhi /
analyzed: bi tsa r'a nu san dhi /
translated: Vicara anusandhi.🔽Sare.

original: sa re / sa ra ba ti /
analyzed: sa re / sa ra ba ti /
translated: Sara-vati.

original: sa r'a nu ga te /
analyzed: sa r'a nu ga te /
translated: Sara anugate.

original: sa me sa m'a ra bha bi ga te /
analyzed: sa me sa m'a ra bha bi ga te /
translated: Same samāra bhavi gate.🔽Gati.

original: ga ti / aa ni ga te /
analyzed: ga ti / aa ni ga te /
translated: Ani gate.

original: aa pra ti ni pa ra ti /🔽bi she sha /
analyzed: aa pra ti ni pa ra ti / bi she sha /
translated: Aprati niparati.🔽Viśeṣa.

original: bi she sha ba ti /
analyzed: bi she sha ba ti /
translated: Viśeṣa-vati.

original: aa bha hi ni /🔽ni bha hi ni /
analyzed: aa bha hi ni / ni bha hi ni /
translated: Abha hini.🔽Nibha hini.

original: pra bha hi ni /
analyzed: pra bha hi ni /
translated: Pra bha hini.🔽Uha.

original: au ha / aud ta ra ne /
analyzed: au ha / aud ta ra ne /
translated: Ud tarane.

original: m'a la pa ni ye /🔽@93a *// aa she she /
analyzed: m'a la pa ni ye / @93a *// aa she she /
translated: mālapāṇiye🔽aśeṣe🔽anuśeṣe🔽anugame

original: aa nu pa she she /🔽aa nu ga me /
analyzed: aa nu pa she she / aa nu ga me /
translated: apratigame🔽agate🔽ānāgate🔽anāgate🔽gativiśodhani

original: aa pra ti ga me /
analyzed: aa pra ti ga me /
translated: pariśodhani🔽kṣaṇakṣaye🔽mate prātite🔽mate viśodhani🔽samantānugate

original: aa ga te /🔽a'a n'a ga te /
analyzed: aa ga te / a'a n'a ga te /
translated: samantaravāte🔽samantāviśodhani🔽anupragrahi

original: aa n'a ga ti /
analyzed: aa n'a ga ti /
translated: anupragrahite🔽hīnārthe🔽arthaviśuddhi🔽parami🔽hedunidhāne

original: ga ti bi sho dha ni /
analyzed: ga ti bi sho dha ni /
translated: prātite🔽prātivātivinivicayānugate🔽anantrārthe🔽anantavigrahe🔽madaviśuddhi🔽anugrahi

original: ba ri sho dha ni /
analyzed: ba ri sho dha ni /
translated: agrahaviśodhani🔽adhyāmatavigate🔽bhāvāviśodhani vidyānugati🔽vidyānusaṃdhi🔽pariśodhani🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

analyzed: k'a da ksha tshe da ni / ya te / ma ti pra t'i te /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: ma ti bi sho dha ni /🔽sa man t'a nu ga te /
analyzed: ma ti bi sho dha ni / sa man t'a nu ga te /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: sa man ta pa ri b'a te /
analyzed: sa man ta pa ri b'a te /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: sa man ta bi sho dhe ni /🔽aa nu pra gri hi /
analyzed: sa man ta bi sho dhe ni / aa nu pra gri hi /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: aa nu pra gri hi te /
analyzed: aa nu pra gri hi te /
translated: Vairocana,

original: h'i n'a ra the /
analyzed: h'i n'a ra the /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: aartha bhi shud dhi /
analyzed: aartha bhi shud dhi /
translated: Vairocana,

original: pa ra me /
analyzed: pa ra me /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: he du ni dhi san ne /🔽pra t'i te /
analyzed: he du ni dhi san ne / pra t'i te /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: pra t'i ta ba ti; bi ni shatsa yo nu ga te /🔽aa nan t'a ra the /
analyzed: pra t'i ta ba ti; bi ni shatsa yo nu ga te / aa nan t'a ra the /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: aa nan ta bi gra he /
analyzed: aa nan ta bi gra he /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: ma da pi shud dhi /🔽aa nu gra he /
analyzed: ma da pi shud dhi / aa nu gra he /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: aa gra ha bi sho dha ni /🔽aa dhyad ma bi ga te /🔽bha h'a bha bi sho dha ni bidy'a nu ga ti /
analyzed: aa gra ha bi sho dha ni / aa dhyad ma bi ga te / bha h'a bha bi sho dha ni bidy'a nu ga ti /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: bidy'a nu sa na dhi /
analyzed: bidy'a nu sa na dhi /
translated: Vairocana,

original: pa ri sho dha ni /🔽bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: pa ri sho dha ni /🔽bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,🔽Vairocana,

original: gsang sngags kyi tshig bstan pa 'di dag ni gzungs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshig bstan pa 'di dag ni gzungs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These secret mantra words are the complete understanding of dhāraṇī.

original: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi gter mtha' yas pa rjes su dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi gter mtha' yas pa rjes su dran par 'gyur /
translated: “Through them, bodhisattvas will recall the infinite Dharma treasures of the thus-gone ones.

original: sems can rnams la yang dag par rab tu ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang dag par rab tu ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach them perfectly to sentient beings.

original: mi slu ba'i sa la gnas shing /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i sa la gnas shing /
translated: They will abide on the undeceiving level.

original: don dang tshig gi tshul thams cad kyang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: don dang tshig gi tshul thams cad kyang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: They will understand all the ways of meaning and words.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu dbye ba rgya chen po tshad med pa yang rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu dbye ba rgya chen po tshad med pa yang rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: They will realize the immeasurable and vast classifications of the buddhas’ teachings.🔽They will fulfill their aspirations.”

original: ji ltar smon pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro; ;bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: ji ltar smon pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro; ;bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzungs kyi tshul la thabs mkhas pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / rjes su rtogs nas kyang tshul @93b dang mthun pa'i dgongs pa la mkhas pa'i tshul kun shes par 'gyur ba gzungs kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba kun shes pa la mkhas pa brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzungs kyi tshul la thabs mkhas pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / rjes su rtogs nas kyang tshul @93b dang mthun pa'i dgongs pa la mkhas pa'i tshul kun shes par 'gyur ba gzungs kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba kun shes pa la mkhas pa brtan par bya'o //
translated: How do bodhisattvas gain special understanding of the skillful means of the way of dhāraṇī?

original: ji ltar kun shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Having gained understanding, how do they know the way of the skillful means of understanding the way of dhāraṇī?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: mig ni gzugs kun du 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs kun du 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: the eyes apprehend all forms,

original: rna ba ni sgra kun du 'dzin pa yin /🔽sna ni dri kun du 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: rna ba ni sgra kun du 'dzin pa yin / sna ni dri kun du 'dzin pa yin /
translated: the ears apprehend all sounds,🔽the nose apprehends all smells,

original: lce ni ro kun du 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: lce ni ro kun du 'dzin pa yin /
translated: the tongue apprehends all tastes,

original: lus ni reg bya kun du 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: lus ni reg bya kun du 'dzin pa yin /
translated: the body apprehends all textures,

original: yid ni chos kun du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: yid ni chos kun du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: and the mind apprehends all phenomena.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la ji ltar na nang gi chos drug po dag phyi'i chos rnams 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na nang gi chos drug po dag phyi'i chos rnams 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: how do the six inner phenomena apprehend outer phenomena?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' mig gis gzugs mthong ba ni de la mi rtag pa nyid du kun du 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' mig gis gzugs mthong ba ni de la mi rtag pa nyid du kun du 'dzin par byed /
translated: When a bodhisattva sees a form with the eye, he or she perceives it as impermanent.

original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can du rab tu rtogs par byed /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can du rab tu rtogs par byed /
translated: He or she understands it to be subject to arising and destruction.

original: de la zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog par kun tu 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de la zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog par kun tu 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He or she perceives it as subject to extinction, separation, and cessation.

original: de shes rab kyi stobs chags pa med pa dran pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi stobs chags pa med pa dran pa la mkhas pa /
translated: With the power of non-attached wisdom, with skill in mindfulness,

original: rdzab rdzub ma yin pas nang gi mig gi khams kun du 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: rdzab rdzub ma yin pas nang gi mig gi khams kun du 'dzin par byed de /
translated: and without deceit, he or she perceives the inner eye element.

original: mig la bdag gam bdag med par nye bar rtog pa ni mi byed do //
analyzed: mig la bdag gam bdag med par nye bar rtog pa ni mi byed do //
translated: He or she does not investigate the eye as a self or not a self.

original: de mig gi skye mched rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de mig gi skye mched rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa la gnas te /
translated: Abiding in the skill of the pure eye sense-sphere,

original: gzugs la dmigs ba rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gzungs kyi sgo rnam par sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs ba rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gzungs kyi sgo rnam par sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: he or she purifies the dhāraṇī gateway in order to take hold of the form objective support.

original: phyi dang nang gi chos de dag las gzhan ba kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba dag dang bral ba'i sgo nas ldog ba rjes su lta /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos de dag las gzhan ba kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba dag dang bral ba'i sgo nas ldog ba rjes su lta /
translated: He observes the cessation of all internal and external phenomena, and he observes the freedom from all bonds.

original: 'dod @94a *// chags dang bral bar rjes su lta /
analyzed: 'dod @94a *// chags dang bral bar rjes su lta /
translated: He observes the absence of desire,

original: 'gog par rjes su lta zhing gnas la cung zad kyang spros par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gog par rjes su lta zhing gnas la cung zad kyang spros par mi byed do //
translated: and he observes cessation, but he does not engage in any conceptual elaboration whatsoever.

original: de spros pa med pa kun du 'dzin pa la mkhas pas rlom sems mi 'byung ba'i gnas la gnas shing /
analyzed: de spros pa med pa kun du 'dzin pa la mkhas pas rlom sems mi 'byung ba'i gnas la gnas shing /
translated: He is skilled in the absence of conceptual elaboration and grasping, and he abides in a state free of conceit.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i chos rnams btang snyoms su 'jog cing rlom par mi byed do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i chos rnams btang snyoms su 'jog cing rlom par mi byed do //
translated: He is indifferent to the eye and to the phenomena that are cognized by the eye consciousness, and he does not engage in conceptual elaboration.

original: ji ltar mthong ba rnam par dag pa bzhin chos rnams sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid rjes su dran par yang byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba rnam par dag pa bzhin chos rnams sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid rjes su dran par yang byed do //
translated: He is mindful that phenomena are like illusions, just as he has seen them to be.

original: de rnam par lta ba thun mong ma yin pas shes pa dang shes bya ba rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa kun tu 'dzin pa na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi phung po rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam par lta ba thun mong ma yin pas shes pa dang shes bya ba rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa kun tu 'dzin pa na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi phung po rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When they hold the expertise in the purification of cognition and the cognized through their unique vision, they also come to hold the vast accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid chos 'dzin pa'i bar du yang mthun par sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid chos 'dzin pa'i bar du yang mthun par sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, the same principle applies to the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind apprehending phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' yid kyis chos rnam par shes pa na chos la mi rtag par kun du 'dzin par byed; chos rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su lta zhing /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' yid kyis chos rnam par shes pa na chos la mi rtag par kun du 'dzin par byed; chos rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su lta zhing /
translated: When bodhisattvas cognize phenomena with the mind, they apprehend phenomena as impermanent, and they observe phenomena as having the nature of arising and disintegrating.

original: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog par kun du 'dzin par yang byed do //
analyzed: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog par kun du 'dzin par yang byed do //
translated: They also apprehend them as exhausted, free from desire, and ceased.

original: de shes rab kyi stobs rnams chags pa med pa /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi stobs rnams chags pa med pa /
translated: They have the power of wisdom, which is free from attachment,

original: dran pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: dran pa la mkhas pa /
translated: and they are skilled in mindfulness.

original: rdzab rdzub ma yin pas nang gi yid kyi skye mched kun du 'dzin par byed de //🔽bdag gam bdag med par spros par yang @94b mi byed la /🔽sna tshogs su kun du 'dzin pa la mkhas pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa la rab tu rnam par 'byed par yang byed do //
analyzed: rdzab rdzub ma yin pas nang gi yid kyi skye mched kun du 'dzin par byed de // bdag gam bdag med par spros par yang @94b mi byed la / sna tshogs su kun du 'dzin pa la mkhas pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa la rab tu rnam par 'byed par yang byed do //
translated: It is not confused, and so it apprehends the internal mental sense-field.🔽It does not engage in the proliferation of self and non-self.🔽And by being skilled in apprehending the variety, it also discerns the level of the mental consciousness.🔽

original: de'i 'og tu yid kyi skye mched rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yid kyi skye mched rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa la gnas te /
translated: He does not grasp the internal mental sense-field as real or unreal, as having a self or not having a self, as empty or not empty, as having an essence or not having an essence, as being produced or unproduced, as ceasing or not ceasing, as calm or not calm, as void or not void, as afflicted or unafflicted, as needing to be seen or not needing to be seen, as needing to be abandoned or not needing to be abandoned, as being realized or not being realized, or as being cultivated or not being cultivated.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.

original: chos la dmigs pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gzungs kyi sgo rnam par sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gzungs kyi sgo rnam par sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.

original: phyi dang nang gi chos de las gzhan pa kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba dag dang bral ba'i sgo nas ldog par rjes su lta /🔽'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su lta /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos de las gzhan pa kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba dag dang bral ba'i sgo nas ldog par rjes su lta / 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su lta /
translated: He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.

original: 'gog par rjes su lta zhing gnas la /🔽cung zad kyang skur ba 'debs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gog par rjes su lta zhing gnas la / cung zad kyang skur ba 'debs pa'am /
translated: He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.

original: spros bar ni mi byed do //
analyzed: spros bar ni mi byed do //
translated: He does not grasp it as being pure or impure.🔽He does

original: de spros pa med ba kun du 'dzin pa la mkhas pas /
analyzed: de spros pa med ba kun du 'dzin pa la mkhas pas /
translated: By being skilled in the retention of the absence of conceptual elaboration,

original: rlom sems mi 'byung ba'i gnas la gnas shing /
analyzed: rlom sems mi 'byung ba'i gnas la gnas shing /
translated: they abide in a state free from conceit.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams btang snyoms su 'jog cing /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams btang snyoms su 'jog cing /
translated: They rest in equanimity with respect to the mental consciousness and the phenomena that are cognized by it.

original: spros par yang mi byed /
analyzed: spros par yang mi byed /
translated: They do not engage in conceptual elaboration.

original: rlom par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rlom par yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not engage in conceit.

original: ji ltar mthong ba rnam par dag pa bzhin chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dran par yang byed /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba rnam par dag pa bzhin chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dran par yang byed /
translated: They recollect the sameness of phenomena as it is seen in its purity.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / shes bya rnam par sbyong ba la mkhas pa kun 'dzin par yang byed cing rnam par lta ba thun mong ma yin pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi phung po rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / shes bya rnam par sbyong ba la mkhas pa kun 'dzin par yang byed cing rnam par lta ba thun mong ma yin pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi phung po rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They retain the skill in purifying consciousness and the objects of consciousness. And, by means of their uncommon view, they come to possess a vast accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: de de ltar phyi nang gi chos 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad la shes rab kyi stobs don gyi rjes su song ba'i blo thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin pas chos 'ga' yang rgyu med par yang dag @95a *//🔽par rjes su mi lta la /
analyzed: de de ltar phyi nang gi chos 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad la shes rab kyi stobs don gyi rjes su song ba'i blo thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin pas chos 'ga' yang rgyu med par yang dag @95a *// par rjes su mi lta la /
translated: In this way, with the power of wisdom, they are skilled in the methods of the mind that follows the meaning of all inner and outer phenomena, whether past, future, or present. Thus, they do not consider any phenomenon to be without a cause.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi lta ste /
translated: They do not consider phenomena to arise from causes and conditions.

original: chos thams cad phan tshun mi ldan par shes par byas nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad phan tshun mi ldan par shes par byas nas /
translated: They understand that all phenomena are mutually unconnected.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow the nature of phenomena just as it is.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: All these phenomena are naturally luminous.

original: phan tshun kun 'dzin pa dang / rjes su mthun pa 'dzin pas chos rnams kyi rten gyi tshul du nye bar gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phan tshun kun 'dzin pa dang / rjes su mthun pa 'dzin pas chos rnams kyi rten gyi tshul du nye bar gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: They abide as the basis of phenomena by mutually holding and maintaining each other.

original: chos thams cad bsdus nas thun mong gi tshul du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsdus nas thun mong gi tshul du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not abide as a common basis that subsumes all phenomena.

original: chos gang dag skye ba med cing ldog pa med pa de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gang dag skye ba med cing ldog pa med pa de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Those phenomena that are neither produced nor cease are not to be expressed.

original: chos gang dag don dang ldan zhing phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa dang bral ba de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //🔽chos rnams ni byed pa po med pa /
analyzed: chos gang dag don dang ldan zhing phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa dang bral ba de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa yang ma yin no // chos rnams ni byed pa po med pa /
translated: Those phenomena that are meaningful and free from mutual homogeneity are neither conjoined nor disjoined.🔽All phenomena are devoid of a creator.

original: byed du 'jug pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of an instigator.

original: chos rnams ni srog med pa /🔽sems can med pa /
analyzed: chos rnams ni srog med pa / sems can med pa /
translated: All phenomena are devoid of life force.🔽All phenomena are devoid of sentient beings.

original: gang zag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of persons.

original: chos thams cad ni tshig mngon par bsgrub pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su 'dzin pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni tshig mngon par bsgrub pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su 'dzin pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are equal to nirvana, since they are taken up in accordance with the accomplishment of words.

original: chos thams cad ni chags pa med pa /🔽chags pa dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chags pa med pa / chags pa dang mi ldan pa /
translated: All phenomena are free from attachment.🔽All phenomena are not associated with attachment.

original: chags pa dang bral pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are free from attachment.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas; gzungs rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyi dang / nang gi chos dag gis chos thams cad nye bar brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas; gzungs rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyi dang / nang gi chos dag gis chos thams cad nye bar brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: “Anantavyūha, this instruction on expertise in the discernment of dhāraṇī is the means by which bodhisattvas should investigate all phenomena in terms of inner and outer phenomena.

original: de ltar @95b bshad na byang chub sems dpa' de nang gi gzhi rnams kyang rab tu spong la /
analyzed: de ltar @95b bshad na byang chub sems dpa' de nang gi gzhi rnams kyang rab tu spong la /
translated: “When this is explained, bodhisattvas will relinquish inner bases

original: phyi rol gyi yang len par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yang len par mi byed do //
translated: and not grasp at outer ones.

original: de 'di ltar rnam par rtog par yang byed de /
analyzed: de 'di ltar rnam par rtog par yang byed de /
translated: They will also contemplate in the following manner:

original: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lo thog ma dang tha ma med par zhugs pa /
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lo thog ma dang tha ma med par zhugs pa /
translated: ‘Alas, the inhabitants of the world are caught up in the wheel of cyclic existence, which has no beginning or end.

original: ma rig pas 'dzin pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: ma rig pas 'dzin pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: They are caught up in the grasping of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su chud cing 'khyam /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su chud cing 'khyam /
translated: They are caught up in the shell of ignorance, wandering,

original: rab tu 'khyam /
analyzed: rab tu 'khyam /
translated: wandering thoroughly,🔽wandering completely and thoroughly.

original: kun tu rab tu 'khyam pa'o; ;'khor ba'i 'khor lo de nyid kun tu 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'khyam pa'o; ;'khor ba'i 'khor lo de nyid kun tu 'gyur /
translated: The wheel of cyclic existence turns

original: rab tu 'gyur yang /
analyzed: rab tu 'gyur yang /
translated: and turns thoroughly,

original: 'di la 'khor bar dmigs pa yang med /
analyzed: 'di la 'khor bar dmigs pa yang med /
translated: yet there is nothing to be observed in cyclic existence here,

original: mngon par yang med de /
analyzed: mngon par yang med de /
translated: nor is there anything that manifests.

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo yongs su 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yang dag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo yongs su 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yang dag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is a real world that is the basis of the world’s cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten gnas pa de lta bu yin yang 'di la 'jig rten du dmigs pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa de lta bu yin yang 'di la 'jig rten du dmigs pa yang med de /
translated: Although the world is like this, there is no world that can be apprehended here.

original: 'jig rten du mngon pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten du mngon pa yang med do //
translated: There is no world that can be perceived.

original: sems can 'di rnams ni chos 'di rnams la chos 'di lta bu dag rab tu mi shes pas /
analyzed: sems can 'di rnams ni chos 'di rnams la chos 'di lta bu dag rab tu mi shes pas /
translated: These sentient beings do not know these phenomena as they really are.

original: 'di nyid du rgyu /🔽kun tu rgyu /
analyzed: 'di nyid du rgyu / kun tu rgyu /
translated: They go around here,🔽they go around everywhere,

original: rgyug / yongs su rgyug /
analyzed: rgyug / yongs su rgyug /
translated: they run around, they run around everywhere,

original: rjes su rgyug go /
analyzed: rjes su rgyug go /
translated: they run around in circles.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni de nyid mi shes shing yang dag pa ma yin pas phyin ci log tu gyur pa /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni de nyid mi shes shing yang dag pa ma yin pas phyin ci log tu gyur pa /
translated: Alas! These sentient beings do not know reality. They are confused by what is unreal.

original: sems can med par sems can du 'du shes pa la chags te /
analyzed: sems can med par sems can du 'du shes pa la chags te /
translated: They are attached to the notion of a sentient being where there is no sentient being.

original: sems can du 'du shes pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa yin no //
translated: They are bound by the fetters of the notion of a sentient being.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni chos rnams rab tu mi shes pas 'jig pa dang / rnam par 'jig pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i rjes su song ba ste /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni chos rnams rab tu mi shes pas 'jig pa dang / rnam par 'jig pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i rjes su song ba ste /
translated: Alas, these beings do not understand phenomena, and so they follow destruction, complete destruction, and utter destruction.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgol ba dang / g-yul @96a *//🔽'gyed pa / mun pa'i rjes su song ba yin yang gang du yang song ba med /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgol ba dang / g-yul @96a *// 'gyed pa / mun pa'i rjes su song ba yin yang gang du yang song ba med /
translated: They are in conflict and battle because of their falsity,

original: gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
translated: and they follow darkness, yet they do not go anywhere and they do not come from anywhere.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni kun du chags pa la zhen pa /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni kun du chags pa la zhen pa /
translated: Alas, these beings are attached to desire,

original: kun du chags pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa ste /
analyzed: kun du chags pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa ste /
translated: and they are bound by the fetters of desire.

original: thar pa rab tu mi shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: thar pa rab tu mi shes pa yin pas /
translated: Since they do not understand liberation,

original: bdag gis sems can rnams la phan gdags pa dang / rjes su gzung ba'i phyir chos kyi tshul 'di dag bstan par bya gor ma chags snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams la phan gdags pa dang / rjes su gzung ba'i phyir chos kyi tshul 'di dag bstan par bya gor ma chags snyam mo //
translated: I will teach them the way of the Dharma in order to benefit and care for beings.’

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams de ltar rab tu rnam par dbye na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams de ltar rab tu rnam par dbye na /
translated: when bodhisattvas discern phenomena in this way,

original: myur du chos rnams la snang ba chen po yang thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: myur du chos rnams la snang ba chen po yang thob par 'gyur /
translated: They will quickly attain great illumination with respect to phenomena.

original: sgo yongs su dag pa yang rjes su thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: sgo yongs su dag pa yang rjes su thob par 'gyur /
translated: They will attain the purity of the sense sources.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa yang kun du 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa yang kun du 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: They will uphold the correct discriminations.

original: bzod pa chen po snang bar bya ba la yang brtson par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po snang bar bya ba la yang brtson par 'gyur /
translated: They will strive to attain the illumination of great patience.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yang 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yang 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: They will uphold great love and great compassion.

original: dgongs pa bstan pa la yang mkhas par 'gyur /🔽tshig gi rnam grangs kyang kun shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: dgongs pa bstan pa la yang mkhas par 'gyur / tshig gi rnam grangs kyang kun shes par 'gyur /
translated: They will become skilled in teaching the intention.🔽They will understand the enumeration of words.

original: tshig tshad med pa yang shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig tshad med pa yang shes par 'gyur /
translated: They will understand immeasurable words.

original: sngon gyi gnas kyang rjes su dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas kyang rjes su dran par 'gyur /
translated: They will remember their past lives.

original: phan yon yang kun du ston par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: phan yon yang kun du ston par 'gyur yang /
translated: They will teach the benefits.

original: chos 'ga' dang yang 'gal bar yang mi byed la /
analyzed: chos 'ga' dang yang 'gal bar yang mi byed la /
translated: They will not contradict any phenomena.

original: sems can rnams rtsod pa med pa'i las la yang dag par 'dzud par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams rtsod pa med pa'i las la yang dag par 'dzud par 'gyur /
translated: They will cause beings to engage in the activity of being free from conflict.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod par mang @96b 'gyur /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod par mang @96b 'gyur /
translated: They will be able to defeat all opponents in accordance with the Dharma.

original: sems can rnams mun pa las rab tu thar par bya ba'i phyir chos ston par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams mun pa las rab tu thar par bya ba'i phyir chos ston par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will teach the Dharma in order to liberate beings from darkness.

original: phyogs bcu dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ched du brjod par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ched du brjod par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will proclaim the praises of the thus-gone ones in the ten directions.

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po gtong bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po gtong bar yang 'gyur /
translated: They will emit the great light of the Dharma.

original: chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sbyin bdag tu yang 'gyur /
analyzed: chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sbyin bdag tu yang 'gyur /
translated: They will become benefactors of the inconceivable Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi gter la rnam par spyod cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi gter la rnam par spyod cing /
translated: They will engage with the Dharma treasures of the thus-gone ones.

original: kun du rmongs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun du rmongs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be confused.

original: smon lam gyi bye brag kun du 'dzin cing ji ltar smon pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi bye brag kun du 'dzin cing ji ltar smon pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will uphold the various aspirations and fulfill their wishes.

original: thabs mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang lhag par rtogs shing; sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sgrub pa yang dag par bskul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang lhag par rtogs shing; sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sgrub pa yang dag par bskul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will realize inconceivable skill in means and will encourage beings to accomplish their wishes.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i rgyu kun tu ston zhing /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i rgyu kun tu ston zhing /
translated: They will teach the causes of the past and the future.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mkhas pa nges par ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mkhas pa nges par ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will teach the expertise in the past and the future.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la byang chub sems dpas ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgrub pa la mngon par brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgrub pa la mngon par brtson par bya ste /
translated: bodhisattvas should strive to accomplish the gateway of meditative absorption.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgrub pa la mkhas pas gzungs kyi sgo bsgrub pa la mkhas pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgrub pa la mkhas pas gzungs kyi sgo bsgrub pa la mkhas pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are skilled in accomplishing the gateway of meditative absorption will realize skill in accomplishing the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi sgo bsgrub pa la mkhas pa rjes su rtogs pa ni dgongs pa'i rnam grangs ston pa la mkhas par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi sgo bsgrub pa la mkhas pa rjes su rtogs pa ni dgongs pa'i rnam grangs ston pa la mkhas par yang 'gyur /
translated: Bodhisattvas who realize skill in accomplishing the dhāraṇī gateway will become skilled in teaching the enumerations of intention.

original: ye shes kyi rnam grangs la yang 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam grangs la yang 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: They will engage in the enumerations of wisdom.

original: chos zab mo'i tshul la yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur /🔽bstan par @97a *//
analyzed: chos zab mo'i tshul la yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur /🔽bstan par @97a *//
translated: They will realize the way of the profound Dharma.🔽They will be skilled in teaching the Dharma.

original: dgongs pa yang rab tu shes par 'gyur zhing gang la yang yid gnyis su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dgongs pa yang rab tu shes par 'gyur zhing gang la yang yid gnyis su mi 'gyur /
translated: They will understand the most sublime wisdom mind and will not be uncertain about anything.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i bzod pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i bzod pa la gnas shing /
translated: They will abide in acceptance that does not depend on others,

original: brtson 'grus chen po rtsom mkhas pa la 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po rtsom mkhas pa la 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will become skilled in the practice of great diligence.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la snying brtse bas chos thams cad shes pa yang dag par sdud pa la mkhas pa kun tu tshol ba ni theg pa gang yang yang dag par mi shes pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la snying brtse bas chos thams cad shes pa yang dag par sdud pa la mkhas pa kun tu tshol ba ni theg pa gang yang yang dag par mi shes pa med de /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ compassion for beings leads them to seek expertise in the discernment of all phenomena. There is no vehicle that they do not know,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang 'thob sla bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang 'thob sla bar 'gyur /
translated: and they will easily attain the wisdom of buddhahood.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i shes pa ye shes chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang shin tu legs par sbyong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i shes pa ye shes chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang shin tu legs par sbyong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also refine the great wisdom of omniscience, which is superior to all worldly knowledge.”

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i chos rim par phye ba bstan pa 'dir chos gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par sdud par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i chos rim par phye ba bstan pa 'dir chos gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par sdud par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this teaching of the section on the method of dhāraṇī, I will teach the Dharma by which bodhisattvas are gathered.

original: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las rgya chen pos yang dag par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las rgya chen pos yang dag par 'dzin cing /
translated: By which bodhisattvas will uphold the vast activity,

original: gsang sngags dang / dgongs pa dang / brjod pa'i sgra dang / yang dag par brjod pa thams cad kyang rjes su rtogs par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang / dgongs pa dang / brjod pa'i sgra dang / yang dag par brjod pa thams cad kyang rjes su rtogs par yang 'gyur /
translated: and by which they will also understand all the secret mantras, intentions, sounds of expression, and correct expressions,

original: blo'i rab tu dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: blo'i rab tu dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: and by which they will also understand the skill in knowing the different types of intelligence.

original: chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those Dharmas?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims @97b kyi gzhi la mkhas pa yongs su dag pa la gnas shing bden pa'i byin gyis brlabs la mkhas pa la gnas pa dang / gtong ba la mkhas pa la gnas pa yang 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims @97b kyi gzhi la mkhas pa yongs su dag pa la gnas shing bden pa'i byin gyis brlabs la mkhas pa la gnas pa dang / gtong ba la mkhas pa la gnas pa yang 'phel bar byed do //
