translated: Here, bodhisattvas who abide in the purity of skill in the basis of discipline also increase their skill in the power of truth and their skill in giving.

original: nga'i med pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba mngon par brtson zhing thabs kyi gnas sgom par byed pa na /
analyzed: nga'i med pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba mngon par brtson zhing thabs kyi gnas sgom par byed pa na /
translated: They strive to seek the Dharma of non-ownership and non-grasping, and when they cultivate the basis of skillful means,

original: chos thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i gnas rtogs par yang 'gyur ro; yongs su nyam nga ba'i chos can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i gnas rtogs par yang 'gyur ro; yongs su nyam nga ba'i chos can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will realize the basis of skill in the way of all phenomena and will not be subject to complete degeneration.

original: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas shing myur du spobs pa phun sum tshogs pas mngon par 'phags par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas shing myur du spobs pa phun sum tshogs pas mngon par 'phags par yang 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, abiding on the irreversible ground, they will quickly become exalted through perfect eloquence.

original: shes rab rgya mtsho lta bus rnam par 'phel bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab rgya mtsho lta bus rnam par 'phel bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also increase through an ocean-like wisdom.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-rāja,

original: phyi ma'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag chos zab mo'i tshul bstan na don du gnyer zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod rnam par dbye bar 'dod cing mos la /
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag chos zab mo'i tshul bstan na don du gnyer zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod rnam par dbye bar 'dod cing mos la /
translated: In the future, there will be bodhisattvas who are interested in the teachings of the profound way and who wish to open the Thus-Gone One’s treasury of Dharma.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: They will be endowed with the highest intention,

original: bsam pa dge ba /
analyzed: bsam pa dge ba /
translated: have virtuous thoughts,🔽and have a good heart.

original: sems bzang pa de dag ma gtogs par gzhan 'ga' yang chos 'di dag len par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: sems bzang pa de dag ma gtogs par gzhan 'ga' yang chos 'di dag len par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Apart from them, no one will take up this teaching.

original: chos kyi tshul 'di la brtson zhing slob par 'jug pa de dag ni /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul 'di la brtson zhing slob par 'jug pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who strive and train in this way of Dharma

original: rnam grangs bstan pa yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam grangs bstan pa yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: will also realize the teachings that are given in enumerations.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also realize the nature of the essence of phenomena.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam grangs kyi chos ston pa yang mdzad la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rang @98a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam grangs kyi chos ston pa yang mdzad la / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rang @98a *//
translated: the Thus-Gone One teaches the Dharma through enumerations,

original: bzhin dang 'gal bar yang mi mdzad cing /
analyzed: bzhin dang 'gal bar yang mi mdzad cing /
translated: but the Thus-Gone One does not contradict the nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin dang mi 'gal bar brjod par yang mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin dang mi 'gal bar brjod par yang mdzad do //
translated: He also speaks without contradicting the nature of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad byas pa med par yang brjod la /
analyzed: chos thams cad byas pa med par yang brjod la /
translated: He speaks of all phenomena as being uncreated,

original: chos rnams la brjod pa'am rjod par byed pa yang mi ston to //
analyzed: chos rnams la brjod pa'am rjod par byed pa yang mi ston to //
translated: but he does not teach that phenomena are described or described by something.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ston pa la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rtogs la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'ga' yang rtogs pa yang med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ston pa la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rtogs la / de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'ga' yang rtogs pa yang med /
translated: the Thus-Gone One has realized the perfection of skill in teaching,

original: rjes su rtogs pa yang med /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa yang med /
translated: but the Thus-Gone One has not realized, does not realize, and will not realize any phenomena.🔽He has not realized, does not realize, and will not realize any phenomena.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa yang med do //
translated: He has not realized, does not realize, and will not realize any phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos 'ga' yang dor bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos 'ga' yang dor bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One does not teach the Dharma in order to discard any phenomena,

original: chos 'ga' yang so sor spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos 'ga' yang so sor spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: nor does he teach the Dharma in order to abandon any phenomena,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /🔽thob par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin / thob par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: to give rise to any phenomena,🔽to attain any phenomena,

original: mi thob par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi thob par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: or to not attain any phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi dmigs pa la gnas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa gnas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi dmigs pa la gnas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa gnas pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Thus-Gone One abides in the absence of observation, yet the Thus-Gone One does not abide.

original: mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is established in non-apprehension, yet the Tathāgata is not established and is not non-established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang gis kyang rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa de 'di ltar gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang gis kyang rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin no // de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa de 'di ltar gnas so //
translated: The Tathāgata is not established by anything.

original: de ltar gnas so zhes ming du brjod pa gang yin pa de yang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin /🔽tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas so zhes ming du brjod pa gang yin pa de yang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin / tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is the Tathāgata, and that which is called the Tathāgata is not one and not different.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong bar gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong bar gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not to be designated as coming or going.

original: @98b de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa med pa ste /
analyzed: @98b de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa med pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is without conceptual elaboration,

original: spros pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin yang gang las kyang 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: spros pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin yang gang las kyang 'da' ba med do //
translated: and is beyond conceptual elaboration, yet he does not transcend anything.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la lhag par 'das pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la lhag par 'das pa med de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not transcend anything.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa lhag par 'das pa med par yang mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa lhag par 'das pa med par yang mkhyen to //
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata knows the Tathāgata without any transcendence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mkhyen pa yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mkhyen pa yang med de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not know the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid du yang mkhyen pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid du yang mkhyen pa med do //
translated: and the Tathāgata does not know the Tathāgata as the non-erroneous suchness and the non-different suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar chos cung zad kyang kun tu mi ston pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid su ston par mdzad cing nges par ston par yang mi mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar chos cung zad kyang kun tu mi ston pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid su ston par mdzad cing nges par ston par yang mi mdzad /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata does not teach any dharma at all, in the same way, the Tathāgata teaches and demonstrates the Tathāgata,

original: yang dag par ston par yang mi mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par yang mi mdzad do //
translated: but he does not teach, demonstrate, or reveal it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba yin yang /🔽chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba yin yang / chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata abides just as the nature of all dharmas is.🔽The nature of dharmas cannot be designated.

original: chos rnams la ni rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: chos rnams la ni rang bzhin med de /
translated: Dharmas are without intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ni ma byas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ni ma byas pa /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has said, ‘All phenomena are uncreated,

original: 'gyur ba med pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa /
translated: unmanifest,

original: yang dag par ma skyes pa /
analyzed: yang dag par ma skyes pa /
translated: unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: unceasing,

original: ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: ma bral ba'o //
translated: and unattached.

original: chos thams cad ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are utterly pure,

original: thob pa yang med /
analyzed: thob pa yang med /
translated: without attainment,

original: yang dag dag par thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: yang dag dag par thob pa yang med do //
translated: and without correct attainment.

original: chos thams cad ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: All phenomena are unobservable.

original: chos thams cad ni mngon par rtogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mngon par rtogs pa med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are non-realization.

original: 'di ltar chos 'ga' yang thob pa med @99a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'ga' yang thob pa med @99a *//
translated: Thus, no phenomenon is attained.

original: do; ;chos de ni cung zad kyang thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: do; ;chos de ni cung zad kyang thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That phenomenon is not to be attained in the slightest.

original: nye bar rtogs pa'i chos ni chos kyang ma yin /
analyzed: nye bar rtogs pa'i chos ni chos kyang ma yin /
translated: A realized phenomenon is not a phenomenon.

original: gang gis kyang nye bar rtogs pa yang med /
analyzed: gang gis kyang nye bar rtogs pa yang med /
translated: There is no realization by anyone.

original: thob pa yang med /
analyzed: thob pa yang med /
translated: There is no attainment,

original: so sor thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: so sor thob pa yang med do //
translated: and there is no individual attainment.

original: de lta bas na chos thams cad ni skye ba med pas nye bar rtogs pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos thams cad ni skye ba med pas nye bar rtogs pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are non-realization, because they are unborn.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to purify the accomplishment of the teachings of the Tathāgatas,

original: 'phags pa'i chos su gdags par brjod par 'byung bar bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'phags pa'i chos cung zad kyang thob pa med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos su gdags par brjod par 'byung bar bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'phags pa'i chos cung zad kyang thob pa med do //
translated: it is taught that the designation of the noble dharmas occurs. But there is not even the slightest attainment of the noble dharmas.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ni chos sam chos ma yin pa cung zad kyang med de /🔽chos la yang 'phags pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ni chos sam chos ma yin pa cung zad kyang med de / chos la yang 'phags pa'am /
translated: For the noble ones, there is not even the slightest dharma or non-dharma.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //🔽'di la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa ni chos 'ga' yang sbyor ba yang med /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do // 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa ni chos 'ga' yang sbyor ba yang med /
translated: Nor is there even the slightest noble one or non-noble one in the dharmas.

original: mi sbyor ba yang med pa ston pa yin par khong du chud par bya'i /
analyzed: mi sbyor ba yang med pa ston pa yin par khong du chud par bya'i /
translated: Here, the accomplishment of the teachings of the Tathāgatas should be understood as the teaching that does not connect with or disconnect from any dharma.

original: tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It should not be followed in terms of conventional expressions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos su 'dogs par yang mdzad la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos su 'dogs par yang mdzad la /
translated: The Tathāgata makes the designation of dharma,

original: chos rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yag mi mdzad do //
analyzed: chos rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yag mi mdzad do //
translated: but does not make the designation of the abiding of dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos ma yin pa ston par yang mdzad la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos ma yin pa ston par yang mdzad la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches what is not the Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pa rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yang mi mdzad do //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yang mi mdzad do //
translated: but he does not posit the establishment of what is not the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ston par yang mdzad la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ston par yang mdzad la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches virtue and nonvirtue,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par gnas pa 'dogs @99b bar yang mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par gnas pa 'dogs @99b bar yang mi mdzad do //
translated: but he does not posit the establishment of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad ston par yang mdzad la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad ston par yang mdzad la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yang mi mdzad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yang mi mdzad do //
translated: but he does not posit the establishment of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad gdags pa med pa ston par yang mdzad la /🔽gdags pa med pa rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yang mi mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad gdags pa med pa ston par yang mdzad la / gdags pa med pa rnam par gnas pa 'dogs par yang mi mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the absence of designation of all phenomena,🔽but he does not posit the establishment of the absence of designation.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa 'di ni shin tu zab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa 'di ni shin tu zab ste /
translated: this Dharma teaching of the Thus-Gone One is extremely profound.

original: chos zab mo yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pas kun shes par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos zab mo yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pas kun shes par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It cannot be understood by those who have not trained in the profound Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar 'dod pa 'khor ba las yongs su 'grol bar 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa bshad pa rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar 'dod pa 'khor ba las yongs su 'grol bar 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa bshad pa rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to fully awaken to buddhahood and liberate beings from saṃsāra should understand the teachings of the thus-gone ones that are explained in the accomplishment of the teachings.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe chos 'di dag la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na chos 'ga' yang len par yang mi byed /🔽'dor bar yang mi byed /🔽chos 'ga' yang bskyed par yang mi byed /🔽'gag par yang mi byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe chos 'di dag la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na chos 'ga' yang len par yang mi byed / 'dor bar yang mi byed / chos 'ga' yang bskyed par yang mi byed / 'gag par yang mi byed /
translated: when bodhisattvas discern these phenomena without hesitation or doubt, they do not adopt or reject anything.🔽They do not generate or stop anything.

original: chos 'ga' yang spros par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yang spros par yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not engage in conceptual elaboration.

original: bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa la yang nye bar sbyor la /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa la yang nye bar sbyor la /
translated: They apply themselves to the accomplishment of the truth,

original: bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa bsten pa la mngon par zhen par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa bsten pa la mngon par zhen par yang mi byed de /
translated: but they do not cling to the practice of accomplishing the truth.

original: de ltar na chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa kun shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa kun shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this way, they will understand the pure gateway to phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mngon par bsgrub pas yongs su sbyang ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mngon par bsgrub pas yongs su sbyang ba byas pa yin no //
translated: They are purified by accomplishing the gateway of samādhi.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: @100a *// dper na /
analyzed: @100a *// dper na /
translated: for example,

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni sems can bsod nams byas pa /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni sems can bsod nams byas pa /
translated: Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, is the abode of beings who have created merit,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: who have planted roots of virtue,

original: gzhal med khang la yongs su longs spyod pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhal med khang la yongs su longs spyod pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur zhing /
translated: and who enjoy palaces.

original: sems can der skyes pa rnams kyang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can der skyes pa rnams kyang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The beings who are born there are overjoyed.

original: de bzhin du chos rin po che kun nas bsdus pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams la ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rin po che kun nas bsdus pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams la ston par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, this precious compendium of Dharma is revealed to bodhisattvas who have planted roots of virtue.

original: rin po che des kyang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che 'thob cing chos bla na med pa shes pa rin po che'i rjes su 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro; ;bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: rin po che des kyang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che 'thob cing chos bla na med pa shes pa rin po che'i rjes su 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro; ;bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Through that precious jewel, bodhisattvas attain the precious wisdom of omniscience and will follow the precious knowledge of the unsurpassed Dharma.🔽Anantavyūha,

original: chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa'i mdo sde 'di ni chos kyi gter gyi gzungs yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa'i mdo sde 'di ni chos kyi gter gyi gzungs yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las 'byung ste /
translated: This sūtra, which is a compendium of all the Dharma, is taught by the thus-gone ones in order to reveal the dhāraṇī of the treasure of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi gzungs rgya chen po 'di rab tu 'byung yang nye bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi gzungs rgya chen po 'di rab tu 'byung yang nye bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This vast dhāraṇī of the Dharma is taught, but it does not remain present.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni sgo mtha' yas pa'i gzungs las 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni sgo mtha' yas pa'i gzungs las 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever is taught by the thus-gone ones all comes from the dhāraṇī of infinite gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgo rnam par sbyang ba dang / mdo sde thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi gzungs kyi tshul 'di ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgo rnam par sbyang ba dang / mdo sde thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi gzungs kyi tshul 'di ston par mdzad do //
translated: The thus-gone ones teach this method of the dhāraṇī of phenomena in order to purify the gateways and to gather all the sūtras.

original: mdo sde thams cad la yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i gzungs 'di ni byed pa med pa /
analyzed: mdo sde thams cad la yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i gzungs 'di ni byed pa med pa /
translated: This dhāraṇī that gathers all the sūtras is without action,

original: mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba /
translated: without change,

original: mtha' med pa /
analyzed: mtha' med pa /
translated: without end,

original: dbus med pa /
analyzed: dbus med pa /
translated: without middle,

original: mthar thug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mthar thug pa med pa ste /
translated: and without final limit.

original: gzungs 'di @100b ni rtsom pa tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzungs 'di @100b ni rtsom pa tshad med pa yin no //
translated: This dhāraṇī is of immeasurable composition.

original: gzungs kyi sgo 'di ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi brlabs kyis spyod do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo 'di ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi brlabs kyis spyod do //
translated: This dhāraṇī gateway is practiced throughout the worlds of the ten directions through the blessing of the tathāgatas.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de ni chos bstan pa 'di la gzungs kyi sgo rim par phye ba'i don gyi tshul brjod pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos bstan pa 'di la gzungs kyi sgo rim par phye ba'i don gyi tshul brjod pa dang po yin no //
translated: this is the first expression of the way of the meaning of the section of the dhāraṇī gateway in this Dharma teaching.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gang du chos thams cad yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ba de la ni byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul 'di rjes su rtogs pa /
analyzed: gang du chos thams cad yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ba de la ni byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul 'di rjes su rtogs pa /
translated: bodhisattvas who have realized this way of Dharma

original: chos kyi rgyun rab tu ma chad pa la 'jug par 'dod pa /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun rab tu ma chad pa la 'jug par 'dod pa /
translated: wish to engage in the uninterrupted stream of Dharma.

original: chos thams cad gnas med pa'i phyag rgya'i rjes su 'brang bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnas med pa'i phyag rgya'i rjes su 'brang bar 'dod pa /
translated: They wish to follow the seal of the absence of any basis for phenomena.

original: gsang sngags dang dgongs pa khong du chud pa nyams pa med pa /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang dgongs pa khong du chud pa nyams pa med pa /
translated: They are undiminished in their understanding of the secret mantra and its intent.

original: brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa /
translated: They are engaged in the application of great diligence.

original: chos 'di yang dag par shes shing chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa rnams kyis brjod pa dang / bstan pa gang gis kyang bsnyad gdags par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: chos 'di yang dag par shes shing chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa rnams kyis brjod pa dang / bstan pa gang gis kyang bsnyad gdags par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: This Dharma is not to be expressed or indicated by any expression or teaching of those who know the truth of this Dharma and have realized the characteristics of the nature of phenomena.

original: gsang sngags dang / dgongs pa thams cad nye bar bzung nas yang dag par rtogs par bya zhing /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang / dgongs pa thams cad nye bar bzung nas yang dag par rtogs par bya zhing /
translated: It is to be realized by comprehending all the secret mantras and intentions.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang; bde bar bya ba'i phyir yi ge zung du brjod pa shes pa la rjes su 'jug pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshul bstan pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang; bde bar bya ba'i phyir yi ge zung du brjod pa shes pa la rjes su 'jug pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshul bstan pa /
translated: In order to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings, it is to be taught by engaging in the knowledge of the paired syllables.

original: khong du chud pa /
analyzed: khong du chud pa /
translated: It is to be understood,

original: chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba shes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba shes pa /
translated: known as the classification of all phenomena,

original: rjes su dran pas bag la nyal gyi don bstan pa /
analyzed: rjes su dran pas bag la nyal gyi don bstan pa /
translated: taught as the meaning of latent tendencies through recollection,

original: dpe dang yang dag par sbyar byar bya /
analyzed: dpe dang yang dag par sbyar byar bya /
translated: to be applied with examples,

original: bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: and to be summarized.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam brjod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam brjod pa /
translated: Bodhisattvas who speak about the Dharma

original: chos ston pa la rab tu 'jug pa /
analyzed: chos ston pa la rab tu 'jug pa /
translated: engage in teaching the Dharma.

original: brtse @101a *// zhing phan 'dogs par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtse @101a *// zhing phan 'dogs par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: They should have a loving and helpful attitude.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa /
translated: They should desire the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med pa /
analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med pa /
translated: They should not be attached to any phenomena.

original: kun tu chags pa med pa sa la gnas pa /
analyzed: kun tu chags pa med pa sa la gnas pa /
translated: They should be free from attachment and abide on the bhūmis.

original: chog shes pa dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa rdzab rdzub ma yin pa nang shes pa dang phyi rol shes pa gnyis su mi ston pas /
analyzed: chog shes pa dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa rdzab rdzub ma yin pa nang shes pa dang phyi rol shes pa gnyis su mi ston pas /
translated: They should be content and should not be deceitful in their engagement with the wisdom of nonduality.

original: 'jig rten la chos 'ol spyi tsam du bstan par mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'jig rten la chos 'ol spyi tsam du bstan par mi bya'i /
translated: They should not teach the Dharma to the world in a general way, but

original: snyoms las med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis gong nas gong du chos yongs su btsal ba la mkhas pa la mngon par brtson par yang bya /
analyzed: snyoms las med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis gong nas gong du chos yongs su btsal ba la mkhas pa la mngon par brtson par yang bya /
translated: they should be diligent in their pursuit of the Dharma with undistracted diligence.

original: tshig thams cad kyang ci nas kyang mi 'gal ba de ltar rjes su mthun par yang bya /
analyzed: tshig thams cad kyang ci nas kyang mi 'gal ba de ltar rjes su mthun par yang bya /
translated: They should also be in accord with all the words in such a way that they are not contradictory.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa nye bar gnas par yang bya zhing bdag dang gzhan du 'du shes pa rnam par gzhig pa la mkhas par yang bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa nye bar gnas par yang bya zhing bdag dang gzhan du 'du shes pa rnam par gzhig pa la mkhas par yang bya'o //
translated: I will be skilled in the destruction of the notion of self and other.

original: chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas chos rnams bdag med pa la zhugs nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas chos rnams bdag med pa la zhugs nas /
translated: I will enter into the selflessness of all phenomena by following the purification of all phenomena.

original: bdag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod par yang bya ba'o //🔽dris kyang rung /🔽ma dris kyang rung /
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod par yang bya ba'o // dris kyang rung / ma dris kyang rung /
translated: I will aspire to purify the self.🔽I will teach the Dharma in an unbiased way, whether I am asked or not.

original: mkhyud pa med par chos kyi tshul yang dag par rab tu bstan par yang bya'o //🔽'di snyam du bdag gis sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i mchog /🔽sbyin pa'i dam pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mkhyud pa med par chos kyi tshul yang dag par rab tu bstan par yang bya'o // 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i mchog / sbyin pa'i dam pa 'di lta ste /
translated: I will teach the Dharma without being stingy.

original: chos bla na med pa rin po che'i mdzod gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos bla na med pa rin po che'i mdzod gtang bar bya'o //
translated: I will think, ‘I will give this supreme gift to sentient beings, this excellent gift, which is the unsurpassed jewel of the Dharma.

original: bdag gis sems can rnams brjod du med pa'i chos rin po che la sbyar @101b bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams brjod du med pa'i chos rin po che la sbyar @101b bar bya'o //
translated: I will connect sentient beings to the inexpressible jewel of the Dharma.

original: bdag gis phan ma btags kyang sems can 'ga' la yang chos kyi ser sna bskyed par mi bya'i /
analyzed: bdag gis phan ma btags kyang sems can 'ga' la yang chos kyi ser sna bskyed par mi bya'i /
translated: Even if I do not help them, I will not arouse stinginess with regard to the Dharma for any sentient beings.

original: ser sna chen por bya'o //🔽bdag gis gtong ba dang ldan zhing sbyin bdag mchog /
analyzed: ser sna chen por bya'o // bdag gis gtong ba dang ldan zhing sbyin bdag mchog /
translated: I will be a great donor.

original: chos kyi sbyin bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i don thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdzad pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i don thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdzad pa yang bya'o //
translated: I will be a donor with generosity, a supreme donor, a donor of the Dharma, and I will perform the deeds of a Tathāgata who knows all things.

original: bdag gis sems can rnams kyi khur chen po yang yongs su dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams kyi khur chen po yang yongs su dor bar bya'o //
translated: I will also put down the great burden of sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can rnams chu bo chen po las bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi gru bca' bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams chu bo chen po las bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi gru bca' bar yang bya'o //
translated: I will build a bridge of Dharma in order to liberate sentient beings from the great river.

original: bdag gis sems can rnams bde ba thams cad nye bar bsgrub pa la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems tshad med pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams bde ba thams cad nye bar bsgrub pa la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems tshad med pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will establish sentient beings in the attainment of all happiness.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpas myur du byams pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos chos khyad par can rjes su rtogs par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpas myur du byams pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos chos khyad par can rjes su rtogs par yang 'gyur /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva will quickly understand the special Dharma with a mind that is accomplished in love.

original: gzungs rnam par dbye ba mngon par bsgrub pa la bstan pa'i mdo 'di la yongs su smin par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: gzungs rnam par dbye ba mngon par bsgrub pa la bstan pa'i mdo 'di la yongs su smin par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be ripened for this discourse that teaches the accomplishment of the dhāraṇī’s divisions.

original: skye ba bzlog par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba bzlog par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will turn away from birth.

original: phas kyi rgol pa thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yang 'gyur /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol pa thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yang 'gyur /
translated: They will not be carried away by any opponents.

original: bdud thams cad pham par byas nas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdud thams cad pham par byas nas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod par 'gyur /
translated: Having defeated all māras, they will defeat all opponents through the Dharma.

original: rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be perfect in the pacification of disputes.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas; gzungs 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas legs par yongs su bzung zhing yid la mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas; gzungs 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas legs par yongs su bzung zhing yid la mdzad pa yin no //
translated: “Anantavyūha, this dhāraṇī has been well received and contemplated by the Thus-Gone One.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows:

original: dper na / byang chub sems dpa' srid @102a *//
analyzed: dper na / byang chub sems dpa' srid @102a *//
translated: For example, a bodhisattva who is in his last existence

original: pa tha ma pa ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi dbus dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas shing /
analyzed: pa tha ma pa ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi dbus dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas shing /
translated: The last type of bodhisattva lives in the Joyous Realm of Tuṣita, in the middle of the gods of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Yāma Heaven, the gods of the Joyous Heaven, and the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations.

original: lha thams cad kyis lhag par bgrod par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis mngon par dga' bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis lhag par bgrod par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis mngon par dga' bar bya ba yin /
translated: He is the object of the highest reverence of all the gods and is greatly loved by all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams chen pos yongs su zin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu smin pa yin /
analyzed: bsod nams chen pos yongs su zin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu smin pa yin /
translated: He is the fully ripened result of roots of virtue that are embraced by great merit.

original: srid pa gcig lus pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: srid pa gcig lus pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He possesses a mass of merit, a mass of discipline, and a completely pure perfection of generosity that is superior to all others, and he possesses a mass of wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sems can rnams kyi nang nas sems can 'gas kyang zil gyis mi non pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sems can rnams kyi nang nas sems can 'gas kyang zil gyis mi non pa yin /
translated: He is not outshone by any being in this great trichiliocosm.

original: sems can thams cad kyis kyang mchod cing bsngags par bya ba yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis kyang mchod cing bsngags par bya ba yin /
translated: He is worshipped and praised by all beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba la yang mngon du phyogs pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba la yang mngon du phyogs pa yin la /
translated: He is oriented toward attaining omniscient wisdom.

original: de gang gi tshe dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'phos te /🔽dbus kyi 'dzam bu'i gling du skye ba de'i tshe yul gyi dbus 'jigs pa med pa'i sa'i dkyil /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'phos te / dbus kyi 'dzam bu'i gling du skye ba de'i tshe yul gyi dbus 'jigs pa med pa'i sa'i dkyil /
translated: When he passes away from the Tuṣita realm🔽and is reborn in the central region of Jambudvīpa, he is born in the center of the country, in the middle of the land,

original: sa'i snying po sa phyogs mchog dam pa khyad par du 'phags pa dbus kyi grong khyer chen po sems can thams cad dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs su skye ste /
analyzed: sa'i snying po sa phyogs mchog dam pa khyad par du 'phags pa dbus kyi grong khyer chen po sems can thams cad dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs su skye ste /
translated: in the heart of the earth, in the supreme, holy, and special central city, in the region that is endowed with all sentient beings.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' @102b sems can rnams kyi nang du 'ongs shing sems can thams cad kyis blta bar bya ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' @102b sems can rnams kyi nang du 'ongs shing sems can thams cad kyis blta bar bya ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva is included among sentient beings and is to be seen, worshipped, honored, and revered by all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo mdo 'di yang chos rnams kyi nang du 'dus shing khongs su gtogs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo mdo 'di yang chos rnams kyi nang du 'dus shing khongs su gtogs la /
translated: In the same way, this dhāraṇī gateway is included among the teachings and is contained within them.

original: chos thams cad zil gyis mnon pa dang / dngos po med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad zil gyis mnon pa dang / dngos po med pa yang yin no //
translated: It surpasses all teachings and is non-existent.

original: 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs su smin par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs su smin par yang 'gyur /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in this will become mature,

original: rnam par 'phel bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar yang 'gyur /
translated: will increase,

original: mchog thob par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: mchog thob par yang 'gyur /
translated: will attain the supreme,

original: chos thams cad kyi bdag por yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bdag por yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and will become the lord of all teachings.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma pa mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa ni chos thams cad kyis spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can thams cad la rnam par blta bar yang byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma pa mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa ni chos thams cad kyis spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can thams cad la rnam par blta bar yang byed /
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas in their final existences who have taken birth among humans will, through the meditative absorption of the invisible crown of the head of all phenomena, look out upon all sentient beings.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la yongs su rtog par yang byed cing /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la yongs su rtog par yang byed cing /
translated: They will also contemplate the entire trichiliocosm.

original: shes rab chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: shes rab chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: Through the power of their great insight,

original: legs par byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems rgya chen pos chos kyi gzungs kyi snying po yang rjes su thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: legs par byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems rgya chen pos chos kyi gzungs kyi snying po yang rjes su thob par 'gyur /
translated: they will attain the essence of the dhāraṇī of the Dharma with a vast and well-blessed mind.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med cing chags par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod par 'gyur ba'i rgyud thams cad don du gnyer ba yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med cing chags par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod par 'gyur ba'i rgyud thams cad don du gnyer ba yin /
translated: They will not delight in or be attached to any of the enjoyments of the desire realm, and they will pursue all the causes of desire.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis shin tu rnam par bltas pa'i blo dang ldan zhing mtshan ma med pa la mkhas pa @103a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis shin tu rnam par bltas pa'i blo dang ldan zhing mtshan ma med pa la mkhas pa @103a *//
translated: They have the intelligence that comes from the samādhi of the emptiness of all phenomena, and they are skilled in the absence of marks.

original: rjes su thob pa yin /
analyzed: rjes su thob pa yin /
translated: They have attained the subsequent stage.

original: sa gang la yang chags pa med cing khams gsum thams cad la ro myang ba med pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang nye bar zhi ba dang / mos pa'i khams kyang rtogs la /
analyzed: sa gang la yang chags pa med cing khams gsum thams cad la ro myang ba med pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang nye bar zhi ba dang / mos pa'i khams kyang rtogs la /
translated: They are not attached to any stage, and they do not savor the experience of the three realms. They understand the realms of faults, of escape, of peace, and of aspiration,

original: de la mngon par zhen pa med cing mi gnas pa'i sems bskyed par yang byed do //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa med cing mi gnas pa'i sems bskyed par yang byed do //
translated: but they do not cling to them, and they do not give rise to a mind that abides.

original: chos rnams la yongs su rtog cing kun 'byung ba 'gag par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po bskyed nas dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i blo yang dag par skyed par yang byed /
analyzed: chos rnams la yongs su rtog cing kun 'byung ba 'gag par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po bskyed nas dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i blo yang dag par skyed par yang byed /
translated: They contemplate phenomena and give rise to great love and great compassion for sentient beings in order to stop the origin of suffering. They give rise to the mind of liberation in those whose faculties are ripe.

original: shes rab mchog gi rjes su song ba'i blo'i tshul la mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i bdag po rjes su dran zhing chos rnams la gzungs kyi tshul nyams pa med pa la mkhas pa yang thob par 'gyur /🔽chos thams cad rab tu rnam par dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pas legs par rnam par bltas nas chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul rnam par gtan la dbab pa la rtog cing gzhon nu'i tshe 'dod pa rnams la rtse zhing kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba'i
analyzed: shes rab mchog gi rjes su song ba'i blo'i tshul la mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa'i bdag po rjes su dran zhing chos rnams la gzungs kyi tshul nyams pa med pa la mkhas pa yang thob par 'gyur / chos thams cad rab tu rnam par dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pas legs par rnam par bltas nas chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul rnam par gtan la dbab pa la rtog cing gzhon nu'i tshe 'dod pa rnams la rtse zhing kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba'i
translated: They will be skilled in the way of the mind that follows supreme insight, and they will be skilled in the way of the mind that is the lord of all beings. They will also attain skill in the way of the dhāraṇī that is unimpaired with regard to phenomena.

original: sems dben pa la mngon du phyogs pas /
analyzed: sems dben pa la mngon du phyogs pas /
translated: “They will be skilled in the knowledge of the perfect classification of all phenomena. Having perfectly observed this, they will contemplate the ascertainment of the way of the inconceivability of phenomena. In their youth, they will play with desires, but their minds will be inclined toward solitude.

original: nor dang // 'bru dang / gnyen thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: nor dang // 'bru dang / gnyen thams cad spangs te /
translated: They will give up all wealth, grain, and relatives,

original: khyim nas khyim med par mngon par 'byung bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: khyim nas khyim med par mngon par 'byung bar yang 'gyur /
translated: and they will go forth from home to homelessness.

original: rab tu byung nas kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul la mkhas pa'i blo dang ldan zhing las ji @103b lta ba bzhin du legs par byas pa nye bar bsags pa'i byang chub kyi snying por seng nas smon lam rnam par bkod pa ji lta ba bzhin du
analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul la mkhas pa'i blo dang ldan zhing las ji @103b lta ba bzhin du legs par byas pa nye bar bsags pa'i byang chub kyi snying por seng nas smon lam rnam par bkod pa ji lta ba bzhin du
translated: After going forth, he became learned in the inconceivable way and, having accumulated the proper karma, he went to the seat of awakening and made the following aspiration:🔽

original: gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa bla na med pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzungs kyi tshul la mkhas pa bla na med pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Having gone forth, they will have a mind that is skilled in the inconceivable way and will have accumulated the proper and excellent actions. Having gone to the seat of awakening, they will attain the unexcelled skill in the way of dhāraṇī, just as they have arranged their aspirations.

original: gzungs la mkhas pa rnam par dag pa phul du phyin pa des chos thams cad kyang rang 'byung gi ye shes kyis rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzungs la mkhas pa rnam par dag pa phul du phyin pa des chos thams cad kyang rang 'byung gi ye shes kyis rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Through that pure and perfect skill in dhāraṇī, they will realize all phenomena with self-arisen wisdom.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kun tu 'dzin pa la mkhas pa nyams pa med pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kun tu 'dzin pa la mkhas pa nyams pa med pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: They will also attain the undiminishing skill in retaining the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzungs rjes su thob nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par nges pa /🔽shin tu sbyangs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzungs rjes su thob nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par nges pa /🔽shin tu sbyangs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Having attained the dhāraṇī of omniscience, they will attain the certainty and thorough refinement of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul bla na med pa la legs par gnas shing chos dang mthun par chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa yang bskor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul bla na med pa la legs par gnas shing chos dang mthun par chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa yang bskor bar 'gyur /
translated: They will abide well in the unsurpassed domain of omniscience and will turn the unsurpassed wheel of Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad shes shing nges pa'i tshig ston par gyur pas shin tu mdzes par snang la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang dbyangs kyi snang bas go bar byed par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad shes shing nges pa'i tshig ston par gyur pas shin tu mdzes par snang la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang dbyangs kyi snang bas go bar byed par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be very beautiful as they teach the words that ascertain all phenomena, and they will make the world and its gods understand through the light of their voices.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzungs kyi phyag rgya la gnas te /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzungs kyi phyag rgya la gnas te /
translated: “Anantavyūha, bodhisattvas who abide by the seal of the dhāraṇī of omniscient wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: gzungs kyi sgo bstan du med pa bskal pa bye ba phrag du mar dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo bstan du med pa bskal pa bye ba phrag du mar dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who have trained in the roots of virtue for many millions of eons through the teaching of the dhāraṇī gateway

original: byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa gzhan dag gis kyang @104a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa gzhan dag gis kyang @104a *//
translated: will be bodhisattvas who are impeded by only a single birth.

original: kun shes par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kun shes par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that they will become omniscient.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa byang chub kyi ched du chos zab mo la bzod pa thob nas yun ring du lon pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa byang chub kyi ched du chos zab mo la bzod pa thob nas yun ring du lon pa /
translated: It is only the bodhisattvas who, having attained acceptance of the profound Dharma for the sake of awakening while seated at the seat of awakening,

original: tshangs par spyad nas yun ring ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyad nas yun ring ba /
translated: who have practiced pure conduct for a long time,

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad la yun ring mo zhig nas byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sems dang ldan pa kho na la gzungs kyi sgo bdag nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa'i blos mngon du 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad la yun ring mo zhig nas byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sems dang ldan pa kho na la gzungs kyi sgo bdag nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa'i blos mngon du 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: and who, for a long time, have had a mind that is accomplished through great love and great compassion for all sentient beings, who will manifest the dhāraṇī gateway through their own mind of conduct.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs kyi sgo des byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug nas /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo des byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug nas /
translated: through this dhāraṇī gateway, bodhisattvas who are seated at the seat of awakening

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs kyi sgo gang zhig ngas da ltar khyed la rnam par rig par byar med pa de ni de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rang gis rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo gang zhig ngas da ltar khyed la rnam par rig par byar med pa de ni de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rang gis rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: The dhāraṇī gateway that I cannot make you understand now will be understood by the bodhisattvas at that time.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs kyi sgo de ni sgo mtha' yas pa dang / rgyu'i sgo dang / sgo tshad med pa dang / sgo dpe med pa yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs kyi sgo de ni sgo mtha' yas pa dang / rgyu'i sgo dang / sgo tshad med pa dang / sgo dpe med pa yin //
translated: At that time, that bodhisattva dhāraṇī gateway will be an infinite gateway, a causal gateway, a gateway of immeasurability, and a gateway of incomparability.

original: sgo de ni bstan du med pa yin //
analyzed: sgo de ni bstan du med pa yin //
translated: That gateway will be an ungraspable gateway.

original: sgo de ni 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa yin /
analyzed: sgo de ni 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa yin /
translated: That gateway will be superior to all worlds.

original: sgo de ni lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / dge slong dang bram ze bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten dang thun mong du ma gyur ba yin /
analyzed: sgo de ni lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / dge slong dang bram ze bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten dang thun mong du ma gyur ba yin /
translated: That gateway will not be shared in common with the world of beings, including gods, māras, and śramaṇas and brahmins.

original: sgo de ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur cing /
analyzed: sgo de ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur cing /
translated: That gateway will be the supreme Dharma.

original: thams cad @104b mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad @104b mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par byed pa yin no //
translated: It will purify omniscient wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgo des rang 'byung gi ye shes rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgo des rang 'byung gi ye shes rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: Bodhisattvas, through this gateway, purify self-arisen wisdom.

original: rang 'byung gi ye shes thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed cing /
analyzed: rang 'byung gi ye shes thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed cing /
translated: Having attained self-arisen wisdom, they turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: rim gyis sems can dpag tu med pa dag chos kyi sgo rnam par sbyang ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nye bar len du yang 'dzud /
analyzed: rim gyis sems can dpag tu med pa dag chos kyi sgo rnam par sbyang ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nye bar len du yang 'dzud /
translated: In stages, they also introduce countless sentient beings to the gateway of omniscient wisdom so that they may purify the gateway of Dharma and perfect the gateway of nirvāṇa.

original: chos kyi tshul rgyu du ma dang ldan pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul rgyu du ma dang ldan pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
translated: They also teach the skill in the many causes of the way of Dharma.

original: phung po shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang len du 'dzud /
analyzed: phung po shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang len du 'dzud /
translated: They also introduce them to the skill in the knowledge of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnam par dag pa shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
analyzed: phung po rnam par dag pa shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
translated: They also explain the skill in the knowledge of the purity of the aggregates.

original: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa yang ston /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa yang ston /
translated: They also teach the knowledge of the elements, the sense sources, and dependent origination.

original: sems can rnams kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo las 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo las 'dzud par byed /
translated: They cause sentient beings to enter through the gateway of the realization of the noble truths.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang bskyed /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang bskyed /
translated: They give rise to expertise in the complete retention of the purity of the noble truths.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi tshul la mkhas pa kun 'dzin pa dang / rnam par dbye ba yang bskyed /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi tshul la mkhas pa kun 'dzin pa dang / rnam par dbye ba yang bskyed /
translated: They give rise to expertise in the complete retention and discernment of the way of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams shes pa rnam par dag pa yang yang dag par ston /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams shes pa rnam par dag pa yang yang dag par ston /
translated: They teach the pure knowledge of the factors of awakening.

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
translated: They explain expertise in the complete retention of the knowledge of tranquility and special insight.

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong shes pa rnam par dag pa yang kun tu ston /🔽ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa la mkhas pa kun @105a *//
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong shes pa rnam par dag pa yang kun tu ston / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa la mkhas pa kun @105a *//
translated: They teach the purity of the knowledge of tranquility and special insight.

original: 'dzin pa yang bskyed /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang bskyed /
translated: They give rise to expertise in the complete retention of the knowledge of samādhi and absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
translated: He teaches the skill in retaining the purity of concentration, absorption, and equipoise.

original: rmongs pa dang bral zhing rmongs pa med pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang bral zhing rmongs pa med pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
translated: He teaches the skill in retaining the absence of delusion and the absence of confusion.

original: rmongs pa dang bral zhing rmongs pa med pa shes pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang bral zhing rmongs pa med pa shes pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
translated: He teaches the skill in retaining the purity of the knowledge of the absence of delusion and the absence of confusion.

original: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi skye ba shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
analyzed: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi skye ba shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
translated: He teaches the skill in retaining the knowledge of exhaustion, of being free from desire, and of nonarising.

original: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnam par dag pa yang ston /🔽rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
analyzed: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnam par dag pa yang ston / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
translated: He teaches the purity of the knowledge of exhaustion, of being free from desire, and of nonarising.🔽He teaches the skill in retaining the knowledge of awareness and liberation.

original: rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
analyzed: rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa rnam par dag pa kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang ston /
translated: He teaches the skill in retaining the purity of the knowledge of awareness and liberation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo rnam par dag pa yang brjod /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo rnam par dag pa yang brjod /
translated: the pure gateway to nirvāṇa,

original: rnam par dag pa'i tshig thams cad dang bral ba kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i tshig thams cad dang bral ba kun 'dzin pa la mkhas pa yang brjod /
translated: and the skill in retaining all the words of purity.

original: rnam grangs du mas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi sgo rnam par dag pa yang brjod /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi sgo rnam par dag pa yang brjod /
translated: He also describes the pure gateway to conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, to phenomena with and without defilements, and to mundane and supramundane phenomena through numerous categories.

original: chos bla na med pa rnam par nges pa dang / sems can rnams kyi shes pa rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa kun 'dzin pa'i rgyu yang yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: chos bla na med pa rnam par nges pa dang / sems can rnams kyi shes pa rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa kun 'dzin pa'i rgyu yang yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: He also teaches the cause for retaining the skill in the ascertainment of the unsurpassed Dharma and the purity of the cognition of sentient beings.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin @105b gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzungs la mkhas pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin @105b gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzungs la mkhas pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: the Thus-Gone One has generated the power of skill in the dhāraṇī of omniscient wisdom.

original: sems can rnams la ji ltar smon pa bzhin de 'dra'i spyod pa kun tu ston cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la ji ltar smon pa bzhin de 'dra'i spyod pa kun tu ston cing /
translated: He displays conduct that accords with the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: blo'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu dbye bar mkhas pa la yang 'jug par mdzad /
analyzed: blo'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu dbye bar mkhas pa la yang 'jug par mdzad /
translated: He causes them to engage in the skill of discerning the way of mind just as it is.

original: chos kyi gter gyi gzungs bla na med pa'i mthu yang ston par mdzad /🔽chos kyi rgyun yang gtong bar mdzad /
analyzed: chos kyi gter gyi gzungs bla na med pa'i mthu yang ston par mdzad / chos kyi rgyun yang gtong bar mdzad /
translated: He displays the power of the unsurpassed dhāraṇī treasure of the Dharma.🔽He releases the stream of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi char yang 'bebs par mdzad /
analyzed: chos kyi char yang 'bebs par mdzad /
translated: He causes the rain of the Dharma to fall.

original: sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi sbyin pas tshim par mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi sbyin pas tshim par mdzad do //
translated: He satisfies all beings with the gift of the Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bslab par bya zhing /
analyzed: khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bslab par bya zhing /
translated: you should train in accordance with the Thus-Gone One.

original: chos zab mo rnam par nges pa 'di la yang mthun par gnas par bya'i /
analyzed: chos zab mo rnam par nges pa 'di la yang mthun par gnas par bya'i /
translated: You should abide in harmony with this ascertainment of the profound Dharma,

original: mi mthun par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par ni mi bya'o //
translated: not in a way that is discordant.

original: khyed kyis myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i gzungs chen po 'di kun tu gzung zhig /
analyzed: khyed kyis myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i gzungs chen po 'di kun tu gzung zhig /
translated: You should quickly uphold this great dhāraṇī seal of omniscient wisdom.

original: gzungs 'di la gnas nas kyang ji ltar nga da ltar byed pa bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don gyis shig /
analyzed: gzungs 'di la gnas nas kyang ji ltar nga da ltar byed pa bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don gyis shig /
translated: Abiding in this dhāraṇī, you should benefit beings just as I do now.”

original: gzungs kyi sgo'i mdo 'di yang ston cig /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo'i mdo 'di yang ston cig /
translated: and teach this dhāraṇī gateway sūtra.

original: chos rnams kyi rnam par nges pa yang rnam grangs du mas ston cig /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam par nges pa yang rnam grangs du mas ston cig /
translated: “Teach the ascertainment of phenomena through many enumerations.

original: rab tu ston cig /
analyzed: rab tu ston cig /
translated: Teach them well.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi bsam pa'i tshogs dang ma bral bas mos pa'i stobs bskyed pa 'dod par bya'o /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi bsam pa'i tshogs dang ma bral bas mos pa'i stobs bskyed pa 'dod par bya'o /
translated: you should wish to generate the power of resolve by being inseparable from the accumulation of the intention of the mind of awakening.

original: ;ji ltar mos pa'i stobs bskyed pa 'dod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ;ji ltar mos pa'i stobs bskyed pa 'dod par bya zhe na /
translated: How should you wish to generate the power of resolve?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs dang ma bral bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar na byang chub sems @106a *//
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs dang ma bral bar bya'o // ji ltar na byang chub sems @106a *//
translated: You should be inseparable from the accumulation of the factors of awakening.

original: dpas; chos thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa la mos par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dpas; chos thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa la mos par bya zhe na /
translated: How should bodhisattvas wish to be skilled in the way of all phenomena?

original: chos rnams ni skye ba yang med /
analyzed: chos rnams ni skye ba yang med /
translated: Phenomena are unborn,

original: 'chi 'pho yang med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho yang med /
translated: they do not die or transmigrate,

original: 'byung ba yang med /🔽'pho ba yang med /
analyzed: 'byung ba yang med / 'pho ba yang med /
translated: they do not arise,🔽they do not transmigrate,

original: g-yo ba yang med /🔽'ong ba yang med /
analyzed: g-yo ba yang med / 'ong ba yang med /
translated: they do not move,🔽they do not come,

original: 'gro ba yang med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang med de /
translated: and they do not go.

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa yin pas stong pa nyid du yang mngon par zhen par mi bya na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa yin pas stong pa nyid du yang mngon par zhen par mi bya na /
translated: Since all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, one should not even cling to emptiness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much less should one cling to the signs of form and so forth?

original: mtshan mar 'du shes pa la ni rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'du shes pa la ni rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
translated: For one who perceives signs, there is no acceptance that accords with reality.

original: stong pa nyid la ni mtshan ma mi 'byung ste; stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni mtshan ma rab tu rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni mtshan ma mi 'byung ste; stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni mtshan ma rab tu rgyu ba med do //
translated: In emptiness, signs do not arise. In emptiness, there is no movement of signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang 'du byed du gtogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni bdag dang / bdag gi dang / srog dang sems can dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / gang zag gis stong zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang 'du byed du gtogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni bdag dang / bdag gi dang / srog dang sems can dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / gang zag gis stong zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has said that all these conditioned things are empty of self, of what belongs to a self, of life-force, of sentient being, of human, of human being, and of person.

original: stong pa nyid la ni kun tu chags pa yang med /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni kun tu chags pa yang med /
translated: In emptiness, there is no attachment.

original: chags pa dang bral ba yang med do //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba yang med do //
translated: There is also no one free from attachment.

original: stong pa nyid la ni sdang ba yang med /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni sdang ba yang med /
translated: In emptiness, there is no anger.

original: sdang ba dang bral ba yang med do //
analyzed: sdang ba dang bral ba yang med do //
translated: There is no anger, and there is also no absence of anger.

original: stong pa nyid la ni rmongs pa yang med /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni rmongs pa yang med /
translated: In emptiness there is no delusion,

original: rmongs pa dang bral ba yang med do //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang bral ba yang med do //
translated: and there is also no absence of delusion.

original: stong pa nyid la ni rjes su chags pa yang med; rjes su chags pa dang bral ba yang med de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni rjes su chags pa yang med; rjes su chags pa dang bral ba yang med de /
translated: In emptiness there is no attachment and there is also no absence of attachment.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la yang mi gnas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la yang mi gnas /
translated: Emptiness does not abide in emptiness,

original: kun tu mi gnas /
analyzed: kun tu mi gnas /
translated: it does not abide everywhere,

original: rab tu mi gnas so //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas so //
translated: and it does not abide at all.

original: stong pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang @106b bral ba yin /
analyzed: stong pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang @106b bral ba yin /
translated: That which is empty is free from desire,

original: de ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba yin te /🔽de la ni rtog pa yang med /🔽kun tu rtog pa yang med /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba yin te / de la ni rtog pa yang med / kun tu rtog pa yang med /
translated: it is cessation and peace.🔽There is no conceptualization,🔽no thought,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang med /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang med /
translated: no discrimination,

original: yongs su rtog pa yang med la /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa yang med la /
translated: and no postulation.

original: rtsom pa med cing nyon mongs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsom pa med cing nyon mongs pa med pa yin te /
translated: There is no undertaking and no affliction.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin ni len pa med cing rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin ni len pa med cing rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Its essential nature is free from grasping and is pure.

original: chos dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: The nature of all dharmas, whether wholesome or unwholesome, conditioned or unconditioned, mundane or supramundane, is emptiness.

original: de ltar mos pa mngon du byed pa de ni rnam par grol ba 'dren par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa mngon du byed pa de ni rnam par grol ba 'dren par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has such an aspiration will attain liberation.

original: rnam par grol na rnam par grol ba'i ye shes rtogs par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par grol na rnam par grol ba'i ye shes rtogs par yang 'gyur /
translated: When one is liberated, one will realize the wisdom of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa dri ma med pa la gnas shing byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs kyang yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa dri ma med pa la gnas shing byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs kyang yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding in the stainless purity of liberation, one will also accomplish the accumulation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the accumulation of the factors of enlightenment?

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: It is the purity of morality, the purity of wisdom, the purity of concentration, the purity of liberation, and the purity of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: the purity of the perfection of generosity, the purity of the perfection of moral discipline, the purity of the perfection of patience, the purity of the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin @107a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin @107a *//
translated: the purity of the perfection of concentration, and the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: no; ;gang rnam par dag pa de ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: no; ;gang rnam par dag pa de ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: That which is pure is purified.

original: gang yongs su dag pa de ni sgo dri ma med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang yongs su dag pa de ni sgo dri ma med pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is purified is the stainless gate.

original: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: The mind is luminous by nature.

original: rtag tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: It is never defiled.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum ni glo bur ba /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum ni glo bur ba /
translated: The three secondary defilements are adventitious,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: unreal,

original: gsog gsob ste /
analyzed: gsog gsob ste /
translated: hollow, and void.

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist.

original: sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'dre ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'dre ba yang ma yin /
translated: The mind is not mixed with affliction.

original: rnam par byang ba dang 'dre ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang 'dre ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not mixed with the process of purification.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
