analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems de ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: sems de ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: The mind is nondual and cannot be made dual.

original: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Its nature is purity.

original: gang gis de ltar shes pa de ni nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar shes pa de ni nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who knows that will not be afflicted by afflictions.

original: sems ni nang dang / phyi rol dang / gnyis ka'i bar du yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la dmigs su med de /
analyzed: sems ni nang dang / phyi rol dang / gnyis ka'i bar du yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la dmigs su med de /
translated: The mind is not afflicted internally, externally, or somewhere in between. It is not an object.

original: dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs nas sems skye ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs nas sems skye ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the arising of the mind from the coming together of causes and conditions,

original: 'di la skye ba yang yang dag par mi snang ste /
analyzed: 'di la skye ba yang yang dag par mi snang ste /
translated: there is no arising that can be observed here.

original: phyogs bcur yang sems kyis sems mi shes so //
analyzed: phyogs bcur yang sems kyis sems mi shes so //
translated: The mind does not know the mind in the ten directions.

original: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //🔽sems dang dmigs pa 'dre ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo // sems dang dmigs pa 'dre ba yang ma yin la /
translated: The mind does not see the mind.🔽The mind is not mixed with the object,

original: dmigs pa yang sems dang 'dre ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang sems dang 'dre ba ma yin no //
translated: and the object is not mixed with the mind.

original: sems kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kun tu sbyor ba ma yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kun tu sbyor ba ma yin la /
translated: The mind is not connected to causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang sems dang kun tu sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang sems dang kun tu sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: Causes and conditions are not connected to the mind.

original: chos thams cad ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems tsam ste /
translated: All phenomena are mind only.

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are connected to the mind.

original: @107b chos gang dag sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag kyang phan tshun mi shes mi mthong na /
analyzed: @107b chos gang dag sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag kyang phan tshun mi shes mi mthong na /
translated: If phenomena that are connected to the mind do not know each other, do not see each other,

original: gang dag sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa de dag smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa de dag smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention those that are not connected to the mind?

original: don dam par ni sems de gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa yang med /
analyzed: don dam par ni sems de gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa yang med /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the mind is not connected to anything,

original: mtshungs par mi ldan pa yang med do //
analyzed: mtshungs par mi ldan pa yang med do //
translated: and it is not disconnected from anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos 'ga' yang chos gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa med de /
analyzed: chos 'ga' yang chos gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa med de /
translated: No phenomenon is connected to or disconnected from any phenomenon.

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu zhi ba yin no //
translated: All phenomena are by nature completely at peace.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: By nature, they are not connected and

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: not disconnected.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The intrinsic reality of phenomena is their nature.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de la ni ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de la ni ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: That which is their nature is their non-intrinsic reality.

original: 'on kyang bshad pa ston pas 'di skad du chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin du gyur pa'o zhes tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bshad pa ston pas 'di skad du chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin du gyur pa'o zhes tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: However, the teacher explains that all phenomena are said to have intrinsic reality and nature.

original: chos rnams la ni ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin med do //
translated: Phenomena do not have intrinsic reality or nature.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid med cing stong pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid med cing stong pa yin no //
translated: The nature of phenomena is non-intrinsic reality and emptiness.

original: gang ngo bo nyid med cing stong pa nyid de ni mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid med cing stong pa nyid de ni mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: That which is non-intrinsic reality and emptiness is of one characteristic.

original: de ni mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid rnam par dag par gyur ba yin pas /🔽mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'am /🔽stong par gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid rnam par dag par gyur ba yin pas / mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'am / stong par gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is without characteristics, it is purified of characteristics.🔽Therefore, it is not to be designated as empty or as having an intrinsic reality that is without characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'am /
translated: It is not to be designated as empty or as having an intrinsic reality that is without characteristics.

original: stong par gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid kyis gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: stong par gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid kyis gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as emptiness is not something to be designated, so too all phenomena are not something to be designated by their characteristics.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa dang / stong pa nyid la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang @108a *//
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa dang / stong pa nyid la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang @108a *//
translated: In the absence of intrinsic identity and emptiness,

original: par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: there is neither affliction🔽nor purification.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni de lta bu yin te /🔽chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni de lta bu yin te / chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: The nature of phenomena is such that🔽the nature of phenomena does not abide in affliction

original: rnam par byang bar mi gnas /🔽kun tu mi gnas /🔽rab tu mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi gnas / kun tu mi gnas / rab tu mi gnas so //
translated: or in purification.🔽It does not abide at all,

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: nor does it abide at all.🔽“Anantavyūha,

original: chos thams cad mi gnas /🔽kun tu mi gnas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi gnas / kun tu mi gnas /
translated: since all phenomena do not abide,🔽do not abide at all,

original: rab tu mi gnas na /
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas na /
translated: and do not abide at all,

original: sems can dag ji ltar kun tu rmongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can dag ji ltar kun tu rmongs par 'gyur /
translated: how could beings be deluded?

original: de la kun tu rmongs pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de la kun tu rmongs pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since there is no delusion there,

original: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pas kun tu rmongs par gyur pa la ltos /
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pas kun tu rmongs par gyur pa la ltos /
translated: consider how the inhabitants of the world are deluded by their false delusions.

original: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni kun tu rmongs pa'i 'khor lo yang dag pa ma yin pa la zhugs kyang /🔽gang du yang zhugs pa med la /
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni kun tu rmongs pa'i 'khor lo yang dag pa ma yin pa la zhugs kyang / gang du yang zhugs pa med la /
translated: Alas, these beings of the world are caught up in the wheel of delusion, yet they are not caught up in anything.

original: zhugs pa med bzhin du nam mkha'i 'chi bas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa med bzhin du nam mkha'i 'chi bas bcings pa'o //
translated: They are not caught up in anything, yet they are bound by the death of space.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni nam mkha'i 'khor lo la kun tu zhugs kyang nam mkha' la ni 'khor lor gdags pa yang med do //
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni nam mkha'i 'khor lo la kun tu zhugs kyang nam mkha' la ni 'khor lor gdags pa yang med do //
translated: Alas, these beings are caught up in the wheel of space, yet there is no wheel to be labeled in space.

original: kun tu rmongs pa chen pos kun tu rmongs par gyur kyang pa'i lam rig pa yang med /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa chen pos kun tu rmongs par gyur kyang pa'i lam rig pa yang med /
translated: They are deluded by great delusion, yet there is no path of delusion to be known.

original: kun tu rmongs pa yang med do //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa yang med do //
translated: There is no delusion at all.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /🔽sems can rnams ma rig pa'i ling tog des chos 'di dag rab tu mi shes /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas / sems can rnams ma rig pa'i ling tog des chos 'di dag rab tu mi shes /
translated: “‘Anantavyūha,

original: mi rtogs shing rtsod pa la kun tu 'jug pa la ltos /
analyzed: mi rtogs shing rtsod pa la kun tu 'jug pa la ltos /
translated: consider how beings, due to the cataracts of ignorance, do not understand or realize these phenomena, and how they engage in disputes.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gang su dag rtsod pa la kun tu zhugs pa de dag ni zhugs pa med ste /
analyzed: gang su dag rtsod pa la kun tu zhugs pa de dag ni zhugs pa med ste /
translated: those who engage in disputes do not engage in anything.

original: 'di ltar bdag kun tu rmongs pas mi shes shing ma mthong bar @108b zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag kun tu rmongs pas mi shes shing ma mthong bar @108b zad do //
translated: In this way, I am completely confused, ignorant, and do not see.

original: gang dag kun tu ma zhugs pa de dag ni rnam par dag par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang dag kun tu ma zhugs pa de dag ni rnam par dag par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Those who do not engage in this way will not become pure.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa la zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa la zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not engage in the purification of the roots of virtue.

original: de'i phyir de dag kun tu ma zhugs pa'i yon no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kun tu ma zhugs pa'i yon no //
translated: Therefore, they do not engage in the purification of the roots of virtue.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa bstan pa'i rnam grangs ni khyed lta bu yun ring po nas dge ba'i chos rnam par dben pa la spyod spyod pa rnams ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis rgyas par kun shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa bstan pa'i rnam grangs ni khyed lta bu yun ring po nas dge ba'i chos rnam par dben pa la spyod spyod pa rnams ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis rgyas par kun shes pa ma yin no //
translated: except for those like you who have long engaged in the practice of the virtuous and secluded Dharma, this enumeration of the teachings of the thus-gone ones is not fully understood by others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gang dag kun tu zhugs pa de dag ni rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa gang la kun tu zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gang dag kun tu zhugs pa de dag ni rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa gang la kun tu zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: When the Thus-Gone One says, ‘Those who engage in this way will not become pure,’ what is it that they engage in?

original: mi dge ba la kun tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la kun tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: They engage in nonvirtue.

original: gang la mi dge ba yod pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la mi dge ba yod pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who have nonvirtue do not exist.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni kun tu zhugs pa'am kun tu ma zhugs pa'i rnam grangs su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni kun tu zhugs pa'am kun tu ma zhugs pa'i rnam grangs su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not exist cannot be counted as either engaged or not engaged.

original: gang dag dge ba la kun tu zhugs pa de dag ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dge ba la kun tu zhugs pa de dag ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who are engaged in virtue are not counted.

original: gang dag rnam grangs su ma gtogs pa de dag gis ni bstan pa kha na ma tho ba med pa 'di kun shes par 'gyur yang de dag rnam par dag par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag rnam grangs su ma gtogs pa de dag gis ni bstan pa kha na ma tho ba med pa 'di kun shes par 'gyur yang de dag rnam par dag par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are not counted will understand this faultless teaching, but they will not be purified.

original: de ni gnas med do ////🔽bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //// bam po gsum pa /
translated: That is impossible.

original: sems can byis pa so so'i skye bo blo gros ngan pa nyon mongs pa chen po la kun tu zhugs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyis ni chos bstan pa 'di'i rjes su mthun pa cung zad kyang mi shes na /
analyzed: sems can byis pa so so'i skye bo blo gros ngan pa nyon mongs pa chen po la kun tu zhugs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyis ni chos bstan pa 'di'i rjes su mthun pa cung zad kyang mi shes na /
translated: Foolish ordinary beings with bad intellects are engaged in great afflictions. Their wisdom does not understand even a little that accords with this teaching on the Dharma.

original: rab tu mthun pa dang / rnam grangs mang po bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rab tu mthun pa dang / rnam grangs mang po bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: How much less could they understand a teaching that accords with it and is explained with many synonyms?

original: gang kun tu zhugs @109a *//
analyzed: gang kun tu zhugs @109a *//
translated: Those who are engaged in the afflictions

original: pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i chos can no zhes bya ba gang la kun tu zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i chos can no zhes bya ba gang la kun tu zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: He is one who has entered into the pure dharmas.

original: dge ba la kun tu zhugs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams la kun tu zhugs pa yin te /🔽nges par 'byung ba la ni khams kyang med /
analyzed: dge ba la kun tu zhugs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams la kun tu zhugs pa yin te / nges par 'byung ba la ni khams kyang med /
translated: He has entered into virtue and he has entered into the element of renunciation.

original: khams su gdags pa yang med do //🔽gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams la kun tu zhugs pa zhes rnam grangs su brjod pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa yang cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: khams su gdags pa yang med do // gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams la kun tu zhugs pa zhes rnam grangs su brjod pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa yang cung zad kyang med la /
translated: But in renunciation there is no element and there is no designation of an element.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pa yang 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pa yang 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Those who have entered into the element of nirvana are said to be of a certain kind, but nirvana is not even the slightest thing and there is no one who has entered into nirvana.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig gis mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su thob par gyur can ni /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig gis mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su thob par gyur can ni /
translated: If someone were to attain nirvana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad med par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad med par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the Tathagata would not exist after death.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sus kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sus kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But nirvana is not attained by anyone.

original: ngas sems can chos zab mo la spyad pa ma spyad pa rnams kun tu rmongs par gyur na mi rung zhes de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad yod do //
analyzed: ngas sems can chos zab mo la spyad pa ma spyad pa rnams kun tu rmongs par gyur na mi rung zhes de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad yod do //
translated: I do not want beings who have not practiced the profound Dharma to become confused.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nongs pa phan chad med do zhes rnam grangs kyis bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nongs pa phan chad med do zhes rnam grangs kyis bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata is not to be taught by way of the categories of ‘the Tathāgata exists after attaining nirvāṇa’ or ‘the Tathāgata does not exist after attaining nirvāṇa.’

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs can du gyur na yang de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad med par 'gyur la /🔽gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs can ma yin par gyur na yang de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad med par 'gyur bas de ni gnyis kar yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs can du gyur na yang de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad med par 'gyur la / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs can ma yin par gyur na yang de bzhin gshegs pa nongs phan chad med par 'gyur bas de ni gnyis kar yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: If the Tathāgata were to become a form, the Tathāgata would not exist after attaining nirvāṇa.🔽If the Tathāgata were not to become a form, the Tathāgata would not exist after attaining nirvāṇa.

original: med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not existent in both ways, nor is he nonexistent in both ways.

original: @109b chos gang zhig skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa de ni shi phan chad yod pa'am med pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @109b chos gang zhig skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa de ni shi phan chad yod pa'am med pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A phenomenon that does not arise and does not cease is not said to exist or not exist after attaining nirvāṇa.🔽The Tathāgata does not arise

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang skye ba yang med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang skye ba yang med /
translated: and does not cease.

original: 'gag pa yang med pas de yang nongs phan chad yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med pas de yang nongs phan chad yod do zhe'am /
translated: Nor is it that it ceases.🔽

original: med do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no cessation, it is not the case that it existed in the past or that it will exist in the future.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yod do zhes bya ba dang / med do zhes bya ba ni mtha' med pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yod do zhes bya ba dang / med do zhes bya ba ni mtha' med pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Tathāgata has said that existence and nonexistence are extremes.

original: gang la mtha' med pa de la ni dbus kyang med do //🔽gang la dbus med pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang la mtha' med pa de la ni dbus kyang med do // gang la dbus med pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is without an extreme also has no middle.

original: med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That which has no middle is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: gal te yod pa dang med pa yang dag pa yin par gyur can ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang 'ga' bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa dang med pa yang dag pa yin par gyur can ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang 'ga' bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If existence and nonexistence were real, they would not be dependent origination.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la ni 'gag pa yang med pas de la yod pa dang / med pa mi 'gal bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la ni 'gag pa yang med pas de la yod pa dang / med pa mi 'gal bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since dependent origination is without cessation, it is not the case that existence and nonexistence are incompatible.

original: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de la ni mtha' dang dbus cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de la ni mtha' dang dbus cung zad kyang med do //
translated: That which is dependent origination has no middle or extremes whatsoever.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gang yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: that which is neither existent

original: med pa yang ma yin pa de la chos thams cad ces ji ltar tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa de la chos thams cad ces ji ltar tha snyad gdags te /
translated: How can one designate as ‘all phenomena’ that which is neither existent nor nonexistent?

original: yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not existent,🔽and it is not nonexistent.

original: med pa yang ma yin pa de dag ni ji ltar yang tha snyad gdags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa de dag ni ji ltar yang tha snyad gdags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those which are neither existent nor nonexistent cannot be designated in any way.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni thabs mkhas pa chen po la gnas te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni thabs mkhas pa chen po la gnas te /
translated: the Thus-Gone One, abiding in great skillful means,

original: sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i sgo pa'i sbubs pa cag pa'i phyir /🔽chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhes chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang mi 'gal ba brjod par mdzad /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i sgo pa'i sbubs pa cag pa'i phyir / chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhes chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang mi 'gal ba brjod par mdzad /
translated: in order to destroy the eggshell of sentient beings’ ignorance,

original: ston @110a *// par mdzad de /
analyzed: ston @110a *// par mdzad de /
translated: speaks and teaches the Dharma without contradicting the nature of phenomena, saying, ‘All phenomena are dependently arisen.’

original: gang zhig rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i khongs su gtogs par byas pa de la ni mtha' dang dbus su tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i khongs su gtogs par byas pa de la ni mtha' dang dbus su tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is included within dependent origination cannot be designated as having an end or a middle.

original: gang tha snyad gdags su med pa de la ni cung zad kyang thob pa med do //
analyzed: gang tha snyad gdags su med pa de la ni cung zad kyang thob pa med do //
translated: That which cannot be designated does not entail any attainment.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: thabs shes pa la mkhas pa dang / chos rnams kun 'dzin pa'i blo la mkhas pas dbu ma'i lam chos rnams kyi mtha' dang bral bar tha snyad 'dogs kyang chos rnams kun 'dzin par byed pa yang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: thabs shes pa la mkhas pa dang / chos rnams kun 'dzin pa'i blo la mkhas pas dbu ma'i lam chos rnams kyi mtha' dang bral bar tha snyad 'dogs kyang chos rnams kun 'dzin par byed pa yang mi dmigs la /
translated: “They are skilled in means and wisdom, and skilled in the mind that comprehends all phenomena. They designate the middle way, which is free from the extremes of all phenomena, and yet they do not apprehend the comprehension of all phenomena.

original: mi dmigs par 'dogs pa yang med pa la ltos /
analyzed: mi dmigs par 'dogs pa yang med pa la ltos /
translated: See how they designate the absence of apprehension without apprehending anything.

original: 'di la khyed kyis ji ltar 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med par de ltar rtogs par bya /🔽khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la khyed kyis ji ltar 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med par de ltar rtogs par bya / khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: You should understand and comprehend that in this way there is no coming and no going.

original: chos 'di dag la snying por gyur pa'i skal ba chad pa yang 'ga' yang mi ston to /
analyzed: chos 'di dag la snying por gyur pa'i skal ba chad pa yang 'ga' yang mi ston to /
translated: I do not teach that any of these phenomena are devoid of the essence of good fortune.

original: chos rnams la ni skal ba chad pa med do //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni skal ba chad pa med do //
translated: There is no lack of good fortune in phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi skal ba ni ma chad /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi skal ba ni ma chad /
translated: The good fortune of phenomena is not cut off.

original: kun tu ma chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu ma chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not completely cut off.

original: chos thams cad ni skal ba mi mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skal ba mi mnyam pa med pa /
translated: All phenomena are without different good fortunes.

original: gcig pa nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ma yin pa /
translated: They are not the same.

original: tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa /
translated: They are not different.

original: dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin yang chos thams cad ni chos gang gi pha rol tu phyin pa yang med par mya ngan las 'das par gyur pas de'i phyir de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin yang chos thams cad ni chos gang gi pha rol tu phyin pa yang med par mya ngan las 'das par gyur pas de'i phyir de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Although it is the perfection of the sacred, all phenomena are nirvāṇa, without any perfection of any phenomenon. Therefore, they are not to be expressed.

original: dbu ma yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ston par 'gyur ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dbu ma yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ston par 'gyur ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the teaching of the relative in order to reveal the Middle Way,

original: dbu ma'i lam gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam yin te /
translated: the Middle Way is the path that leads to nirvāṇa.

original: @110b mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang du yang 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: @110b mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang du yang 'gro ba med do //
translated: Nirvāṇa does not go anywhere.

original: de la 'gro ba dang 'ong bar 'gyur ba cung zad kyang med pas de'i phyir chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba dang 'ong bar 'gyur ba cung zad kyang med pas de'i phyir chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bstan te /
translated: Since there is not the slightest going or coming there, it is taught that all phenomena are the same as nirvāṇa.

original: chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid rab tu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid rab tu brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the proclamation of the sameness of phenomena.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: dbu ma'i lam 'di ni bsgrub pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam 'di ni bsgrub pa yang ma yin /
translated: this Middle Way is not to be accomplished.

original: mi bsgrub pa yang ma yin pas nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir mtha' dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: mi bsgrub pa yang ma yin pas nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir mtha' dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Since there is neither attainment nor non-attainment, there is no appropriation, and therefore there is freedom from extremes.

original: gang la mtha' med pa la dbus lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gang la mtha' med pa la dbus lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a middle where there are no extremes?

original: mtha' ni gnas med pa yin kyang byis pa so so'i skye ba rnams kyis mtha' gnas med pa nyid du kun tu mi shes te /
analyzed: mtha' ni gnas med pa yin kyang byis pa so so'i skye ba rnams kyis mtha' gnas med pa nyid du kun tu mi shes te /
translated: Although extremes are groundless, ordinary, foolish beings do not understand that extremes are groundless.

original: de'i phyir de dag gnas med pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la kun tu chags pas yongs su ma grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gnas med pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la kun tu chags pas yongs su ma grol ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not liberated from the groundless and unreal, due to their attachment to it.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: thabs la mkhas pa chen po la rnam par nges pa'i blos dbu ma'i lam gnas med cing rten med pa ji ltar ston pa la ltos /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa chen po la rnam par nges pa'i blos dbu ma'i lam gnas med cing rten med pa ji ltar ston pa la ltos /
translated: consider how, with a mind that is certain about great skill in means, you teach the middle way that is groundless and without support.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni chos ston pa de dag la the tshom mi mnga'/🔽bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni chos ston pa de dag la the tshom mi mnga'/ bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
translated: the thus-gone ones are free from doubt and forgetfulness in their teachings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ste /
translated: The blessed buddhas are always in equipoise.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mnga' brnyes pas rtag tu rnam par gzigs pa rtag tu legs par mnyam par bzhag pas kun tu rtog pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mnga' brnyes pas rtag tu rnam par gzigs pa rtag tu legs par mnyam par bzhag pas kun tu rtog pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: Since they have mastered samādhi, they always see, and since they are always in equipoise, they are free from conceptualization.

original: ye shes dpag tu med pa mthong ba la rab tu gnas pa yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi gnas @111a *//
analyzed: ye shes dpag tu med pa mthong ba la rab tu gnas pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi gnas @111a *//
translated: They abide in the vision of immeasurable wisdom.

original: rnam par mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis shin tu yongs su dag pa'i chos ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis shin tu yongs su dag pa'i chos ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The blessed buddhas teach the Dharma with perfect purity, without abiding🔽and without non-abiding.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rab tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i chos ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rab tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i chos ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The blessed buddhas teach the Dharma with perfect purity and peace.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos ston par 'byung ba la ni lus pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos ston par 'byung ba la ni lus pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: The teachings of the blessed buddhas are without exception.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows:

original: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na nor bu rin po che sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba yod pas chu'i tshogs chen po bskams na chu'i phung po de 'phel bar mi 'gyur bas rgya mtsho chen po mi ldud do zhes bya la /
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na nor bu rin po che sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba yod pas chu'i tshogs chen po bskams na chu'i phung po de 'phel bar mi 'gyur bas rgya mtsho chen po mi ldud do zhes bya la /
translated: For example, in the great ocean there is a jewel called “various jewels,” which dries up the great mass of water. Since that mass of water does not increase, the great ocean does not overflow.

original: der 'bab pa'i chu thams cad kyang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: der 'bab pa'i chu thams cad kyang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur bas /
translated: And all the water that flows into it is exhausted.

original: de ni me'i phung po chen po lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni me'i phung po chen po lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like a great mass of fire.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas shes rab kyi snang ba chen po dpag tu med pas sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa bsregs par mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas shes rab kyi snang ba chen po dpag tu med pas sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa bsregs par mdzad /
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, with the immeasurable great light of wisdom burns up and dries up the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: skems par mdzad do //
analyzed: skems par mdzad do //
translated: He dries them up.🔽Vairocana,

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Vairocana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung nyin mtshan du brjod pa de dag thams cad ni rim gyis nyon mongs pa rnams nges par bsreg par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung nyin mtshan du brjod pa de dag thams cad ni rim gyis nyon mongs pa rnams nges par bsreg par 'gyur bas /
translated: All the words of the Tathāgata, spoken day and night, will gradually burn up the afflictions.

original: gsung gi phrin las don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las don yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the activity of his speech is meaningful.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod pa yang sgron ma chen po yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod pa yang sgron ma chen po yin te /
translated: “Homage to the buddhas” is also a great lamp

original: nyon @111b mongs pa rnams nges par bsreg par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon @111b mongs pa rnams nges par bsreg par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: that will burn up the afflictions.

original: gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan thos pa de yang de dag gis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rgyu chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan thos pa de yang de dag gis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rgyu chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who hear the names of the tathāgatas will also make great causes for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di lta bu ni sems can de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyir zhugs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi char 'bebs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni sems can de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyir zhugs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi char 'bebs pa yin no //
translated: this is how the Thus-Gone One sends down a rain of Dharma in order to pacify the afflictions of those beings who are practicing to become tathāgatas.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan brjod pa yang mun pa dang bral bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan brjod pa yang mun pa dang bral bar 'gyur la /
translated: The recitation of the names of the tathāgatas is also free from darkness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan thos pa yang mun pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan thos pa yang mun pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The hearing of the names of the tathāgatas is also free from darkness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin te /
translated: The Dharma taught by the Tathāgata is the truth, just as it is.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: It does not change,

original: phyin ci log kyang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: nor is it mistaken.

original: yang dag pa la ni bshad pa dang / rab tu bshad pa cung zad kyang med de /🔽chos rnams la yang yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa la ni bshad pa dang / rab tu bshad pa cung zad kyang med de / chos rnams la yang yang dag pa'am /
translated: However, in the truth there is not the slightest explanation or elucidation.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest truth or untruth in phenomena.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par gsung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par gsung ba ste /
translated: the Tathāgata speaks the truth.

original: yang dag pa la gnas nas gzungs kyi sgo rim par phye ba ston pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa la gnas nas gzungs kyi sgo rim par phye ba ston pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ston par mdzad do //
translated: Having remained in the truth, he teaches this Dharma discourse that reveals the section of the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gang dag gis 'di kun shes par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'di kun shes par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Who will not understand this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' bden pa mthong ba lta ba phun sum tshogs pa chos zab mo la yongs su sbyang bar byas pa ma gtogs pa rnams kyis kun @112a *//🔽shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bden pa mthong ba lta ba phun sum tshogs pa chos zab mo la yongs su sbyang bar byas pa ma gtogs pa rnams kyis kun @112a *// shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not see the truth of the bodhisattvas, who are not endowed with the view, who have not trained in the profound Dharma.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: don gyi tshul 'di khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: don gyi tshul 'di khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: you should understand this principle:

original: chos 'di la bdag nyid kyi dran pas mngon sum du gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di la bdag nyid kyi dran pas mngon sum du gtad par bya'o //
translated: one should apply one’s own mindfulness to this teaching.

original: gang la yang yang dag pas 'gro bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang yang dag pas 'gro bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go anywhere else for the sake of understanding.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes 'dod par bya zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes 'dod par bya zhing /
translated: Bodhisattvas should seek the wisdom that is not dependent on others.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir chos 'di la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir chos 'di la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bskyed par bya ste /
translated: In order to benefit and bring happiness to all beings, they should develop patient acceptance in accord with this teaching.

original: gang dag de la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de dag ni mi mthun par gnas par mi 'gyur ro; ;bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: gang dag de la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de dag ni mi mthun par gnas par mi 'gyur ro; ;bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa mi mthun par gnas pa ni chos 'dul ba 'di kun shes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang chos kyi tshul 'di ni gang dag lta ba gzhan spyod yul ba lam gzhan la zhugs pa /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa mi mthun par gnas pa ni chos 'dul ba 'di kun shes par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan yang chos kyi tshul 'di ni gang dag lta ba gzhan spyod yul ba lam gzhan la zhugs pa /
translated: immature, ordinary people who are not learned and remain in disagreement will not understand this Dharma and Vinaya.🔽Moreover, this way of Dharma is not within the range of those who engage in other views and other paths,

original: lam log pa dang ldan pa dge ba ma spyad pa spyod yul gzhan bstan pa de dag gi rna lam du grag pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: lam log pa dang ldan pa dge ba ma spyad pa spyod yul gzhan bstan pa de dag gi rna lam du grag pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: those who are on the wrong path and have not practiced virtue, and those who are taught other objects.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: chos kyi gter /
analyzed: chos kyi gter /
translated: when this Dharma treasure,

original: chos kyi snang ba sgrib pa med pa 'di bshad pa na byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams ma rabs kyi sems ma dul ba /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba sgrib pa med pa 'di bshad pa na byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams ma rabs kyi sems ma dul ba /
translated: this unobscured illumination of the Dharma is explained, immature, unlearned people will be excluded from even hearing it.🔽See how those who are vulgar, whose minds are untrained,

original: yang dag par ma bsdams pa rnams ring du spong bar 'gyur ba la ltos /
analyzed: yang dag par ma bsdams pa rnams ring du spong bar 'gyur ba la ltos /
translated: and who are not restrained will be excluded.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo lus rab tu ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo lus rab tu ma bsgoms pa /
translated: “Anantavyūha, these teachings are not for the childish, but for the wise.

original: chos 'dul ba 'di las ring du gyur pa de dag thams cad la chos 'di lta bu la rjes su mthun @112b pa'i bzod pa skye ba yang med na zag pa med pa'i bzod pa thabs dang ldan pa skye bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di las ring du gyur pa de dag thams cad la chos 'di lta bu la rjes su mthun @112b pa'i bzod pa skye ba yang med na zag pa med pa'i bzod pa thabs dang ldan pa skye bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos / bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: They are not for those who have not trained their bodies, but for those who have. They are not for those who are far from this Dharma and Vinaya, but for those who are close.

original: 'khor 'di'i nang du chos bstan pa 'di 'jug pa ni gang du yang chags pa med cing nyams pa med pa dang / don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor 'di'i nang du chos bstan pa 'di 'jug pa ni gang du yang chags pa med cing nyams pa med pa dang / don yod pa yin no //
translated: Anantavyūha, this Dharma teaching is not attached to anything, nor does it diminish anywhere. It is meaningful.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di dag thams cad ni sgrib pa med pa'i sa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni sgrib pa med pa'i sa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because all of these beings are established on the level of the absence of obscurations.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i chos ston pa la mkhas pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i chos ston pa la mkhas pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is skilled in teaching the Dharma free of obscurations, and he does so in order to purify and out of love for all beings.

original: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: Through the roots of virtue of those bodhisattvas and the blessings of the thus-gone ones,

original: gzungs kyi sgo'i mdo 'di ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo'i mdo 'di ston par mdzad do //
translated: this discourse on the dhāraṇī gateway is taught.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gang la la zhig dam pa'i chos bstan pa 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni yang dag par 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la la zhig dam pa'i chos bstan pa 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni yang dag par 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: those who engage with this teaching of the sacred Dharma should be known as those who engage authentically.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas shing ring po mi thogs par len pa med pa'i bzod pa yang thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas shing ring po mi thogs par len pa med pa'i bzod pa yang thob par 'gyur /
translated: They will abide on the bodhisattva levels and before long will attain acceptance that is free of grasping.

original: ring po mi thogs par lung bstan pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: ring po mi thogs par lung bstan pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Before long they will also receive prophecies.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos zab mo 'dul ba 'di la mos par gyis shig /
analyzed: chos zab mo 'dul ba 'di la mos par gyis shig /
translated: you should be inspired by this profound Dharma discourse on the vinaya.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di ni lta ba mi dmigs pa rnams kyis yin pas dmigs su med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba mi dmigs pa rnams kyis yin pas dmigs su med pa'i sa'o //
translated: this is the level of those who do not observe views, so it is the level of nonobservation.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis yin no //
translated: This is for those who possess the acceptance of nonobservation.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa /
translated: This is for those who have served the victorious ones of the past.

original: yun ring po nas @113a *//
analyzed: yun ring po nas @113a *//
translated: For a long time,🔽

original: sems rab tu sbyangs pa /
analyzed: sems rab tu sbyangs pa /
translated: “They are the domain of those who have trained their minds for a long time,

original: lus legs par bsdams pa /
analyzed: lus legs par bsdams pa /
translated: who have well-restrained bodies,

original: ngag legs par bsrungs pa /
analyzed: ngag legs par bsrungs pa /
translated: who have well-guarded speech,

original: yid legs par dul ba /
analyzed: yid legs par dul ba /
translated: who have well-tamed minds,

original: rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dran pa /
translated: who recollect the equality of consciousness,

original: sems mi dmigs pa la gnas pa rnams kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: sems mi dmigs pa la gnas pa rnams kyi yul yin te /
translated: and who abide in the non-apprehension of mind.

original: de dag ni chos 'di lta bu blang ba'i phyir lus dang srog kyang yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: de dag ni chos 'di lta bu blang ba'i phyir lus dang srog kyang yongs su btang nas /
translated: For the sake of receiving such a Dharma teaching, they will give up their bodies and lives

original: mdo sde 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will engage with this sūtra.

original: de la phyi ma'i dus na sems can gang dag tha na chos 'di lta bu mnyan pa'i phyir brtson par 'gyur ba de dag kyang dkon na yi ger 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / 'chang ba dang / kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgyas par ston par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de la phyi ma'i dus na sems can gang dag tha na chos 'di lta bu mnyan pa'i phyir brtson par 'gyur ba de dag kyang dkon na yi ger 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / 'chang ba dang / kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgyas par ston par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: “In the future, those beings who strive to listen to such a Dharma teaching will be rare. What need is there to mention those who will write it down, read it, possess it, recite it, and teach it extensively to others?

original: gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'phel bar byed cing /
analyzed: gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'phel bar byed cing /
translated: Those who spread this Dharma teaching

original: gzhan la ston par byed pa de dag ring po mi thogs par gzungs kyi sgo'i chos 'di rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan la ston par byed pa de dag ring po mi thogs par gzungs kyi sgo'i chos 'di rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those who teach this Dharma will not be delayed in purifying the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: myur du rnam par dag pa'i ye shes thob nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du rnam par dag pa'i ye shes thob nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly attain pure wisdom and follow the path of omniscient wisdom.”

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi gter 'di yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi gter 'di yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: the Thus-Gone One teaches this Dharma treasure so that beings may attain omniscient wisdom.

original: 'di las gang mi ston pa de cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di las gang mi ston pa de cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is nothing that is not taught in this.

original: nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir chos ston cing rnam par dag pa bskyed par yang mdzad /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir chos ston cing rnam par dag pa bskyed par yang mdzad /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to eliminate afflictions and to give rise to purity.

original: chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa rab @113b tu ston par yang mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa rab @113b tu ston par yang mdzad do //
translated: He also teaches the pure gateway of Dharma.

original: chos thams cad ni nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bya ba ji ltar chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bya ba ji ltar chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: All phenomena are like space.’ How are all phenomena like space?”🔽“Anantavyūha,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: It is equal to space.

original: nam mkha' gang dang yang mnyam pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' gang dang yang mnyam pa yang ma yin /
translated: Space is not equal to anything,

original: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it unequal to anything.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mnyam pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mnyam pa yang ma yin /
translated: Just as space is not equal to anything,

original: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mnyam pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mnyam pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor is it unequal to anything, so all phenomena are not equal to anything,

original: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they unequal to anything.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gang du yang ma gtogs pa de bzhin du chos thams cad gang du yang ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gang du yang ma gtogs pa de bzhin du chos thams cad gang du yang ma gtogs so //
translated: Just as space is not included in anything, so all phenomena are not included in anything.

original: chos rnams la ni mtha' mi dmigs te /🔽mtha' dmigs su med pa la mtha' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni mtha' mi dmigs te / mtha' dmigs su med pa la mtha' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The extremes of phenomena are not observed.🔽Where the extremes are not observed, there are no extremes.

original: mtha' yod pa ma yin pa la mthar gdags pa yang med do //
analyzed: mtha' yod pa ma yin pa la mthar gdags pa yang med do //
translated: Where there are no extremes, there is no designation of extremes.

original: gang dag 'di lta bu la gnas pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'di lta bu la gnas pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul la gnas pa ste /
translated: Those who abide in this way abide in the way of the Thus-Gone One.

original: de dag ni brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: They are inexpressible.

original: gang dag brjod du med pa de dag ni gdags pa mnyam pa nyid du gtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag brjod du med pa de dag ni gdags pa mnyam pa nyid du gtogs par bya'o //
translated: Those who are inexpressible should be included in the equality of designation.

original: de'i phyir de dag kun tu mi spyod cing mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kun tu mi spyod cing mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they do not engage in them and do not follow extremes.

original: mtha' la mi rten pa rnams ni dbu ma dang yang phrad par 'gyur /
analyzed: mtha' la mi rten pa rnams ni dbu ma dang yang phrad par 'gyur /
translated: Those who do not rely on extremes will encounter the middle way.

original: mtha' dang dbus kyi phung po thams cad kyang so sor spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus kyi phung po thams cad kyang so sor spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will abandon all the aggregates of extremes and middle.

original: de so sor spong ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar gdags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de so sor spong ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar gdags pa med pa ste /
translated: ‘ Abandoning’ means not designating going.

original: 'di lta bu ni ye shes rnam par dag pa thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni ye shes rnam par dag pa thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is how to attain pure wisdom.

original: gang zhig chos spyod par mi byed pa de ni so sor 'brang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig chos spyod par mi byed pa de ni so sor 'brang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who do not practice the Dharma will not follow it.

original: chos @114a *// thams cad ni nye bar 'gro ba med cing 'jig pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos @114a *// thams cad ni nye bar 'gro ba med cing 'jig pa med pa yin no //
translated: All phenomena are without coming and going.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir bdag med cing bdag mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir bdag med cing bdag mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is because all phenomena are selfless and not observed, since they have no inherent nature of their own.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag par ston pa de bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba'i don ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag par ston pa de bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba'i don ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the meaning of transformation in the same way that he teaches that all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi don ston pa de bzhin du ldog pa'i don dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi don ston pa de bzhin du ldog pa'i don dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the meaning of cessation and the meaning of freedom from attachment in the same way that he teaches the meaning of suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes ston pa de bzhin du phung po thams cad nges par spong ba'i don ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes ston pa de bzhin du phung po thams cad nges par spong ba'i don ston par mdzad de /
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the meaning of the definite relinquishment of all the aggregates in the same way that he teaches that nirvāṇa is peace.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo nas chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa ston to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo nas chos kyi sgo yongs su dag pa ston to //
translated: He teaches the pure gateway to the Dharma through impermanence, suffering, no-self, and nirvāṇa.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: this teaching of the thus-gone ones expresses the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag rnam grangs du ma dang / sgo du ma dang / bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa du mas bstan te /🔽tha snyad du brjod kyang de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams tha dad pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag rnam grangs du ma dang / sgo du ma dang / bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa du mas bstan te / tha snyad du brjod kyang de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams tha dad pa nyid dam /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has taught these phenomena in many ways, through many approaches, and by accomplishing many teachings.

original: gcig pa nyid du 'dogs par ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'dogs par ni mi mdzad do //
translated: Although he has expressed them conventionally, the Thus-Gone One does not label phenomena as being either separate or not separate.

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa ste /🔽gcig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa ste / gcig pa yang ma yin /
translated: All phenomena are nondual.

original: tha dad pa @114b yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa @114b yang ma yin gyi /
translated: They are neither one nor separate.

original: bstan du med pa'i khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan du med pa'i khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
translated: They are included within the realm of the unobservable.

original: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul can yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul can yin no //
translated: All phenomena are characterized by the absence of characteristics, and they are of the nature of space.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs kyi sgo'i ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dul bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo'i ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dul bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: this purity of the dhāraṇī gateway is the nature of the bodhisattvas’ training.

original: ci zhig 'dul bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'dul bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is it that is trained?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang 'dul bar 'gyur ro; ;ma rig pa 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang 'dul bar 'gyur ro; ;ma rig pa 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will tame desire and anger. They will tame ignorance.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gdul bar bya ba ni yod pa ma yin zhing shin tu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gdul bar bya ba ni yod pa ma yin zhing shin tu mi dmigs so //
translated: In this way, desire, anger, and ignorance are not to be tamed, because they are not observed.

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kyang ma yin te /
translated: That which is not observed is neither desire, nor anger, nor ignorance.

original: tshul bzhin du btsal na rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du btsal na rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one searches properly, one will not find them.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni yod pa ma yin pas gsob bslu ba'i chos can byis pa 'drid pa bslu ba nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni yod pa ma yin pas gsob bslu ba'i chos can byis pa 'drid pa bslu ba nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Desire, anger, and ignorance are not real, and so they are deceptive phenomena that deceive and mislead the childish.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag gang las skye ba'i gzhi med cing mi rnyed pas de nyid du 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag gang las skye ba'i gzhi med cing mi rnyed pas de nyid du 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, desire, anger, and ignorance are not a basis from which anything arises, and so they are not found. They are thus separated from themselves.

original: de dag 'bral ba yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'bral ba yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should also look at how they are separated.

original: ji ltar lta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should you look at them?

original: 'di ltar ma skyes pa de ltar blta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa de ltar blta ste /
translated: You should look at them as unborn.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir gang las skyes pa dang / gang gis skyes pa de thams cad gsob ste /🔽bslu ba'i chos can yin no //🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug @115a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir gang las skyes pa dang / gang gis skyes pa de thams cad gsob ste / bslu ba'i chos can yin no // 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug @115a *//
translated: because they arise from what is unreal and are themselves unreal.

original: rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Desire, hatred, and ignorance do not exist inherently.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i mun pas mi shes pa dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa ni de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i mun pas mi shes pa dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa ni de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Ignorance, which is the lack of understanding and the lack of realization due to the darkness of ignorance, is their antecedent.

original: gang dag gis de ltar mthong ba de dag la ni sgo yongs su dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag gis de ltar mthong ba de dag la ni sgo yongs su dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Those who see in this way will give rise to the inconceivable purity of the sense-spheres.

original: gzungs kyang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzungs kyang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They will also attain the dhāraṇīs.

original: rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi las yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi las yin /
translated: The function of wisdom is to understand the equality of consciousness.

original: 'di ni gzungs thob pa'i las yin /
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs thob pa'i las yin /
translated: The function of attaining the dhāraṇīs is as follows.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs sbyong bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs sbyong bar byed pa /
translated: This is the training in the accumulation of the branches of awakening.

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa'i sa yin /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa'i sa yin /
translated: This is the ground of aspiration, diligence, and conscientiousness.

original: 'di ni bag med pa 'dul ba'i sa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni bag med pa 'dul ba'i sa yin /
translated: This is the ground of taming carelessness.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga nyams pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga nyams pa med pa yin no //
translated: This is the ground of the purity of discipline, view, and conduct.

original: 'di ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa yin /
translated: This is the ground of the purity of physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: 'di ni bdag med pa'i ye shes mtshan nyid med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag med pa'i ye shes mtshan nyid med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin /
translated: This is the ground of the wisdom of selflessness that is in accord with the absence of characteristics.

original: 'di ni 'du shes spangs pa dang ma bral ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes spangs pa dang ma bral ba yin /
translated: This is the ground of the absence of the abandonment of perception.

original: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa mtha' yas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa mtha' yas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This is the ground of the accomplishment of infinite skillful means.

original: gang dag chos 'di lta bu la tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog cing sbyong bar byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag chos 'di lta bu la tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog cing sbyong bar byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who properly contemplate and train in this teaching

original: chos 'di la bsgrub pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di la bsgrub pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain liberation through accomplishing this teaching.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang brjod la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang brjod la /
translated: I have also described the characteristics of the nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag kyang ston cing rab tu ston par byed /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag kyang ston cing rab tu ston par byed /
translated: They teach and explain these Dharma discourses.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam @115b pa nyid du ston kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam @115b pa nyid du ston kyang /
translated: They teach that all phenomena are the same as space,

original: ston pa por 'dogs pa yang med la /
analyzed: ston pa por 'dogs pa yang med la /
translated: but they are not fixated on the one who teaches.

original: gang bstan pa de yang mi mngon pa la ltos /
analyzed: gang bstan pa de yang mi mngon pa la ltos /
translated: Look how the teachings are not apparent.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: bstan pa'i sgo la 'jug pa'i tshig 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni blo rgya mtsho lta bu'i stobs kyis ring du 'gro bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: bstan pa'i sgo la 'jug pa'i tshig 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni blo rgya mtsho lta bu'i stobs kyis ring du 'gro bar yang 'gyur /
translated: the bodhisattvas who train in these words that introduce the gateway to the teachings will go far with the oceanic strength of their minds.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi tshugs par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi tshugs par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be unassailable by any opponents.

original: ye shes kyi rnam pa rjes su 'thob par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam pa rjes su 'thob par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will attain the aspects of wisdom.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes ston pa la mkhas pa yang rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes ston pa la mkhas pa yang rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: They will realize the skill in teaching the wisdom that does not depend on others.

original: don mnyam pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas pa yang rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: don mnyam pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas pa yang rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will realize the inconceivable skill in the perfect equality of meaning.

original: don la mkhas pa des ming med cing mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams ston pa rjod par yang byed la /
analyzed: don la mkhas pa des ming med cing mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams ston pa rjod par yang byed la /
translated: The one who is skilled in meaning teaches the Dharma that is without name and without sign.

original: de ston par byed pa yang med do //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa yang med do //
translated: And yet, there is no one who teaches it.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba dang / rang 'byung zhes bya ba dang ston pa pa yang nye bar gnas shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba dang / rang 'byung zhes bya ba dang ston pa pa yang nye bar gnas shing /
translated: The one who is skilled in meaning is called a buddha, is called omniscient, is called self-arisen, and is called a teacher.

original: ming dang / mtshan ma rnam par dag pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang / mtshan ma rnam par dag pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is also one who attains the purification of name and sign.

original: myur du dbyangs kyi rnam pa mang po thob par 'gyur te; yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa'i dbyangs dang / dbyangs rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du dbyangs kyi rnam pa mang po thob par 'gyur te; yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa'i dbyangs dang / dbyangs rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will quickly attain the many aspects of melody, and will attain the melodious sound that is pleasing, the melodious sound that is delightful, and the perfect, pure melodious sound.

original: tshig btsun par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig btsun par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will have trustworthy speech.

original: mngon du 'gro bar bya ba dang / yongs su dri bar bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon du 'gro bar bya ba dang / yongs su dri bar bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be one who is approached and questioned.

original: sems can rnams kyi shes rab rnam par nges pa la mkhas pa bsgrub pa yang shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi shes rab rnam par nges pa la mkhas pa bsgrub pa yang shes par 'gyur /
translated: They will know how to accomplish the skill in discerning the wisdom of sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa smra ba dang / rigs @116a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa smra ba dang / rigs @116a *//
translated: They will be those who speak with desire,

original: pa smra ba dang / phan par smra bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: pa smra ba dang / phan par smra bar yang 'gyur /
translated: who speak with logic, and who speak with benefit.

original: phan pa'i tshig dang / legs par smra ba'i tshig dang / don gtan la 'bebs pa'i tshig can du yang 'gyur /
analyzed: phan pa'i tshig dang / legs par smra ba'i tshig dang / don gtan la 'bebs pa'i tshig can du yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be those who speak with beneficial words, who speak with good words, and who speak with words that ascertain the meaning.

original: don gcig bstan pas don mang po rnam par gtan la 'bebs par yang kun shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gcig bstan pas don mang po rnam par gtan la 'bebs par yang kun shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will know how to ascertain many meanings by teaching a single meaning.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'di la spyod pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gyi tshogs ji snyed cig dang ldan pa la ltos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'di la spyod pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gyi tshogs ji snyed cig dang ldan pa la ltos /
translated: consider the qualities that bodhisattvas who practice this teaching will possess when they fully awaken to perfect buddhahood.

original: de ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs pa la gnas pa 'phrogs par mi 'gyur zhing chags par 'gyur ba dang / ldang bar 'gyur ba dang / rmongs par 'gyur pa'i chos de dag gis kyang 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs pa la gnas pa 'phrogs par mi 'gyur zhing chags par 'gyur ba dang / ldang bar 'gyur ba dang / rmongs par 'gyur pa'i chos de dag gis kyang 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be carried away by attachment and aversion, and he will not be carried away by the things that cause attachment and aversion, such as the things that cause attachment and anger.

original: yongs su sbyang ba byas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba byas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be purified.

original: thabs dang shes rab la mkhas pa dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa la mkhas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab la mkhas pa dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa la mkhas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be skilled in means and wisdom, and he will be skilled in the knowledge of the divisions of words.

original: thams cad du legs par bslabs pa'i bzod pa phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du legs par bslabs pa'i bzod pa phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be endowed with the perfection of patience that is well-trained in all ways.

original: chos tshad med pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: chos tshad med pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: He will be endowed with immeasurable Dharma.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be endowed with a perfect intention.

original: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa la gnas shing /🔽'jug pa phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa la gnas shing / 'jug pa phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be endowed with the perfection of patience.🔽He will be endowed with the perfection of engagement.

original: gsong por smra ba rnam par dag par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsong por smra ba rnam par dag par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be endowed with pure speech.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @116b chos 'di la mngon par mi brtson zhing mi shes pa la rab tu mi sbyor ba de dag la ni yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @116b chos 'di la mngon par mi brtson zhing mi shes pa la rab tu mi sbyor ba de dag la ni yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag cung zad kyang med do //
translated: those bodhisattvas who do not apply themselves to this teaching and who do not understand it will not have any of these qualities.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: sems can gang dag chos 'di la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ba de dag ni nyung /
analyzed: sems can gang dag chos 'di la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ba de dag ni nyung /
translated: those beings who apply themselves to this teaching are few,

original: shin tu nyung ngo //
analyzed: shin tu nyung ngo //
translated: very few indeed.

original: sems can gang dag phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'dod cing smon lam ji lta ba dang / 'dug pa ji lta ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yang dkon /
analyzed: sems can gang dag phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'dod cing smon lam ji lta ba dang / 'dug pa ji lta ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yang dkon /
translated: Those beings who wish to attain all that is excellent and who fulfill their aspirations, as well as their conduct, thoughts, and intentions, are rare,

original: rab tu dkon no //
analyzed: rab tu dkon no //
translated: extremely rare.

original: gang dag chos 'di la bzod pa spyod pa rnam par rtog cing chos 'di las nges par 'byung ba de dag ni mngon par shes pa zad mi shes pa dang / ye shes chen po dang / 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: gang dag chos 'di la bzod pa spyod pa rnam par rtog cing chos 'di las nges par 'byung ba de dag ni mngon par shes pa zad mi shes pa dang / ye shes chen po dang / 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i ye shes dang /
