translated: great wisdom, wisdom that is exalted above all worlds,

original: rang 'byung gi ye shes dang / ye shes tshad med cing mtha' yas pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang 'byung gi ye shes dang / ye shes tshad med cing mtha' yas pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: self-arisen wisdom, and immeasurable and limitless wisdom.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de la gzungs kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i chos rim par phye ba bstan pa'i sgor 'jug pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bslab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzungs kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i chos rim par phye ba bstan pa'i sgor 'jug pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bslab par bya ba ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas should train in this gateway to the teaching of the section of the Dharma called the seal of dhāraṇī.

original: 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi snying po la yang nye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi snying po la yang nye bar 'gyur /
translated: Bodhisattvas who train in this will approach the seat of awakening,

original: sems can rnams la yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas nye bar gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas nye bar gnas par 'gyur /
translated: and they will remain in buddha activity for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po mngon par bsgrub pas nye bar gnas par yang 'gyur /🔽sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon par bsgrub @117a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po mngon par bsgrub pas nye bar gnas par yang 'gyur / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon par bsgrub @117a *//
translated: They will also be present in order to accomplish great love for all sentient beings.

original: par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also accomplish great compassion for sentient beings.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: gzungs kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i chos rim par phye ba bstan pa'i sgor 'jug pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzungs kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i chos rim par phye ba bstan pa'i sgor 'jug pa de gang zhe na /
translated: what is the gateway to entering the teaching of the section of the Dharma called the dhāraṇī gateway?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas; 'di la chos thams cad yi ger mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba gang du chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas; 'di la chos thams cad yi ger mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba gang du chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba yin no //
translated: Anantavyūha, this is the seal of the manifestation of all phenomena in letters, in which all phenomena are subsumed.

original: ji ltar yang dag par 'du zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par 'du zhe na /
translated: How are they subsumed?

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du'o //
translated: All these phenomena are subsumed in sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis ni mnyam pa nyid yang dag par mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis ni mnyam pa nyid yang dag par mi mthong ngo //
translated: Sameness does not see sameness.

original: rab tu mi shes nye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab tu mi shes nye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not known or observed.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin rnam par mi rtog na 'dir chos thams cad yang dag par 'du bar gyur pas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang bral ba'i sgo nas yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin rnam par mi rtog na 'dir chos thams cad yang dag par 'du bar gyur pas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang bral ba'i sgo nas yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If all phenomena are non-conceptual in terms of their intrinsic reality, then all phenomena are subsumed here. Thus, they are subsumed in terms of being free from the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa dang / ngag gi las su brjod pa gang dag gis 'dus byas ston par 'gyur ba de dag la yang yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa gang yin pa dang / ngag gi las su yongs su brjod pa gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga yang chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid yin pas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa dang / ngag gi las su brjod pa gang dag gis 'dus byas ston par 'gyur ba de dag la yang yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa gang yin pa dang / ngag gi las su yongs su brjod pa gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga yang chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid yin pas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The teaching on the accomplishment of letters and the verbal expressions that teach the conditioned are both not real, because they are naturally the same in terms of the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la ni brjod pa de yang yang dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la ni brjod pa de yang yang dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: That which is not real is not real even in terms of verbal expression.

original: yi ger gdags pa yang yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ger gdags pa yang yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The designation of letters is also not real.

original: ngag gi las su brjod pa yang yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba @117b 'di ni dbyer med pa'i tshig bla dvags yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi las su brjod pa yang yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba @117b 'di ni dbyer med pa'i tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: “The words ‘not real’ are a synonym for indivisibility.

original: lhag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags yin no //🔽chos kyi tshul 'di ni bstan du med pa yin la chos thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin /
analyzed: lhag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags yin no // chos kyi tshul 'di ni bstan du med pa yin la chos thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin /
translated: “The words ‘not in excess’ are a synonym for non-superimposition.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: “This Dharma way is not demonstrable, and all phenomena are neither real nor unreal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni nye bar zhi ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni nye bar zhi ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Because all phenomena are by nature at peace.

original: yi ges bstan pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa dang / mthong ba dang / dmigs pa'i chos de ngag ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: yi ges bstan pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa dang / mthong ba dang / dmigs pa'i chos de ngag ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: “The phenomena that are taught with words, expressed in speech, seen, and apprehended are without inherent nature.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad na ma byas pa /🔽mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad na ma byas pa / mnyam pa med pa /
translated: Because all phenomena are unmade,🔽unequal,🔽uneven,

original: mi mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa med pa /
translated: not at peace,

original: ma zhi ba /🔽nye bar ma zhi ba; rab tu ma zhi pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhi ba /🔽nye bar ma zhi ba; rab tu ma zhi pa'o //
translated: not at rest,🔽and not completely at peace.

original: chos rnams ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du nye bar mi gnas /
analyzed: chos rnams ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du nye bar mi gnas /
translated: Phenomena are characterized by peace,

original: rab tu mi gnas so //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas so //
translated: by complete peace, and by complete pacification, but they do not abide in that way, nor do they abide in the absence of such characteristics.

original: chos thams cad ni 'gyur pa med pa yin pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'gyur pa med pa yin pas /
translated: All phenomena are unchanging,

original: de dag gang du yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gang du yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore they cannot be established as anything.

original: chos rnams ni rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir gang du yang bgrang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: chos rnams ni rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir gang du yang bgrang ba ma yin na /
translated: Since phenomena do not abide in any way, they cannot be counted.

original: chos su bgrang bar sten pa'i brjod pa gang gis bgrang bar 'gyur /🔽ngag gi las yi ger gdags pa thams cad ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: chos su bgrang bar sten pa'i brjod pa gang gis bgrang bar 'gyur / ngag gi las yi ger gdags pa thams cad ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: What is the expression that is used to count phenomena?

original: phyogs na mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas pa ste /
translated: All verbal actions and designations of syllables do not abide in any place or direction.

original: yi ge dang ngag gi las ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro la /
analyzed: yi ge dang ngag gi las ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro la /
translated: Syllables and verbal actions do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: chos gang gi mthar gtogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos gang gi mthar gtogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: They do not belong to the end of any phenomenon,

original: dbus su gtogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dbus su gtogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor do they belong to its middle.

original: yi ge'i las thams cad ni las med pa /
analyzed: yi ge'i las thams cad ni las med pa /
translated: All verbal actions are devoid of action,

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: devoid of syllables,

original: rtsol ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa'o //
translated: and devoid of effort.

original: ngag @118a *// gi las thams cad kyang yi ge med pa /
analyzed: ngag @118a *// gi las thams cad kyang yi ge med pa /
translated: All verbal actions are without syllables,

original: las med pa /
analyzed: las med pa /
translated: without activity,

original: rtsol ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa'o //
translated: and without effort.

original: yi ge thams cad ni yi ge'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin la /
analyzed: yi ge thams cad ni yi ge'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin la /
translated: All syllables are empty of the intrinsic nature of syllables,

original: ngag gi las kyang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi las kyang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: and verbal actions are empty of the intrinsic nature of verbal actions.

original: bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin no //
translated: They are empty of the intrinsic nature of self, the intrinsic nature of other, and the intrinsic nature of both self and other.

original: gang stong pa de ni dben pa yin no //
analyzed: gang stong pa de ni dben pa yin no //
translated: That which is empty is void.

original: gang dben pa de ni nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: gang dben pa de ni nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: That which is void is completely pacified.

original: chos thams cad ni nye bar zhi ba'i sgo can yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nye bar zhi ba'i sgo can yin no //
translated: All phenomena have the door of complete pacification.

original: sgo gang dang gang gis chos kyi ming ston pa dang / yi ge ston pa dang / tshig gi las ston par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni sgo med pa ste /
analyzed: sgo gang dang gang gis chos kyi ming ston pa dang / yi ge ston pa dang / tshig gi las ston par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni sgo med pa ste /
translated: All the doors through which the names of phenomena, syllables, and verbal actions are taught are without doors,

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgo rnam par sbyong ba yin no /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgo rnam par sbyong ba yin no /
translated: because they do not exist. Therefore, they are purified of doors.

original: sgo gang dang gang gis chos brjod par 'gyur ba'i sgo de dang der shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgo gang dang gang gis chos brjod par 'gyur ba'i sgo de dang der shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever the gateway through which the Dharma is expressed, that gateway is perfectly included within utter purity.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba 'di gang gi tshig bla dvags yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba 'di gang gi tshig bla dvags yin zhe na /
translated: “In what sense is it said that all phenomena are free from desire?”

original: 'dod chags ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Desire is not inherently existent.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: That which is inherent is utterly pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de la ni 'dod chags kyang med /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de la ni 'dod chags kyang med /
translated: That which is utterly pure is free from desire.

original: 'dod chags su gdags pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'dod chags su gdags pa yang med de /
translated: There is no imputation of desire.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni g-yo ba med pa /
translated: All these phenomena are without movement,

original: rlom pa med pa /
analyzed: rlom pa med pa /
translated: without conceit,

original: spros pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: spros pa med pa yin no //
translated: and without conceptual elaboration.

original: 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo rnam par dag pa'i phyag rgya snyon pa'i chos rim @118b par phye ba'i sgor 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo rnam par dag pa'i phyag rgya snyon pa'i chos rim @118b par phye ba'i sgor 'jug pa yin te /
translated: This is the gateway to the dhāraṇī gateway, the entrance to the dhāraṇī gateway, the gateway to the dhāraṇī gateway that is the seal of the purity of the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: sgor 'jug pa des byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i mun pa rab rib bas la nas rig pa dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rigs rjes su dran par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sgor 'jug pa des byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i mun pa rab rib bas la nas rig pa dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rigs rjes su dran par 'gyur ro /
translated: By entering this door, bodhisattvas will remember the family of the Dharma that is in harmony with awareness, having been freed from the darkness of ignorance.

original: ji ltar rjes su dran zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dran zhe na /
translated: How do they remember it?

original: chos thams cad la snang ba rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la snang ba rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: They have pure vision with regard to all phenomena.

original: des ni chos kyi mig gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ni chos kyi mig gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa yang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: They will attain the eye of Dharma and the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: chos kyi sgo rim par phye ba yi ge rnam bar bsgrub pa yang rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo rim par phye ba yi ge rnam bar bsgrub pa yang rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: They will realize the gateway of Dharma that is the accomplishment of the letters.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgo shin tu rnam par dag pa yang kun 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgo shin tu rnam par dag pa yang kun 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: They will uphold the extremely pure gateway of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang yang nye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang yang nye bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be close to the thus-gone ones.

original: mu stegs kyi gnas thams cad kyang chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi gnas thams cad kyang chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod nus par 'gyur /
translated: They will be able to defeat all the non-Buddhists through the Dharma.

original: bdud kyi phyogs kyang pham par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs kyang pham par byed par 'gyur /
translated: They will defeat the forces of Māra.

original: sems can rnams la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur /
translated: They will also be present in order to purify the roots of virtue of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos thams cad mtshams sbyor ba la yang 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos thams cad mtshams sbyor ba la yang 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: They will also engage with the connection of all the Dharma of the thus-gone ones.

original: gzungs kyi sgo 'di lta bu yang thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo 'di lta bu yang thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will also attain dhāraṇī gateways such as this.

original: gzungs kyi sgo des de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la chos kyi snang ba chen po thob nas myur du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs 'grub par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo des de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la chos kyi snang ba chen po thob nas myur du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs 'grub par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Through those dhāraṇī gateways, they will attain the great illumination of Dharma with regard to the ten powers of the thus-gone ones and will swiftly accomplish the powers of the thus-gone ones.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bskyed pa thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bskyed pa thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po /
translated: those who have attained the thus-gone ones’ power will have the ten powers of the thus-gone ones.

original: stobs chen po 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i stobs @119a *//
analyzed: stobs chen po 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i stobs @119a *//
translated: They will have great power that is superior to the entire world.

original: kyis 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrog cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gzungs kyi sgo rnam par dag pa rnam par dbye ba yang ston par mdzad /
analyzed: kyis 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrog cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gzungs kyi sgo rnam par dag pa rnam par dbye ba yang ston par mdzad /
translated: in the midst of the assembly, he roars the lion’s roar and teaches the bodhisattvas the analysis of the pure dhāraṇī gateway.

original: rab tu ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rab tu ston pa mdzad do //
translated: He teaches it well.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po //
translated: What are the ten powers of the tathāgatas?

original: stobs chen po stobs chags pa med cing tshad med pa gang dag gis ston ce na /
analyzed: stobs chen po stobs chags pa med cing tshad med pa gang dag gis ston ce na /
translated: What are the great powers, the unimpeded and limitless powers, by which he teaches?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa bla na med pas gnas dang gnas ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa bla na med pas gnas dang gnas ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata, through the unsurpassed power of the wisdom of omniscience, knows perfectly and as it is what is possible and what is not.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang po yin te /
translated: This is the first power of the tathāgatas.

original: stobs des de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che zhing sems can rnams la chos kyang ston /
analyzed: stobs des de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che zhing sems can rnams la chos kyang ston /
translated: Through this power, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, claims the bull’s place, the place of the leader, and teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na 'di las phyi rol tu gyur pa'i lha'am mi sus kyang sngon ma bskor ba yang bskor bar mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na 'di las phyi rol tu gyur pa'i lha'am mi sus kyang sngon ma bskor ba yang bskor bar mdzad do //
translated: He also turns the unexcelled wheel of Dharma, which no god or human in the world, including the realms of gods, can turn.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog la ma chags ma thogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog la ma chags ma thogs pas /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata, with his nonconceptual, unimpeded gnosis of omniscience,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba du ma spyad pa dang / las yang dag par len pa'i rgyu yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba du ma spyad pa dang / las yang dag par len pa'i rgyu yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: knows exactly the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that have been performed and the causes for taking up such actions in the past, present, and future.

original: 'di ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams @119b cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa ma chags mo thogs pas sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa rnam pa du ma ma lus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams @119b cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa ma chags mo thogs pas sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa rnam pa du ma ma lus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata, with his nonconceptual, unimpeded gnosis of omniscience, knows exactly the various conducts of all sentient beings without exception.

original: 'di ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs bla na med pas sems can thams cad kyi mos pa sna tshogs dang / mos pa du ma dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spyad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs bla na med pas sems can thams cad kyi mos pa sna tshogs dang / mos pa du ma dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spyad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One, with the unsurpassed power of the vision of omniscient wisdom, knows exactly the various interests, the many interests, the thoughts, and the conduct of all beings.

original: 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten gnas pa 'di'i khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs dang / skye mched du ma dang / skye mched sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten gnas pa 'di'i khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs dang / skye mched du ma dang / skye mched sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One knows exactly the various elements and the many elements, the various sense sources and the many sense sources of this world.

original: 'di ni lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lnga pa yin no //
translated: This is the fifth power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen shes pa mthong bar 'grol ba lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen shes pa mthong bar 'grol ba lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One knows exactly the path that leads to liberation through the vision of the knowledge of causes and conditions.

original: 'di ni drug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the sixth power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs gshegs pa ni lha'i spyan gyis sgrab pa med pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs shing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa bla na med pas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs gshegs pa ni lha'i spyan gyis sgrab pa med pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs shing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa bla na med pas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du
translated: Furthermore, the Thus-Gone One, with the divine eye that is free from conceptual elaborations, sees with the wisdom of omniscience and, through the unsurpassed power of wisdom,

original: rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: he knows exactly the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni bdun pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug @120a *//
analyzed: 'di ni bdun pa yin no // gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug @120a *//
translated: This is the seventh power.🔽Furthermore, the Thus-Gone One knows exactly the afflictions and purification of meditative concentration, liberation, absorption,

original: pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: and attainment.

original: 'di ni brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa yin no //
translated: This is the eighth power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Furthermore, the Thus-Gone One knows exactly the recollection of past lives.

original: 'di ni dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dgu pa yin no //
translated: This is the ninth power.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa mngon du bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa mngon du bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata has direct knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants, just as it is.

original: 'di ni bcu pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu pa yin no //
translated: This is the tenth.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs tshad med cing bla na med pa 'di dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs tshad med cing bla na med pa 'di dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata possesses these immeasurable and unsurpassed powers of omniscience.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: chos kyi gter 'di ni sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bskyed pa dang / chos shes pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi gter 'di ni sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bskyed pa dang / chos shes pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: this Dharma treasure is revealed to bodhisattvas so that all beings may develop the wisdom of the buddhas and purify their knowledge of phenomena.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa ji tsam du zab pa dang / ji tsam du rtogs par dka' ba la ltos /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa ji tsam du zab pa dang / ji tsam du rtogs par dka' ba la ltos /
translated: consider how profound the Tathāgata’s wisdom is and how difficult it is to realize.”

original: chos gang de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs ston par byed pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs rnam par sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: chos gang de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs ston par byed pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs rnam par sbyong ba ste /
translated: Any Dharma that is called a thus-gone one and that reveals the powers of the thus-gone ones is the purification of the power of omniscient wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ni dmigs su med cing gdags su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ni dmigs su med cing gdags su med do //
translated: The Dharma of the thus-gone ones is not an object of reference and cannot be labeled.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: stobs zhes bya ba ni brdzi ba med pa'i @120b chos can yin no //
analyzed: stobs zhes bya ba ni brdzi ba med pa'i @120b chos can yin no //
translated: power is a quality that cannot be crushed.

original: 'di ni chos kyi sgo bla na med pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi sgo bla na med pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sgo yin te /
translated: This is the unsurpassed Dharma gateway and the thus-gone ones’ Dharma gateway.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo de la gnas nas chos kyi tshul 'di rjod par byed cing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo de la gnas nas chos kyi tshul 'di rjod par byed cing /
translated: Abiding in this gateway to omniscience, they teach this way of the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad stobs bskyed pa med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad stobs bskyed pa med pa /
translated: All phenomena are devoid of the power of generation.

original: yang dag par 'phags pa med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i chos kyi tshul 'di dpag tu med cing mtha' yas par ston pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par 'phags pa med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i chos kyi tshul 'di dpag tu med cing mtha' yas par ston pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: “Anantavyūha, this Dharma way, which is beyond the utterly pure, which is devoid of essence, and which is free from essence, is taught to be immeasurable and limitless, and thus the ten powers of the thus-gone ones are perfected.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni stobs mtha' yas pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni stobs mtha' yas pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: the Thus-Gone One possesses infinite powers

original: chos kyi sgo mtha' yas pa la mkhas pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo mtha' yas pa la mkhas pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: and has attained expertise in infinite Dharma gateways.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sgo mtha' yas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sgo mtha' yas pa yin te /
translated: this is the thus-gone ones’ infinite Dharma gateway.

original: chos kyi sgo de la gnas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yang brjod par mdzad /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo de la gnas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yang brjod par mdzad /
translated: Abiding in this Dharma gateway, the Thus-Gone One has also described the ten powers of the thus-gone ones

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su dag pa yang ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su dag pa yang ston par mdzad do //
translated: and revealed the purity and perfection of the thus-gone ones’ powers.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgo rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgo rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to purify the gateways of the bodhisattvas,

original: gzungs kyi sgo'i phyag rgya ston pa'i chos brjod par byas pa nyon cig /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo'i phyag rgya ston pa'i chos brjod par byas pa nyon cig /
translated: Listen to the Dharma that teaches the seal of the dhāraṇī gateway.

analyzed: pra mo tsa ne bri pra mun tsa ti /
translated: Pramocanebri pramunacati

translated: Svasani

original: pa ri sva sha ni /
analyzed: pa ri sva sha ni /
translated: Parisvasani

original: mah'a p'a k'a she /
analyzed: mah'a p'a k'a she /
translated: Mahapakasa

original: a'a k'a sh'a sa mo sa ra ni /
analyzed: a'a k'a sh'a sa mo sa ra ni /
translated: Akashasamosaranini

original: bi ti ma ri ka ra ni /
analyzed: bi ti ma ri ka ra ni /
translated: Vitimarakaranini

original: sarba dzny'a pa th'a bi sho dha ni /
analyzed: sarba dzny'a pa th'a bi sho dha ni /
translated: Sarvajnapthatavishodhani

original: ni ra b'a na pa th'a sa na dha ri sha ni /
analyzed: ni ra b'a na pa th'a sa na dha ri sha ni /
translated: Nirvanapathasandharishani

original: bkod pa mtha' yas; 'di ni bstan pa gang du chos thams cad yang dag par 'du par 'gyur ba'i gzungs kyi sgo'i phyag rgya bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas; 'di ni bstan pa gang du chos thams cad yang dag par 'du par 'gyur ba'i gzungs kyi sgo'i phyag rgya bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Anantavyuha, this is the teaching of the seal of the dharani gateway, where all the teachings are gathered.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyuha,

original: chos rim par phye ba'i sgo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni thos pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos rim par phye ba'i sgo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni thos pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur /
translated: the bodhisattva who trains in this section of the Dharma will follow what he has heard.

original: blo'i rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang kun shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: blo'i rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang kun shes par 'gyur /
translated: He will understand the perfect eloquence of the skill in discerning the different levels of intelligence.

original: gzungs kyi tshig mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzhi yang kun shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi tshig mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzhi yang kun shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also understand the basis for accomplishing the dhāraṇī mantra.

original: tshig mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzhi yang gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzhi yang gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis for accomplishing the words?

original: s'a ga ra /
analyzed: s'a ga ra /
translated: Sāgara

original: a'a pa rya na ta /
analyzed: a'a pa rya na ta /
translated: āparāntaka

original: su me ru ratna /
analyzed: su me ru ratna /
translated: sumeru ratna

original: s'a ga ra na san ni tsa ye /🔽aa bhi ta ni /
analyzed: s'a ga ra na san ni tsa ye / aa bhi ta ni /
translated: sāgarasaṃnicaya🔽abhitāni

original: aa sam bh'i ta ni /
analyzed: aa sam bh'i ta ni /
translated: asamāhitāni

original: aa bi ba re /
analyzed: aa bi ba re /
translated: avabare

original: badzra san ni /
analyzed: badzra san ni /
translated: vajrasaṃni

original: nir be sha ni /
analyzed: nir be sha ni /
translated: nirbheṣaṇi🔽akṣobhini asakṣobhini

original: aaksho bhi ni aa sang ksho bhi ni /🔽aaksha ya / aa bya yi ksha ya pa ryan te /
analyzed: aaksho bhi ni aa sang ksho bhi ni / aaksha ya / aa bya yi ksha ya pa ryan te /
translated: akṣaya🔽avyayikṣayaparyante

original: aaksh'i na / ksha y'a na ta san dri she /
analyzed: aaksh'i na / ksha y'a na ta san dri she /
translated: akṣīṇe kṣāntasandṛśe

original: aa @121b pa ri ksha ye /
analyzed: aa @121b pa ri ksha ye /
translated: aparikṣaye

original: aa bhi kshu bha ni aa bhi ga le /🔽aa bhi ga la dzny'a na ha ra ni /
analyzed: aa bhi kshu bha ni aa bhi ga le / aa bhi ga la dzny'a na ha ra ni /
translated: abhikṣubhani abhikṣale🔽abhikṣalajñānaharani

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Vairocana,

original: 'di ni tshig mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzhi yin te /
translated: this is the basis for accomplishing the words.

original: 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi rgya mtsho lta bu mi 'khrugs pa 'phel bar 'gyur zhing rnam par lta ba chen pos lta bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi rgya mtsho lta bu mi 'khrugs pa 'phel bar 'gyur zhing rnam par lta ba chen pos lta bar yang 'gyur /
translated: The bodhisattva who trains in this way will increase the ocean-like, unshakable wisdom and will also see with great vision.

original: ji ltar lta bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lta bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How will he see?

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la byams pa mtha' yas pas khyab par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la byams pa mtha' yas pas khyab par byas nas /
translated: “I will pervade all sentient beings with infinite love

original: sems can rnams dbugs dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams dbugs dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: and comfort sentient beings.

original: bdag gis khyed la sman chen por rab tu sbyar zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis khyed la sman chen por rab tu sbyar zhing /
translated: I will apply the great medicine to you

original: des ma rig pa'i mun pa'i rab rib bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ma rig pa'i mun pa'i rab rib bsal bar bya'o //
translated: and thereby remove the cataracts of the darkness of ignorance.

original: bdag gis khyed thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor pa na sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / mya ngan gyi zug rngu bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis khyed thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor pa na sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / mya ngan gyi zug rngu bsal bar bya'o //
translated: I will remove the suffering, unhappiness, and anguish of you who are in beginningless and endless cyclic existence.

original: bdag gis khyed sred pa'i bcing ba las dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis khyed sred pa'i bcing ba las dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: I will liberate you from the bonds of craving.

original: bdag gis khyed 'khor ba'i mun pa las bsgral zhing chos kyi snang ba chen po bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis khyed 'khor ba'i mun pa las bsgral zhing chos kyi snang ba chen po bya'o //
translated: I will liberate you from the darkness of cyclic existence and create the great light of the Dharma.”

original: sems can gang dag mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyar ba de dag kyang gdon mi za bar drang bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyar ba de dag kyang gdon mi za bar drang bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: I will certainly lead those sentient beings who are engaged in unwholesome actions.

original: skyes bu dam pa deng dpon gyi mchog de dag ni ci nas kyang sems can 'ga' yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bla na med pa 'di las nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rnam par lta ba chen pos lta bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa deng dpon gyi mchog de dag ni ci nas kyang sems can 'ga' yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bla na med pa 'di las nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rnam par lta ba chen pos lta bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those sublime beings, those supreme leaders, will look with great vision so that no sentient being will fail in this unsurpassed, transcendent wisdom of omniscience.

original: nges par 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will lead them to liberation.

original: de ltar de dag sems can rnams la byams pas khyab par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar de dag sems can rnams la byams pas khyab par byed cing /
translated: In this way, they will pervade sentient beings with love.

original: chos kyi sgo @122a *//🔽don dang ldan pa sngon ma thob pa ldog pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang snang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo @122a *// don dang ldan pa sngon ma thob pa ldog pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang snang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They will illuminate the Dharma gateways

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: that have not been previously attained, that are meaningful, that are free from attachment, and that are endowed with the knowledge of non-arising.🔽“Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam byed par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam byed par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattvas wish to engage in a Dharma discussion,

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: what should they do?

original: gzungs dang gsang sngags mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshig 'di dag mngon du byas la chos kyi tshul la mkhas pa mi bcab pa'i yid la byed pas seng ge'i khri la 'dug ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang gsang sngags mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshig 'di dag mngon du byas la chos kyi tshul la mkhas pa mi bcab pa'i yid la byed pas seng ge'i khri la 'dug ste /
translated: Having actualized these dhāraṇī-mantra words, one should sit on a lion throne with a mind that is not secretive about being skilled in the way of the Dharma.

original: blo mtha' yas pas de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed cing thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa chen po'i yangs pas chos kyi tshul shin tu rnam par nges pa rab tu bstan zhing /
analyzed: blo mtha' yas pas de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed cing thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa chen po'i yangs pas chos kyi tshul shin tu rnam par nges pa rab tu bstan zhing /
translated: With an infinite mind, one should contemplate the Tathāgata and, with the vast power of skill in means and the power of great wisdom, teach the Dharma way that is very certain.

original: dran pa la mkhas pa'i sa rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa la mkhas pa'i sa rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to purify the level of skill in mindfulness,

original: sems can gang dag chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam la 'dus par gyur pa de dag la snying rje chen po yang bskyed /
analyzed: sems can gang dag chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam la 'dus par gyur pa de dag la snying rje chen po yang bskyed /
translated: one should generate great compassion for those sentient beings who have gathered for the Dharma discussion.

original: byams pa chen po yang bskyed nas sems dang ye shes la mkhas pa chen pos sems can rnams kyi bsam pa mngon par bsgrub pa rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa chen po yang bskyed nas sems dang ye shes la mkhas pa chen pos sems can rnams kyi bsam pa mngon par bsgrub pa rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Having generated great love, one should realize the accomplishment of the intentions of sentient beings with great skill in mind and wisdom.

original: chos kyi tshul shin tu rnam par nges pa rab tu bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin lhag chad med cing ngag gi las gsal la tshig dang yi ge legs par brjod pa dang / ngag gi las legs par gtan la dbab pas chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam tshad med pa bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul shin tu rnam par nges pa rab tu bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin lhag chad med cing ngag gi las gsal la tshig dang yi ge legs par brjod pa dang / ngag gi las legs par gtan la dbab pas chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam tshad med pa bya'o //
translated: You should give limitless Dharma teachings, without adding or omitting anything, with clear speech and well-formed words and syllables, and with speech that is well-founded, in accordance with the teaching of the way of the Dharma that is completely ascertained.

original: chos kyi 'bel @122b ba'i gtam des bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos kyi 'bel @122b ba'i gtam des bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: By those Dharma teachings, your own roots of virtue will increase,

original: sems can rnams kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang sdud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang sdud par 'gyur te /
translated: and you will gather the inconceivable Dharma of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas dpe du ma dang / nye bar dgod pa du mas chos yang dag par bsdu ba 'di dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i chos rim par phye ba 'di brjod cing ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas dpe du ma dang / nye bar dgod pa du mas chos yang dag par bsdu ba 'di dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i chos rim par phye ba 'di brjod cing ston par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata has taught and explained this Dharma summary and this section of the dhāraṇī gate with many parables and many illustrations.

original: de lta bas na khyod kyis chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam bla na med pa yang gyis shig /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyod kyis chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam bla na med pa yang gyis shig /
translated: Therefore, you should also give the highest Dharma teachings.

original: khyed kyis sems can rnams la yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas nye bar gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed kyis sems can rnams la yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas nye bar gnas par gyis shig /
translated: You should also be present for the activities of the buddhas for the sake of sentient beings.

original: myur du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa yang yongs su rdzogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: myur du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa yang yongs su rdzogs par gyis shig /
translated: Quickly perfect the fearlessness of the thus-gone ones.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi las chen pos mngon par shes pas bsgrub pa'i las la slob pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi las chen pos mngon par shes pas bsgrub pa'i las la slob pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: bodhisattvas who train in the activities that are accomplished through the higher perceptions with great wisdom will acquire the great accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la mngon par shes bsgrub pa'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes bsgrub pa'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What are the activities that are accomplished through the higher perceptions?

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: Anantavyūha,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la gnas shing /
translated: in this regard, bodhisattvas who are established in the bases of miraculous power

original: yang dag pa'i 'gro ba shin tu rnam par phye ba chen po nam mkha' ltar rten med pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pas sgrab pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'gro ba shin tu rnam par phye ba chen po nam mkha' ltar rten med pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pas sgrab pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: will, with the wisdom that is free from accomplishment, perceive the great, utterly refined movement of the mind, which is like space and without support.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang yang ldan pa shes rab dang ye shes la mkhas pa'i stobs mtha' yas pas chos thams cad shes pa la mkhas pa'i rnam par nges pa thob kyang @123a *//🔽chos cung zad kyang thob pa yang med /🔽dmigs pa yang med do //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi dmigs pa la gnas pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa la gnas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa chos gang gis kyang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang yang ldan pa shes rab dang ye shes la mkhas pa'i stobs mtha' yas pas chos thams cad shes pa la mkhas pa'i rnam par nges pa thob kyang @123a *// chos cung zad kyang thob pa yang med / dmigs pa yang med do // de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi dmigs pa la gnas pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa la gnas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa chos gang gis kyang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: He has attained the power of the wisdom of the Tathāgatas, and the power of skill in wisdom and insight. He has attained the certainty of skill in knowing all dharmas, and yet he has not attained even the slightest dharma.🔽He has no reference point.🔽The Tathāgata abides in the absence of reference points and in equality with what is unequal, and yet the Tathāgata does not abide in any dharma at all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dgon pa la gnas pa dang / tshogs pa med pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i ye shes mthong ba la gnas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mkhyen pa'am /🔽mi gzigs pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dgon pa la gnas pa dang / tshogs pa med pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i ye shes mthong ba la gnas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mkhyen pa'am /🔽mi gzigs pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' ste /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rang 'byung gi ye shes mthong ba mtha' yas pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rang 'byung gi ye shes mthong ba mtha' yas pa la gnas shing /
translated: The Thus-Gone One abides in the vision of infinite self-arisen wisdom.

original: phyin ci log gi mun pa dang bral bas sgrib pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mun pa dang bral bas sgrib pa med pa yin no //
translated: He is free from the darkness of error and is therefore free from obscurations.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Therefore, the Thus-Gone One has fully awakened to the equality of all phenomena.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / ming med pa dang / 'du shes med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / ming med pa dang / 'du shes med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: He has revealed their illusory nature, their dream-like nature, their echo-like nature, their absence of names, and their absence of concepts.

original: de bas na khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bslab par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should follow the Thus-Gone One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni ye shes thogs pa med pa ston cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni ye shes thogs pa med pa ston cing /
translated: The Thus-Gone One reveals unobstructed wisdom.

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen ba la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen ba la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in knowing the superior and inferior faculties of beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni ye shes thogs pa med pa ston cing shes pa thams cad la mkhas pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa yin pas byang chub sems dpa' 'di @123b dag la mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa'i las brdzi ba med cing mi mnyam🔽pa dang mnyam pa yang ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni ye shes thogs pa med pa ston cing shes pa thams cad la mkhas pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa yin pas byang chub sems dpa' 'di @123b dag la mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa'i las brdzi ba med cing mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yang ston pa mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the unobstructed wisdom of these bodhisattvas and shows them how to master all knowledge. He teaches them the activities of accomplishing superknowledge, which are unhindered and equal to the unequaled.

original: mngon par shes bsgrub ba'i las des byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa'i sgo'i rdzu 'phrul yang sgrub par byed /
analyzed: mngon par shes bsgrub ba'i las des byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa'i sgo'i rdzu 'phrul yang sgrub par byed /
translated: Through these activities of accomplishing superknowledge, bodhisattvas accomplish the miracles that are the gateway to superknowledge.

original: bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyang sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyang sgrub par byed cing /
translated: They also accomplish the power of the blessings of truth.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /🔽ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /
translated: They abide in the power of the generation of pure discipline.🔽They abide in the power of the generation of pure absorption, insight, and wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /
translated: They abide in the power of the generation of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: gtong ba rnam par dag pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /
analyzed: gtong ba rnam par dag pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas /
translated: They will also abide in the power of pure giving.

original: chos shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas so //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa la yang gnas so //
translated: They will also abide in the power of the knowledge of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stobs bskyed pa 'di la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stobs bskyed pa 'di la gnas nas /
translated: “Bodhisattvas who abide in this power

original: bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs bskyed pa yang 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs bskyed pa yang 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: will attain the power of the blessing of truth.

original: des kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang bsgyur bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: des kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang bsgyur bar yang 'gyur /
translated: They will also master the body up to the world of Brahmā.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba du ma yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba du ma yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: They will experience many miraculous activities.

original: chos kyi rnga rnam pa du ma yang brdung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi rnga rnam pa du ma yang brdung bar 'gyur /
translated: They will beat the many kinds of Dharma drums.

original: seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas 'khor rnams kyang chos kyis tshim par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas 'khor rnams kyang chos kyis tshim par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Seated on the lion throne, they will satisfy the assembly with the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la yang phan par nye bar bsgrub pas gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang phan par nye bar bsgrub pas gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will abide in benefiting all beings.”

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Vairocana,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: dper na / ri'i rgyal po khor yug chen po ni sems can rnams kyis dmyal ba pa'i dri nga ba'i mi mthun pa'i @124a *//
analyzed: dper na / ri'i rgyal po khor yug chen po ni sems can rnams kyis dmyal ba pa'i dri nga ba'i mi mthun pa'i @124a *//
translated: For example, the king of mountains, the great Cakravāḍa, is not shaken by the foul-smelling, disagreeable beings of the hells.🔽

original: tshor ba dang / dmyal ba pa'i sgra thos pa dang / dmyal ba pa mthong na mi rung bas sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pas 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khor yug tu bskor nas 'dug go /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / dmyal ba pa'i sgra thos pa dang / dmyal ba pa mthong na mi rung bas sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pas 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khor yug tu bskor nas 'dug go /
translated: For example, the great king of mountains, the encircling outer rim, is situated in this world realm, encircled by the karma of sentient beings, so that sentient beings do not experience the unpleasant sensations of the smells of the hells, do not hear the sounds of the hells, and do not see the hells.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas kyang sems can thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas kyang sems can thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas should make the Dharma free of obscurations for all sentient beings,

original: sems can rnams chos thams cad zag pa med pa la gzud par yang bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams chos thams cad zag pa med pa la gzud par yang bya'o //
translated: and should cause sentient beings to enter into all dharmas that are without outflows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig chos bstan pa 'di la shes rab kyi stobs rdo rje lta bu thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin pas slob pa ni; chos zab mos nges par 'byung zhing mi dmigs par gnas la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig chos bstan pa 'di la shes rab kyi stobs rdo rje lta bu thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin pas slob pa ni; chos zab mos nges par 'byung zhing mi dmigs par gnas la /
translated: “Bodhisattvas who train in this Dharma teaching, with the vajra-like power of wisdom, and who are supported by skillful means, will attain emancipation through the profound Dharma and abide in the absence of observation.

original: bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also receive the consecration of nectar.

original: ji ltar bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How will they receive the consecration of nectar?

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyis yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyis yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will not be overwhelmed by the demon of afflictions.

original: phung po'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi dbang du yang nye bar mi gnas la /
analyzed: phung po'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi dbang du yang nye bar mi gnas la /
translated: They will not come under the power of the demon of the aggregates, the demon of the son of the gods, or the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: 'chi 'pho'i 'du shes kyang mi 'jug go /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho'i 'du shes kyang mi 'jug go /
translated: The notion of death will not occur to them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu dam pa de dag ni stong pa nyid kyis gnas shing /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa de dag ni stong pa nyid kyis gnas shing /
translated: Those holy beings abide in emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa legs par yid la byed pas gang du yang smon par mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa legs par yid la byed pas gang du yang smon par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make any wishes at all, since they are attentive to the absence of marks.

original: de ltar na chos 'ga' yang skye ba yang med /
analyzed: de ltar na chos 'ga' yang skye ba yang med /
translated: In that way, no phenomena arise,

original: 'chi 'pho ba yang med /🔽'ong ba yang med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba yang med / 'ong ba yang med /
translated: die, come,

original: 'gro ba yang med /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang med /
translated: There is no going.🔽

original: gnas pa yang med /
analyzed: gnas pa yang med /
translated: or abide.🔽They are not afflicted

original: kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi @124b 'gyur /🔽rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi @124b 'gyur / rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: or purified.

original: stobs dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: They are not powerful

original: nyams par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not fall into error.🔽Since all phenomena are non-apprehensible, they do not falsely project even the slightest phenomenon.

original: chos thams cad ni mi dmigs pa yin pas chos cung zad kyang rlom par mi byed cing rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal dang / snyems pa spangs nas dman pa'i sems kyis nang yang dag par shes par bya ba la rmongs pa med cing phyi yang dag par shes par bya ba la legs par yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mi dmigs pa yin pas chos cung zad kyang rlom par mi byed cing rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal dang / snyems pa spangs nas dman pa'i sems kyis nang yang dag par shes par bya ba la rmongs pa med cing phyi yang dag par shes par bya ba la legs par yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: Having abandoned conceit, pride, and arrogance, with a humble mind they are not confused about what is to be understood internally and they have thorough knowledge of what is to be understood externally.

original: de dag ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos rnams kyis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos rnams kyis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They are not carried away by phenomena that are seen, heard, distinguished, or cognized.

original: skyes bu dam pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid /🔽phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid / phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid /
translated: Those holy beings abide in the suchness that the Tathāgatas have taught, saying, “All phenomena are like space.”🔽They abide in the non-erroneous suchness,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: in the suchness that is not otherwise.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ entry into the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang dag 'di lta bu la gnas pa de dag ni shes rab mtha' yas pa mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang dag 'di lta bu la gnas pa de dag ni shes rab mtha' yas pa mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those who abide in this way will accomplish infinite wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi stobs des kyang ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs des kyang ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: And through the power of wisdom, they will also understand the teaching of inconceivable wisdom.

original: dgongs pa bshad pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro; ;de dag gis ni chos thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgongs pa bshad pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro; ;de dag gis ni chos thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
translated: They will also engage in the explanation of the intention. They will understand all phenomena.

original: byang chub dang mtshams med pa yang mnyam par rtogs la /
analyzed: byang chub dang mtshams med pa yang mnyam par rtogs la /
translated: They will realize that awakening and the heinous actions are the same.

original: byang chub kyang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag gis ni mtshams @125a *//🔽med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas byang chub bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshams med pa rnam par mi rtog pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro // de dag gis ni mtshams @125a *// med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas byang chub bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshams med pa rnam par mi rtog pas /
translated: They will also realize awakening.🔽They will understand that awakening is inconceivable due to the inconceivability of the heinous actions,

original: byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that awakening is nonconceptual due to the nonconceptuality of the heinous actions.

original: de dag gis byang chub dang mtshams med pa gnyi ga dmigs su med par shes pas mtshams med pa dang mi mthun par yang mi byed /
analyzed: de dag gis byang chub dang mtshams med pa gnyi ga dmigs su med par shes pas mtshams med pa dang mi mthun par yang mi byed /
translated: Since they know that both awakening and the acts with immediate result are unobservable, they do not make the acts with immediate result incompatible with awakening.

original: byang chub dang mthun pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub dang mthun pa yang mi byed de /
translated: They do not make awakening compatible with the acts with immediate result.

original: mtshams med pa yang mi byed /
analyzed: mtshams med pa yang mi byed /
translated: They do not commit the acts with immediate result.🔽They do not destroy awakening.

original: mi 'jig / byang chub kyang mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / byang chub kyang mi byed /
translated: They do not create awakening.

original: mi 'jig go /
analyzed: mi 'jig go /
translated: They do not destroy it.

original: gang dag don gyi rnam grangs bstan pa 'di la yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de dag ni las dang rnam par smin pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag don gyi rnam grangs bstan pa 'di la yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de dag ni las dang rnam par smin pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur /
translated: Those who have trained in this presentation of the topics will not cling to karma and its ripening.

original: rlom par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlom par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be arrogant.

original: de dag gi las dang rnam par smin pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du shes te /
analyzed: de dag gi las dang rnam par smin pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du shes te /
translated: They will know that karma and its ripening do not exist and are the same.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa ni mnyam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa ni mnyam pa yin gyi /
translated: Karma and its ripening are the same.

original: mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not different.

original: de dag ni las dang rnam par smin par mi dmigs /
analyzed: de dag ni las dang rnam par smin par mi dmigs /
translated: They do not observe karma and its ripening.

original: mi rlom / mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi rlom / mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: They are not arrogant. They do not cling to them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de dag gi las kyi sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i rgyu kun nas mi ldang bar bsrabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de dag gi las kyi sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i rgyu kun nas mi ldang bar bsrabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the causes of the obscurations of karma and the obscurations of affliction are reduced and do not arise.

original: de dag chos thams cad kyi sgo bstan pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i chos rim par phye ba 'di la snang ba thob par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos thams cad kyi sgo bstan pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo'i chos rim par phye ba 'di la snang ba thob par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain illumination with regard to this revealed Dharma door and section of the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: de dag chos kyi sgo rnam par dag pa 'di phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su spyod cing /
analyzed: de dag chos kyi sgo rnam par dag pa 'di phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su spyod cing /
translated: They will practice this pure Dharma door in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: spyod pa rnam par dag pa yang rjes su thob @125b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par dag pa yang rjes su thob @125b par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain pure conduct.

original: de dag 'jig rten gyi chos rnams gyis khengs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten gyi chos rnams gyis khengs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not be puffed up by worldly dharmas.

original: yid shi bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid shi bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: They will not be disheartened.

original: bsod nams kyi zhing yon gnas su 'gyur bar spyod cing /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing yon gnas su 'gyur bar spyod cing /
translated: They will practice as a field of merit and a worthy recipient of offerings.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mngon du bgrod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mngon du bgrod par bya ba yin no //
translated: They will be revered by the world and its gods.

original: bkod pa mtha' yas /
analyzed: bkod pa mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantavyūha,

original: nga ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu la yang yon gnas dpag tu med cing tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: nga ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu la yang yon gnas dpag tu med cing tshad med pa yin no //
translated: I am an immeasurable and limitless object of offering even to a son of the lineage who is on the eighth level.🔽

original: zhes smra na /
analyzed: zhes smra na /
translated: I say that even a son of the lineage who is on the eighth ground is an immeasurable and limitless object of offering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'di lta bu la gnas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'di lta bu la gnas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much more so is a bodhisattva great being who is established in such dharmas!

original: gang dag byang chub dang / sems can dang / chos dang / snang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mi dmigs /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub dang / sems can dang / chos dang / snang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mi dmigs /
translated: Those who do not apprehend awakening, sentient beings, dharmas, appearances, or worldly dharmas,

original: mi rlom / spros par mi byed cing /
analyzed: mi rlom / spros par mi byed cing /
translated: who do not think about them, and who do not conceptualize them,

original: chos bstan pa 'di kun shes la /
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di kun shes la /
translated: who understand this teaching of the Dharma,

original: chos ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub pa la gnas pa de dag ni yon yongs su sbyong ba bla na med pa yin pas //
analyzed: chos ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub pa la gnas pa de dag ni yon yongs su sbyong ba bla na med pa yin pas //
translated: and who are established in the practice of the Dharma just as it is—they are unsurpassed objects of offering.
